intents.name: Signalling All
intents.question:
***Signalling System Operation App*** 


      General Signal Principles 

                        or 

      Select a Signalling System?

intents.name: Signalling All A1b
intents.question:
Select a signalling system: 





      Are you working with legacy Conventional Signalling?

intents.name: RRI All
intents.question: Are you working with Relay Interlocking?

intents.name: CBTC All
intents.question: Are you working with CBTC?

intents.name: tbtc All
intents.question: Are you working with TBTC?

intents.name: NES Depot All1a
intents.question: Are you working at Neasden Depot?

intents.name: NES Depot All1b
intents.question:
For Neasden depot there is PMI axle counter system used. 
       What is the initial status check of the PMI system. 


       Do you have any error indication, fault alarms, track sections showing disturbed?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c
intents.question:
When a track section shows disturbed on SER display GUI or shunters cabin display GUI, 
       Escalation is required, view escalation? or see how incident is raised via APCC?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A2
intents.question:
T.O. inform DSIM that a reset is required. 
      Has DSIM started the process of escalating PMI axle counter fault?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A3
intents.question: Is DSIM following procedure ND1 S2530 Irregular Adjustment PMI type asset ND1?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A4
intents.question:
To undertake an Axle Counter reset 
      Is DSIM aware they will need to use a reset key and push button, 

      but first has the T.O. first walked the track section and confirm its clear?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A5
intents.question:
Since the T.O. has walked the track section and confirm its clear, 
      AWC authorisation can begin for the Axle Counter reset, 
      or would like to continue view the escalation process?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A6
intents.question:
Has the DSIM/SIM given authorisation and issue AWC 
      to another DSIM/SIM to use the reset key and push the button?

intents.name: NES Depot All1c A7
intents.question:
Has DSIM/SIM given authorization for ND1 S2530, 
      and issued AWC to the T.O. to once again visually inspect that the track section is clear?

intents.name: NES Depot All1d
intents.question:
If T.O. cannot confirmed that the track section is clear 
      then the reset key and push button must not be used. 



       Would you like to view the standard escalation procedure?

intents.name: NES Depot All1e
intents.question: Has Axle Counter Reset been successfully completed?

intents.name: Chesham All1a
intents.question: Are you working on the Chesham Shuttle?

intents.name: Chesham All1b
intents.question:
For Chesham Shuttle there is Axle Counter section. 
       What is the initial status check of the axle counter section. 


       Do you have any error indication, fault alarms, track sections showing disturbed?

intents.name: Chesham All1c
intents.question:
When a axle counter section shows disturbed, a reset can be done but escalation is required. 

      CH1 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Axle Counter type asset CH1. 
       To undertake an Axle Counter reset 
      The Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager must authorize 
      and issue AWC to DSIM/SIM to reset the axle counter,
      and awc for T.O. to visually inspect axle counter section is clear. 
      


    Has EOCR duty signal manager given authorization for CH1 S2530?

intents.name: Chesham All1d
intents.question:
If T.O. cannot confirmed that the track section is clear 
      then the reset must not be used. 
      


      Would you like to view the standard escalation procedure?

intents.name: Chesham All1e
intents.question: Has Axle Counter Reset been successfully completed?

intents.name: VicLine All
intents.question: Are you working with Victoria Line signalling?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All1a
intents.question:
For Victoria Line signalling, 
      initial status check of signalling system. 


       Do you have any error indication or fault alarms showing?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All1b
intents.question: Does the issue involve the Diverse Monitor Controller PC?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All1c
intents.question:
Following a confirmed Right Side Track Circuit Failure, 
    the Diverse Monitor Controller (DMC) computer has applied an inhibit. 



       Has the DMC computer applied an inhibit that requires a reset?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All1d
intents.question:
The Signalling Systems Manager (SSM) located at Osborne House, 
    can remotely reset the the Diverse Monitor Controller (DMC), 
      following a confirmed Right Side Track Circuit Failure 
      and the DMC has applied an inhibit. 



       To do this escalation is required, VL1 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset VL1 



      Has the DSIM given authorised for VL1 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to Osborne House SSM?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All1e
intents.question:
If it cannot be confirmed that the inhibit has been raised due to a Right Side Track Circuit Failure, 
      then this process must not be used and the issue must be escalated to the 
      on call Duty Signal Manager and then onto the on call Duty Senior Signal Engineer. 

          Has the DMC reset been applied as set out in the procedure for right side failures?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All2a
intents.question: Does the issue involve 'Walthamstow Central' point systems with a Supplementary Detector bypass feature?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All2b
intents.question:
There is a provision to get temporary point functionality, 
      when failure of an individual supplementary detector has been identified. 
       These points (located at Walthamstow Central only) has a Supplementary Detector bypass feature 

      To action this the T.O. will have to unlock and switch bypasses MCB for relevant supplementary detector,
      This is an irregular adjustment so escalation is required, VL2 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset VL2 



      Has the DSIM given authorised for VL2 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to Technical Officer?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All2c
intents.question:
Must comply with Management Work Instruction W12054 sections 3, 4, 5. 
       Walthamstow Central Supplementary Detector Bypass Procedure. 
       TO on site to visually inspect the points system for obstructions,
      mechanical integrity, flangeback wear and correct movement. 
       If there is doubt as to whether this procedure should be applied the Duty Signal Incident Manager (DSIM) 
      shall escalate the matter to the Duty Signal Manager (DSM) 
      & Duty Senior Signal Engineer (DSSE) to determine the required action. 



       Would you like to view the standard escalation procedure?

intents.name: Vicline Failure All2d
intents.question: Has S2530 VL2 been implemented?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms1
intents.question:
***Legacy conventional signalling*** 

      Do you have an active incident that requires management?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms2 PR1abc
intents.question:
***Active incident*** 

      Legacy fault finding scenarios, 


      or would you like to view the standard escalation procedures instead?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms2
intents.question: Have you identified the area at fault?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3
intents.question: Is it a track sequencing alarm fault?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3b
intents.question: Is there a signal failure?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3bc
intents.question:
T.O. has been despatched, the incident requires managing beforehand. 


       Would you like to discuss incident managing first?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3bc2
intents.question: Has the signaller, exhausted all operational options (eg emergency release)?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3bc3
intents.question:
Recommend L18 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L18, 
      For signals that cannot be used: 
      Set up route to facilitate hand signalling. 
       Operate ground-lock and points by depressing valve armatures. 
       If its electric points use emergency crank handle 
      This is actioned by the T.O. after consulting DSIM. 


       Has the DSIM authorised and issued AWC to Technical Officer to action L18 S2530?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3bc4
intents.question:
Incident is managed until time allocated for failure investigation and repair. 
        

      Do you wish to investigate signal failure?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms3bb
intents.question:
To find failure you will need to recreate sequence of events leading to fault. 


       Would you like to recreate failure sequence scenario?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms4
intents.question:
Recommend L14 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L14, 
      maintenance release of a track sequencing circuit alarm 
      This L14 S2530 is to overcome a false track sequencing alarm, 
      and the releasing of sequencing alarm using Maintenance Organisation panel. 


       The DSIM authorised and issued AWC to Technical Officer to action L14 S2530. 



       Would you like to view the standard incident and escalation procedures?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Alarms5
intents.question:
Check documentation, tt must be identified why the alarm was generated, 
      so as not to bypass a genuine failure or sequencing issue. 
       Process to be undertaken in accordance with the approved local Procedure. 


        APCC/FRC receives notification of the fault, it is then logged into the asset data management system. 


       Has alarm been reset?

intents.name: Legacy ConSignal All
intents.question: Would you like to do a high level overview of conventional signalling with a train?

intents.name: Legacy ConSignal All_2b
intents.question: View site with Controlled Signal?

intents.name: Legacy Signal Auto
intents.question: View site with Auto Signal?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR A1
intents.question: What signalling is in the area, is it an auto signalling site?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR B1
intents.question:
***semi Automatic signalling*** 


      Train is approached next signal of a three home and starter automatic signals. 



       Is the signal displaying a green aspect?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR B2
intents.question: Are all tracks in the signal selection up?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR B3
intents.question:
This is a wrong side failure. 



       Have you reported the irregularity?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR B3
intents.question: Click 'yes' to view the alleged Signalling Irregularity procedure PR0702?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR B4
intents.question:
This will need to be investigated to confirm and escalated if found to be an irregularity. 



       Has DSIM been imformed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR c1
intents.question:
This circuit has TR/GR series, so the r-side of the TR is in series with the GR r-side. 


       Has the GR pick up?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR C2
intents.question:
The GR is Up, then the GR back contacts are broken, 
      but the signal red light has a alternate suppled via trainstop in the ON position. 


       The GR up contacts also feeds the trainstop valve (V), is V energised?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR C3
intents.question:
This is a signal failure. 
       A T.O. been to investigate. 



       Is there 100v going to the valve?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR C4
intents.question:
Recommend valve is replaced. 
       Has fault been fix?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR D1
intents.question: With the valve (V) energised, has the trainstop head moves to the OFF position?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR D2
intents.question:
With the trainstop head moves to the OFF position 

      the signal red light loses its alternate supply 

      Is the signal green light ON?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR D3
intents.question:
This is a signal failure. 
       A T.O. been to investigate. 



       Will a relamp fix the issue?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR E1
intents.question: Has a Train moved from berth track to the replacing track of the signal?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR E2
intents.question: Has the replacing track relay lost its r-side feed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR E3
intents.question:
Track failing to shunt, this can happen if there is too much current. 
       Check capacitance to track, a T.O. may of put for 33 1/3hz area 10uF, and 13uF for DSIMs, 
      for 125hz area could be up to 60uf, extra capacitance may have been parralleled in. 



       The T.O. has reduced the capaitance, has this fixed fault?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR E4
intents.question:
Track failing to shunt, this can happen if there is rusty rails, it is a wrongside failure. 


       T.O. onsite rails scrapped and relay operation observed. 



       Has this fixed the fault?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR E5
intents.question: Is the replacing track relay down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR F1
intents.question:
Since the train is on the tracks within L.O.C  (the signal selection) of the GR, 


      has the GR lost its q-side feed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR F2
intents.question: Is the GR down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR F3
intents.question:
Since the GR down, the GR up contacts are broken. 


       Is feed to green light removed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G1
intents.question: Is trainstop gone to the fully ON position?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G2
intents.question:
If the trainstop failed to go to the fully ON  position after the passage of a train, 
      The replacing track for that signal will remain down, 


      Does the replacing track relay have 100v on the q-side?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G3
intents.question:
The trainstop ON contact is providing an alternate feed in RE circuit to the red light. 



       Would you like to test the alternate red light circuit?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G4
intents.question:
To test this you need the GR up (GR condition met, ie all tracks up in L.O.C  )

      remove the  valve stem of trainstop 

      Do you have a dual aspect red and green?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G5
intents.question: Do have faulty trainstop?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G6
intents.question: Manual Lower trainstop head red light goes out?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR G7
intents.question: Test successful, continue procedure with train in the route?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR H1
intents.question:
Since the GR is down, the back contact 7b is also providing a feed to red light. 


       The signal will continue to show a red light until the train passes the overlap of the next signal. 



       Has the train passed the over lap of the next signal?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR H2
intents.question: process complete, would like to select a different signalling task?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR J1
intents.question:
***Controlled signalling*** 


      A train is on route. 
      . 
      . 



       Has the previous train completed the route?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K1
intents.question:
Next Train has arrived at sighting point. 


       Is the ALR up?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K2
intents.question:
The route is approach locked. 



       Is there a train already within the signals limit of control?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K3
intents.question:
The train must complete its route for ALR and UCLR to pick up. 


       Has train cleared the route?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K4
intents.question:
An emergency release is needed if a route was called 
       and cancelled with berth track down. 


       or when a ALR is down, or when UCLR is down. 


       Has the release fix issues (ie getting levers normalize)?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K6
intents.question: Has signaller called for an emergency release?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K7
intents.question:
Is it a signal failure? 


  Has APCC/FRC receives notification of the fault, 
       it is logged into the asset data management system?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K8
intents.question:
For the ALR up, the GR must be down (signal red), and berth track up. 



       Has the berth track up allowed ALR to pick and stick?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K9
intents.question: Has the train arrive at the berth track?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR K10
intents.question:
The ALR pick and stick means it should remain up with the berth track down, 
      but it needs GR down and trainstop ON. 


       Is ALR still Up?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR L1
intents.question:
To select a route points must be in line first before signal lever is selected. 


       Is signaller ready to select route?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M1
intents.question: Are points required to move?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M2
intents.question: Has the signaller reverse the points lever required for the route?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M3
intents.question: Has the points set locked and detected (N or R) )in the required position?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M4
intents.question: Do you have a points failure??

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M5
intents.question:
T.O. sent. 


       Is it a point indication issue?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M6
intents.question:
T.O. gets signaller to attempt to throw points 

      Has the points unlocked?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M7
intents.question: Has the points attempted to move?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M8
intents.question:
The points have moved. 
       Has the points locked?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR M9
intents.question: Is the points detected?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR N1
intents.question: Has the signaller reverse the required signal lever?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR N2
intents.question: Has the GR picked up?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR O1
intents.question: Is the trainstop down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR P1
intents.question: Is signal showing a green aspect?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR Q1
intents.question:
The route is now set. 


       The signal lever will be caught on the locked if the route is cancelled. 
       The train must takes the route. 



       Is the ALR down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR R1
intents.question: Has the train taken the route and is now on the replacing track?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR S1
intents.question:
The GR is Up, then the GR back contacts are broken, 
      but the signal red light has a alternate supplied 
       via trainstop in the ON position. 


       Is the trainstop valve energised?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR S2
intents.question:
With the trainstop valve energized, 
       has the trainstop head moves to the OFF position?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR S3
intents.question:
With the trainstop head moves to the OFF position 

      the signal red light loses its alternate supply. 


       Is the signal green light ON?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR T1
intents.question:
Has a Train moved from berth track of first signal 
       of a three home and starter automatic signals 
      to the replacing track of the first signal?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR T2
intents.question:
The train axles shunting rails of the replacing track. 


       Has the replacing track relay lost its r-side feed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR T3
intents.question: Is the replacing track relay down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR U1
intents.question:
Since the train is on the tracks within the signal selection of the GR, 
       has the GR lost its q-side feed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR U2
intents.question: Is the GR down?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR U3
intents.question:
Since the GR down, the GR up contacts are broken. 


       Is feed to green light removed?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR V1
intents.question: Is trainstop gone to the fully ON position?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR V2
intents.question:
If the trainstop failed to go to the fully ON position 
       after the passage of a train. 
      The replacing track for that signal will remain down, 


      Does the replacing track relay have 100v on the q-side?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR V3
intents.question:
The trainstop ON contact is providing an alternate feed 
       in the RE circuit to the red light. 



       Is the red light ON?

intents.name: Legacy1 Con Signal GR W1
intents.question:
The GR is down, the back contact 7b is also providing a feed to red light. 


       The signal will continue to show a red light until the train passes the overlap of the next signal. 



       Has the train passed the over lap of the next signal?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route1
intents.question:
Initial state is GR down, 
      Trainstop 'ON', 
      Signal Lever is normal, 
      Tracks in L.O.C - up, 
      points set locked and detected Normal or Reverse. 
         

      Is this correct?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route2
intents.question: Are points required to move?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route3
intents.question: Is route 2 required, points reverse?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route4
intents.question: Is route 1 required, points normal?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route5
intents.question:
Point lever has moved to, or is at, the desired position. 


       Is WKR up?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route6
intents.question: Move Signal lever reverse?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7
intents.question: Is GR up?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route8
intents.question: So a green aspect showing in signal?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route9
intents.question:
Is all ok at aspect level
      no dual aspect (red and green)?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure1
intents.question:
T.O. investigating incident found a fault inside the relay room, 
      or within Interlocking Machine Room (IMR) 
      or inside an Signalling Equipment Room (SER) or CER?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15b
intents.question: Has T.O. found an open circuit wire or cable inside the room?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15c
intents.question:
Recommend L15 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L15,
      Open circuit wire within a room (SER IMR, CER or relay room)
      The L15 S2530 is to replace wire to permit restoration of signalling. 

      Has authorisation come from the Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager
      and has the Duty Senior Signal Engineer authorised. 

      So have they issued AWC to a DSIM to action L15 S2530. 


      View Escalation process?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d1
intents.question:
When a failure occurs, which requires the replacement of wires or cable inside an equipment room, 
      The DSIM with AWC will action work onsite. 

      View Incident Escalation or AWC process?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d2
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      The level of verification required is determined by assessing the risk. 

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d3
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      They agreed with the Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager and Duty Senior Signal Engineer. 

      Is staff in agreement with EOCR DSM and DSSE?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d4
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      Before the installation of the replacement wire or cable,
      positive proof by undertaking a hand trace is required to ascertain that the wire 
      or cable being replaced is in fact the wire or cable shown in the site prints. 


       Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d5
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      Where it is NOT possible to undertake a hand trace of the wire or cable, 
      the equivalent must be achieved by the predetermined in a above, level of correlation to design records. 

      If required, has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d6
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      continuity and functional testing to verify as a minimum all prime safety controls are present. 

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d7
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      They verify the correct potential orientation 
      e.g. BX/NX selection proving. 

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d8
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      The agreed verification process as determined. 
      previously like verification shall be completed prior to the installation of the replacement wire or cable. 

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d9
intents.question:
Staff must ensure that:
      If controls other than the prime safety controls have not been confirmed 
      to be present in the affected circuit(s) then they shall be tested 
      and verified to be present during the next engineering hours shift. 

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15d10
intents.question: Is full site test complete and all working ok?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure1 Line15
intents.question:
Has T.O. investigating incident found either:

      A damage track side cable
      Or a open circuit in 10 core track crossing cable
      Or an open circuit  trackside 2-core lead covered cable?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure1b
intents.question: Is T.O. able fix problem?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure1b
intents.question:
Escalation required. 
       Has it been escalated by DSIM?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 1a
intents.question: Can a temporary repair of the trackside cable be done WITHOUT connecting an independent wire?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 1b
intents.question:
Recommend L9 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L9, 
      Replacement of 10 core cable, connecting an independent wire, secure, and connect in parallel. 

      This is the provision of temporary wire to permit restoration of signalling pending replacement of 10 core cable. 

          Hand trace, wire count, functional testing, site record correlation. 

      Has the Emergency On Call Roster Signal Manager authorised with AWC to DSIM to action L9 S2530?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 1c
intents.question: Is it trackside 2-core lead covered cable?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 1d
intents.question:
Recommend L11 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L11, 
      re-route broken NX path via lead cable sheath,
      or substitute NX conductor for broken BX and re-route NX path via lead cable sheath. 

      This is the provision of using a temporary cables/wire to allow restoration of signalling

      pending replacement of 2-core lead covered cable. 

          Hand trace, wire count, functional testing, site record correlation. 

      Has the Emergency On Call Roster Signal Manager authorised with AWC to DSIM to action L11 S2530?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 1e
intents.question:
Ensure DSIM with the AWC to do the work must ensure:

      Defective  open circuit core to be NX at both ends. 

          Testing to establish that all functions in the selected circuit are in the BX leg. 

          Permanent repair to be effected within 10 days. 
       Wire count, functional testing, hand trace, site record correlation. 


       Has this all been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Trackside Fail 2a
intents.question:
Recommend L10 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L10, temporary repair of affected cables

      This is the provision of temporary wire to permit restoration of signalling pending proper repair. 

          Hand trace, wire count, functional testing, site record correlation. 

      Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      and 'Duty Senior Signal Engineer' 
      agreed on who will authorised 
      and who the persons to action the L10 S2530 with full extend of hand trace, wire count, functional testing, site record correlation. 

          (providing wire is single core minimum 1. 
      5mm and low smoke) wire should be proven to site record. 
       Has AWC been issued?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure2
intents.question:
Recommend L6 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L6

      Special alterations to by-pass normal controls. 

      Used for major failure conditions, this includes for after derailment or run-through, or tracks failed to shunt. 

      Is the irregular adjustment to fit shorting loop across vital contact (relay, lever band, etc) going ahead?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure3
intents.question:
Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      and 'Duty Senior Signal Engineer' 
      agreed on who will authorised 
      and who the person to action the L6 S2530 irregular adjustment?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure4
intents.question:
Has the Duty Senior Signal Engineer inform the LUCC (London Underground Central Control) immediately,
    for the notification of the Lead Maintenance Assurance Engineer, 
      and notification of the  Head of Road and Rail Traffic Control Systems,
      of the circumstance and the damage?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure5
intents.question:
Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      and 'Duty Senior Signal Engineer', and other service departments,
      agreed and planned timescale for all damage equipment to be repaired, 
      and signal returned to full operational service?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route Failure6
intents.question: Has signal failure been fixed?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1at1
intents.question:
Is Trainstop functioning correctly, 
      ok in the 'OFF'(lowered) position?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1at2
intents.question:
This is a Trainstop failure - head can not lower to OFF position. 

      Can T.O. fix fault or is an Emergency Trainstop being installed?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1at3
intents.question:
Recommend L17 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L17

      Pegging down trainstop head and loop out failing trainstop proving contact. 

      Has EOCR Duty Signal Manager and DSSE authorise a DSIM to action L17 S2530?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1at4
intents.question:
Note that limited train move will be implemented, with point to point working (station to station working) 
      one train in the section. 


       Is L17 S2530 process complete and new trainstop to be installed in engineering hours?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1a
intents.question:
Is Trainstop functioning correctly, 
      and is in the fully 'ON'(up) position?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1b
intents.question: Is signalling functioning correctly??

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1c
intents.question:
T.O. has been sent out to investigate. 

      Is it a wire off?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1d
intents.question: Is it only ONE wire off

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1e
intents.question:
Recommend L7 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L7

      re-terminate one wire. 


       Has DSIM authorise a T.O. and second competent person (T.O. or above) to action L7 S2530?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1f
intents.question:
Recommend L8 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L8,

      re-terminate more than one wire off. 
       Hand trace, wire count, functional testing, site record correlation. 

      Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      and 'Duty Senior Signal Engineer' 
      agreed on who will authorised 
      and who the persons to action the L8 S2530 with full extend of wire count?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 F1g
intents.question:
Authorisation only if authorising person is satisfied that identification of host terminal is certain,
      and that it conforms to the design and site records, 
      hand trace required, but if hand trace can not de done
      a pre-determine level of correlation to design records is at least needed
      and include functional testing, wire count of that terminal on completion. 

          The re-terminated wire to be clearly labelled with the date
      and name of person effecting the repair. 

          A detailed check to be carried out in Engineering Hours by a actioning person,
      or other competent person to verify the correctness of the terminal identification and quality of the repair. 

      Has above been done and full site been tested?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2a
intents.question: Is it only the Trainstop detection box that is defective?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2aa
intents.question:
Is it a single defective contact on the detection box, 
 and will wiring an equivallent spare contact in be used?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2ab
intents.question:
Recommend L12 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L12
      Wire an equivalent spare contact in parallel
      Provision of use an alternative contact on the trainstop detection box to permit restoration of sgnalling. 

      Has the DSIM given authorised for this L12 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to T.O. ?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2ac
intents.question:
Recommend L13 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L13

      Replace defective trainstop detection box. 

      Provision of alternative trainstop detection box from lean stores to permit restoration of sgnalling. 

      Has the DSIM given authorised for this L13 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to T.O. ?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2ad
intents.question:
For contacts of trackside equipment,
      parallel connections to be made to the 10 core box directly attached to the equipment concerned. 
      
 Equipment to be changed during next Engineering Hours 
      or if during Night Tube at an agreed time with LU Operations 
      and parallel contact removed in accordance with site drawings. 

      Has the T.O. actioned the L12 S2530 worked,
      and the Trainstop has been checked gauged and tested?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2ae
intents.question:
1. 
       'On' and 'off' contacts to be verified (made and broken) with head fully on and fully off. 

          2. 
       J-type trainstops to be adjusted to gauge during the next Engineering Hours 
    or if during Night Tube at an agreed time with LU Operations
      3. 
       All other types of trainstops to be changed during next Engineering Hours. 

      Has the T.O. actioned the work L13 S2530 work,
      and the Trainstop been checked gauged and tested?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2b
intents.question: Can the trainstop be fix with quick adjustment of the contacts?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2c
intents.question:
Too prevent heavy impact on service a quick fix temporary solution is required. 

      Emergency trainstop will be use, do you have a 10 core cable for head proving?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2d
intents.question:
Temporary adjustment of trainstop indication rod, requires breaking of trainstop seal. 

      This is a 'L5' S2530 Irregular Adjustment for Legacy type asset, trainstop contact failing to make. 

      Has DSIM issued AWC to Technical Officer to do this?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2e
intents.question: Has the T.O. verified ON and OFF contact?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2f
intents.question:
If J-type trainstop, arrangement for adjustment to gauge by next engineering hours should be made. 


       All other trainstop types should be changed. 

      Is it a j-type trainstop?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure2g
intents.question: Has Trainstop been changed check and tested?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure3a
intents.question:
Recommend L4 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L4

      Emergency trainstop with head proving the temporary trainstop allows functionality prior to permanent repair. 

      Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      given authorised for this S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure3b
intents.question:
Recommend L3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L3

      Emergency trainstop without head proving fitted. 

      Provision of temporary trainstop functionality prior to permanent repair. 

      Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      given authorised for this S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure4
intents.question:
The AWC to DSIM is to loop out damage trainstop proving contact (pegging damage trainstop). 

      Is the DSIM onsite to supervise and issue AWC to T.O. for fitting Emergency Trainstop?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure5
intents.question:
T.O. has fitted emergency trainstop under DSIM onsite supervision. 

      Emergency trainstop should be checked for correct contact arrangements and positioning and operation. 

          note: must be located at or before signal replacing blockjoint/n        be no more than 2 metres before associated signal
      if unidirectional put emergency trainstop in sleeper bay, berfore or after the failing permanent trainstop depending if wrong road move. 

      Is the emergency trainstop without head proving checked hourly or at the authorised frequency?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route7 Failure6
intents.question:
Emergency Trainstop will need head proving to be verified as matching damage trainstop
      and ensure trainstop is changed checked guaged and tested in 24 hours, next engineering hours

      Has this been done?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route8
intents.question: Is train (up to Berth track) approaching signal?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route9
intents.question: Is train taken route Berth Track down and Replacement track down?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route10
intents.question: Has Train pass point locking tracks?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route11
intents.question: Has train completed route?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route12
intents.question: Has the Signal Lever Lock been released after train movement?

intents.name: Legacy Con Signal Route13
intents.question:
With the signal lever going back normal, route cancelling is complete. 
       Would you like to select another route?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail1
intents.question:
Signal lever lock not releasing after train movement. 

      Manually release route locking required 

      To ensure routes can be cancel and set. 


       Has trains confirmed clear of area and tracks up?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail2
intents.question: Has signaller requested an emergency release?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail3
intents.question: After 60 seconds did the release clear signals on the lock?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail4
intents.question:
Looks like equipment failure, 

      so the signal lock can not release after train passage. 

      T.O. has escalated to DSIM. 

      The DSIM has authorised S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset L1 - 

      T.O. actioned to Lift the Signal Lever lock. 
       Has AWC been issue to T.O. for S2530 lift the lock?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail5
intents.question: Before T.O. lifts lock, Are all trains stationary at platforms?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail6
intents.question: Before T.O. lifts lock, Are all track circuits clear (up)?

intents.name: Legacy Con Route Locking Fail7
intents.question: T.O. has lifted lock, has signal lever gone back (home) normal?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail1
intents.question:
Point failures can be loss of point indications, detection, locks or motor. 
       It can be electrical or a mechanical fault. 


       Can a T.O. fixed the point failure?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail2p1
intents.question: Have the points been secured and padlocked in the required position?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail2p2
intents.question: Has keys to padlock been retained by Signal Engineering for duration of any S2530 adjustment?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail2p3
intents.question:
Before any irregular wiring adjustment activity:

      Has a AWC been issued for the T.O. to do adjustment of the point detection rodding?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail2
intents.question:
Recommend S2530 Irregular Adjusted Legacy type asset L2

      - falsely maintain vital indication circuit. 


       Has The 'Emergency On Call Roster Duty Signal Manager' 
      given authorised for this S2530 Irregular Adjustment?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail3
intents.question: Will there be a mechanical adjustment?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail4
intents.question:
If its NOT a light detection issue, the DSIM should go to site to supervise. 


       Has DSIM issues T.O. with AWC for a mechanical adjustment?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail5
intents.question: Is an electrical circuit point indication S2530 L2 required?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail6
intents.question: Has the Emergency On Call Roaster Duty Signal manager issued DSIM with AWC?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail7
intents.question: DSIM go onsite to do electrical false feeding of detection relay?

intents.name: Legacy Con Point Lock Fail10
intents.question:
DSIM actioned and receives AWC for creating a provision to facilitate 
      a limited train movement over one lay of points,
      by falsely maintain vital indications circuit. 


       Produce method statement, drawings, temporary prints update, report AWC paperwork? 

      Has DSIM successfully completed L2 S2530 force feeding indication?

intents.name: CBTC All2a
intents.question: Would like to check the Axle Counters?

intents.name: CBTC All2b
intents.question: Would like to check the VCC?

intents.name: CBTC All2c
intents.question: Would like to check the Intersig?

intents.name: CBTC All2d
intents.question: Would like to check the points?

intents.name: CBTC All2e
intents.question: Would like to check the Emergency Stopping Device?

intents.name: CBTC All2f
intents.question: Are you working with the Data Communication Systems?

intents.name: CBTC All2g
intents.question:
The SMC is safest way to interact with the VCC. 


       Before making any request, do you have any SMC alarms?

intents.name: CBTC All2g A2A
intents.question:
Before you acknowledge any SMC alarms, 
      have you critic the nature of the alarm. 
       Does it require urgent attention?

intents.name: CBTC All2g A2B
intents.question:
Would like to look into point failure issue 

      or analyse other standard CBTC procedures?

intents.name: CBTC All2g A2C
intents.question: Would like to observe standard incident procedure PR0540?

intents.name: CBTC All2h
intents.question: Are you working on Central Computer Operation Terminal (CCOT), and wish to enter commands?

intents.name: CBTC All2i
intents.question:
CCOT commands is safety critical and can only be done by VCC operator. 

       All interaction with VCC should be done on SMC as a request, 
      unless it is essential for a command to VCC via the CCOT. 
      


      Can the task be done on SMC?

intents.name: CBTC All2i A2A
intents.question: Have you PG to get the status of the subsystems?

intents.name: CBTC All2i A2B
intents.question:
Have you critic the PG print back status. 



       Does the PG hightlight anything that requires urgent attention (ie SEC failure)?

intents.name: CBTC All2i A2C
intents.question: Have you followed the 4 step process before entering a command?

intents.name: CBTC All2i A2D
intents.question: Have you observed printback or PG to confirm status after command has been entered?

intents.name: CBTC All2i A2E
intents.question:
CCOT process complete. 


       Have you check SMC for alarm status and communicated to the relevant stakeholders?

intents.name: CBTC All2m
intents.question:
Onboard train equipment (eg MRU and VOBC) picks up Transponder data 
      via TIU and transmit it to VCC, simutaneously VCC is sending commands to the VOBC. 



       Is there any fleet issues relating to train?

intents.name: CBTC All2m A2A
intents.question:
The VOBC should successfully received and transmit data to and from WIFI via the access point and DCS fibre network. 



       Is there any communication problems between the VCC and VOBC?

intents.name: CBTC All2 A2B
intents.question:
Fleet issues are handle by CRT. 
       Raise a job?

intents.name: CBTC All2j
intents.question:
The status of CBTC signalling system. 


      Do you have any major alarms or system failure?

intents.name: CBTC All2j
intents.question: Are you able to get more info via Network Management System (ie syslogs, ipsec statusall, polling)?

intents.name: CBTC All2j A2b1
intents.question: Is it points issue?

intents.name: CBTC All2j A2b2
intents.question: Do you have any issue that requires a job raised?

intents.name: CBTC All2k
intents.question:
This is Data Communication System Level. 



       What is status of communications, has a train gone non-communicating (NCT)?

intents.name: CBTC All2k
intents.question: Has the Network Management System (NMS) identified device failure, red icon?

intents.name: CBTC All2k
intents.question:
Using the Network Management System (NMS) attempt to poll the device. 



       Has a job been raised?

intents.name: CBTC All2k
intents.question:
Using the Network Management System (NMS) attempt to log into the device. 



       Has device syslog or 'status all' identified cause of failure?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1
intents.question:
Communication Based train Control (CBTC) is a ATO system, 
      uses a Frequency Hopping Spread Spectrum (FHSS)
      on a 2.4ghz wifi system to communicate with trains. 



      Would you like to analyse this signalling system?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1
intents.question:
There are 3 main levels of CBTC. 

      Management 'request' level is SMC operator, 

      Would you like to work on the SMC?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question:
CBTC 'command' level is VCC operator, 


       Are you working on Central Computer Operation Terminal (CCOT), and wish to enter commands?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question:
Activation level forms part of onboard train equipment. 



      Would you like to overview the VOBC or other onboard train equipment?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question:
Activation level forms part of the wayside equipent like: 
      Points 
      Route Secure (RS) 
      TCI 
      Axle Counters 
      would you like to analyse the activation level?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question:
Connecting all the sub-systems together is the Data Communication System (DCS),

      Would like to look at the Data Communication System Level?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question: Would you like to analyse CBTC Wayside?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All1 A1a
intents.question: Would you like to analyse CBTC Central?

intents.name: CBTC System All1
intents.question:
Would you like to look into procedure PR0052 

      - CBTC/TBTC Axle counter reset/restore procedure?

intents.name: CBTC System All2
intents.question: Would you like to look at signalling incident management procedure?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052a1
intents.question:
CBTC/TBTC Axle counter reset/restore procedure - warning: 

      RA will cause an NCT image to disappear. 
       An RA sweep needs a block count to return to zero before it will work. 


       The use of the BR command during traffic must be escalated and used under strict controls. 
       Incorrect application of the BR command may result in collision, injury and death. 



       Are you aware of high risk of reseting axle counter blocks?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052a2
intents.question:
The block must either be disturbed or falsely occupied for this procedure PR0052 to be used. 



       Is block disturbed or falsely occupied?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052a3
intents.question: Is the disturbed ACB in a possession?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052b1
intents.question: Is the block disturbed during Traffic Hours??

intents.name: CBTC PR0052c1
intents.question: Is it the end of Engineering Hours and start of Traffic Hours but before train movements?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052c2
intents.question: Is the ACB in a specified area or in egineering hours?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052d1
intents.question:
recommend ACB sweep is carried out. 



       The SSM should use PG 0 SW to confirm points positions. 


       ACB can not be swept if disturbed block is over points that are set the wrong way. 
        

      Is points facing the correct way to sweep?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052d2
intents.question:
Please note: ACB can not be swept if its outside traffic hours. 



       Confirm is it traffic hours and trains are running?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052d3
intents.question:
Signaller should keep disburbed 
      and adjacent blocks clear of trains so sweep can be set up 


      Is trains clear of area and stationary?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052d4
intents.question: Has any route reservations existing across disturbed ACB been removed (RM)?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052e1
intents.question:
The SSM should check and confirm the block status using the PG command (PG 0 ACB). 
       If you get DI* means disturbed with communicating trains in area. 
       If you get DI disturbed and associated tracks closed due to NCT train in area. 
       If you get DI- then disturbed with pret for reset entered in response. 



       Has block status been checked?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052e2
intents.question:
The SSM should confirm all trains are on a healthy block and have a healthy block clear of trains in-between the disturbed block, 

      Has this been checked and confirm by SSM?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052f1
intents.question:
ACB can not be swept if its unrecoverable via preparatory reset, 

      The SSM should test the prep for reset function on SMC, 

      was prep test been done successfully, is there comms with the ACE and EAK?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052f2
intents.question:
Its important that the Train to be used for ACB sweep must be a communicating train, 
      as an NCT train will cause multiple tracks to close and the sweep will be unsuccessful. 



       Use PT (ie PT 3 0 5 3) and check train. 


       If any tracks are closed in disturbed block, the Open track overide will open any swept track. 


       Is designated train communicating, with 2 healthy VOBC?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052f3
intents.question:
If the designated train is ready. 


       Is it practical to sweep the ACB?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052g1
intents.question:
The signaller can select 'prep for reset' RA command on the SMC. 


       The SSM must check for alarms if ACB can not be swept if its unrecoverable via preparatory reset, 

      Is the signallers 'prep for reset' select done successfully?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052g2
intents.question:
The Prep for reset entered, confirms comms with the ACE and EAK. 



       Is train ready to sweep?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052h1
intents.question:
Run the sweep train. 



       Has the sweep train travelled from healthy block through disturbed block and to healthy block?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052h2
intents.question: Has ACB reset worked and ACB is no longer disturbed?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052h3
intents.question:
Open any closed tracks, open track override will open any track within swept disturbed block. 


       Resume normal service. 
       Is Axle Counter reset process complete, yes?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052i1
intents.question: Has the first Traffic hours train passed through the area?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052i2
intents.question: Has DSIM and Service Manager agreed that BR command can be used to reset the block?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052j1
intents.question: Are there any outstabled trains or engineering vehicles in the area?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052j2
intents.question: Have you confirmed that train/vehicles are waiting in their designated position?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052k1
intents.question:
Recommend IBR. 


       Has Service manager and DSIM agree that BR command can be used to reset the block?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052k2
intents.question:
The SSM should check that ACB is recoverable by selecting the prep for reset (Preparatory Reset) on SMC 


      Has the ACE to EAK 'prep for reset' function test, been successful?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052k3
intents.question:
PG 0 ACB. 
       If you get DI* means disturbed with communicating trains in area. 
       If you get DI disturbed and associated tracks closed due to NCT train in area. 
       If you get DI- then disturbed with pret for reset entered in response. 



       Is there a healthy ACB between the train and the ACB to be reset?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052k4
intents.question:
Reset ACB using Immediate Block Reset BR command following (Current & Line Specific) 
      VCC Workstation User Guide for IBR in conjunction with PR050. 



       Has ACB IBR completed?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052k5
intents.question:
PG 0 ACB. 
       If you get DI* means disturbed with communicating trains in area. 
       If you get DI disturbed and associated tracks closed due to NCT train in area. 
       If you get DI- then disturbed with pret for reset entered in response. 
        


      Has the disturbed ACB recovered?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052l1
intents.question: Is the disturbed ACB adjacent to a stabled vehicle?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052l2
intents.question:
PG 0 ACB. 
       If you get DI* means disturbed with communicating trains in area. 
       If you get DI disturbed and associated tracks closed due to NCT train in area. 
       If you get DI- then disturbed with pret for reset entered in response. 


       Does SSM have a pre-work PG list of ACB?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052m1
intents.question: Did the SSM received confirmation that the ACB maintenance work has been completed?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052m2
intents.question:
PG 0 ACB. 
       If you get DI* means disturbed with communicating trains in area. 
       If you get DI disturbed and associated tracks closed due to NCT train in area. 
       If you get DI- then disturbed with pret for reset entered in response. 


       Does SSM have post-work PG list of ACB?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052m3
intents.question:
Has SSM compared the pre and post work PG list for the blocks for stabled vehicles. 

      Has the block count changed?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052n1
intents.question:
Escalate to DSIM, T.O. will be issued AWC to walk the track 
      and confirm ACB adjacent to stabled vehicle are clear. 



       Is disturbed ACB adjacent to train clear of vehicles?

intents.name: CBTC PR0052n2
intents.question:
Train will have to be moved. 

      Arrange with Service Manager, Controller and Signaller to move train in RM from disturbed ACB. 

          The train should be communicating, if goes NCT then tracks will close. 



       Has the train been moved from disturbed ACB?

intents.name: CBTC Failure Relay1a
intents.question:
Has the syslogs identified defective device as a relay 
      and it will require changing?

intents.name: CBTC Failure Relay1b
intents.question:
To change a relay would normally halt an Intersig, due to the checkback. 
       Therefore escalation is required C2 S2530 Irregular Adjustment CBTC type asset L12
      Operation of the CHIT (CE) command: 
      To enable the checkback halting of INTERSIG 'temporarily suspended function' 
      for a period of up to 2 minutes. 

      Has the EOCR Duty Signal Manager given authorised and AWC for this C2 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM?

intents.name: CBTC Failure Relay1c
intents.question:
For the DSIM actioned C2 S2530, staff must be satisfied that it is safe
    to enter the command before checkback halting of INTERSIG 
      temporarily suspended function is enabled. 

          Before authorisation to perform CE is given, the authoriser must be satisfied that: 
      a) Physical segregation implemented such that no further vehicles can approach the area of the site b) 
      All trains in the area of the site are confirmed stationary or c) 
      Traction current in the area of the site is discharged 
      Once the command has been entered successfully
    the checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function is enabled for 2 minutes or until the CD 

    (checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function soon as possible. 
       The relay must be tested 
      to the level agreed by the issuing authority. 
       Prior to removal of the above controls, 
      it must be confirmed that checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function
      is disabled. 
       disabled) command is issued. 


       It must be ensured that the relay is changed within the 
      two minutes and the checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function is disabled. 
      



      Has C3 S2530 been correctly implemented?

intents.name: CBTC Failure ESD1a
intents.question: Is there an active ESD(TCI) that requires changing?

intents.name: CBTC Failure ESD1b
intents.question:
Escalation required for C3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment CBTC type asset C3
      Undertake ESD override on a activated ESD TCI device (VCC SO E Command)

      Has the EOCR Duty Signal Manager given authorised for this C3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM, SSM, and T.O. 
      ?

intents.name: CBTC Failure ESD1c
intents.question:
The reason for the ESD being active must be understood 
      and checks undertaken to ensure it is safe to operate trains before the ESD is overridden. 

      1. 
       Fixed red lights standing
      and illuminated 2. 
       Buffer stop

      train arrestor not struck or civils inspection of the buffer stop
      train arrestor resulting in formal approval to pursue override
      Staff must ensure that the override is reset once
      the condition has been rectified (RO command) on the next engineering hours. 
      



      Has C3 implemented and complete?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All2
intents.question: Do you have a VCC Single CC failure?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All3
intents.question: Do you have a total VCC failure?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4a
intents.question:
Do you have a disturb Axle Counter Blocks during traffic 
      which can not be sweep (prep for reset failed)?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4aa1
intents.question: Is the block disturbed over a set of points?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4aa2
intents.question:
If points are not in the desired position and blocks are disturbed,
      you can use the C4 S2530 Irregular Adjustment
      This is the Remote Point Deadlocking Override (RPDO), to throw points to the desired position
      Has the Emergency On Call Roster (EOCR) Duty Signal Manager,
      given authorised for this C4 S2530 Irregular Adjustment
      The DSIM will be issued an AWC for to T.O. walks track, 
      SSM inputs CCOT RPDO command and ensure safety procedures are in place. 

      Has this been implemented?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4e
intents.question:
Recommend a power cycle of the ACE/EAK. 
       T.O. should identified MCB needed to do power cycle the ACE. 
      


      Ensure all safety procedures are carried out (trains held at platforms etc). 

          Has power cycle fix fault?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4b
intents.question:
T.O. will confirm no trains in disturbed block area 
      and investigate cause of fault at the site. 

      The SSM will informed Line Controller and requested Signaller to do a Prep-For-Reset on the disturbed blocks. 

          This will confirm if the EAK is communication with the Axle Counter Evaluator (ACE). 
      


      Has this been implemented?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4c
intents.question:
SSM and T.O. should check SSP to identify the faulty Axle Counter, 
      that is causing the blocks to be disturbed. 

      Check prints Bookwiring Volume 1 Page 100 to 304 for 
      ACE, PDCU and EAK circuitry

      Also for cable and fuse analysis look at:
      bookwiring Volume 2 Page 2921 to 3060 (SCS1), 3921 to 5148 (SCS2). 



       T.O. arrive on site and started testing
      (ie PDCU output 100vAC input 2. 
      4vDC)

      Has T.O. observed ISDN indication, is it flashing?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4d
intents.question:
T.O. should access GDI application via SMC 
      (ensure KVM selected in ACE rack is set to ATS(b position),  and put selector to correct ACE 1 or 2). 



       Has the TO. 
       been successful at interrogates ACE via GDI?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4e
intents.question:
Recommend a power cycle of the ACE/EAK. 
       T.O. should identified MCB needed to do power cycle the ACE. 
      


      Ensure all safety procedures are carried out (trains held at platforms etc). 

          Has power cycle fix fault?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4f
intents.question:
If service is or will be severely affected recommend C1 S2530 escaltion
      for disturbed Axle Counter Blocks. 


       Immediate Block Reset of an axle counter block. 
       (VCC BR command)



      Has the EOCR authorised IBR C1 S2530?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4g
intents.question:
Is a T.O. with AWC onsite to walk the disturbed blocks
      and ensure no train is in the area

      Also has DSIM and Service Manager are in agreement,and SSM made arrangement with service control for major site protection, 
      (ie, Traction current off, trains held, points reserved)?

intents.name: CBTC Failure All4h
intents.question:
IBR use in traffic must be done under strict control. 
      

    IBR must not be done if any doubts that train maybe in area. 

      Has all procedures and local checks for C1 S2530 been done successfully?

Seems like its working ok, if not try a system reboot. 
       No further action required unless other issues are present.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Three Print Backs Failed
intents.action:
The expected three print backs have failed. 
       Refer to the troubleshooting guide for the CCOT or consult with technical support.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Final End of Diagnostics
intents.action:
Maybe try a system reboot. 
       If unresolved, escalate to the next level of support or consider a system restart.

intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Check Failed Input Path VGL LED
intents.question: For the failed input path, is the VGL CC availability LED flashing?

Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, KRnC/#.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Final No Issue Found

Check EPCM, KRnBS/#, and ASPF for output path LED issues.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Check for Failed Input Path LED

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Input Path LED Flashing Action
intents.action:
Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, and KRnC/# for input path LED issues.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC End of Diagnostics
intents.action: If all previous checks do not resolve the issue, further technical support may be required.

intents.action: Proceed with issuing the 'SS' command as required on the CCOT.

intents.question: Are the 'VGL CC' availability LEDs flashing indicating output synchronization?

intents.question: Confirm if 'VGL CC' LEDs are still flashing after approximately 5 minutes?

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Final Action for Output Sync LEDs Flashing
intents.action: If the 'VGL CC' LEDs continue to flash beyond 5 minutes, further troubleshooting is required.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are the 'VGL CC' availability LEDs solid indicating input synchronization?

intents.name: CBTC Single CC Final Action for Input Sync LEDs Flashing
intents.action: If the 'VGL CC' LEDs are flashing, wait approximately 5 minutes to confirm if the issue persists.

intents.name: CBTC Single CC End of Flowchart Path
intents.action:
No further issues detected. 
       If the problem persists, refer to the advanced diagnostics manual or contact support.

intents.name: CBTC TotalVCC Power Status Check
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) on?

intents.name: CBTC TotalVCC No Power LED Response
intents.action: Check the PDU and 3GVCC (Power bar).

intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly with Binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.action: Check Ri and Oi paths for S/P-VL and VgL/Eth cards respectively.

intents.name: CBTC TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Verify VGL CC availability LEDs and ensure they are solid, then check all LED status on VGL cards.

intents.name: CBTC TotalVCC End of Diagnosis
intents.action:
System checks out okay. 
       No further issues detected.

intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) off?

intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly?

intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization correct?

intents.action: There is a card synchronization issue; check the Ri and Oi card connections and configurations.

intents.question: Does equalisation have 3 responses on CCOT?
