intents.name: WH RI All
intents.question: Are you working with Relay Interlocking?

intents.name: WH RI Route Availability
intents.question: Before selecting a new route, Do You Have Availability, is UAR relay - up?

intents.name: WH RI Route Selection Process
intents.question:
Check the status of the following relays: 
 
      (FM)R - up (route button not pulled - cancelled) 
      (F)R - down (route button not pushed - selected) 
      RUR - down (route not seen reverse) 
      NLR - up (route is normal position) 
 
 
      Are all the above relays in the corresponding state?

intents.name: WH RI Route Button Pushed
intents.question:
Push selected route button. 
       Is the (F)R relay up?

intents.name: WH RI F R Relay Up
intents.question:
The NLR should of de-latched with the UAR remaining up. 
       Is the NLR down?

intents.name: WH NLR Not Delatched
intents.question:
The NLR failure.  
      Check feed to de-latch coil and chase voltage,  

      if 100v at coil change relay and remember to de-latch first when installed. 
       Has fault been found and fixed?

intents.name: WH RI NLR is Down
intents.question: Has the RUR picked up and push button illuminated?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point1
intents.question:
The RUR up allows 'Route to Point Calling'. 

      Does the route require points to move?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point2
intents.question: Is points required reverse?'

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point2b
intents.question: Is points required normal?'

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point2r
intents.question: Has point NLR de-latched (represents point lever no longer normal)?'

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point2n
intents.question: Has point RLR de-latched (represents point lever no longer reverse)?'

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point3rw
intents.question:
After 550ms the WZR should drop

      Has the WZR drop?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point3nw
intents.question:
After 550ms the WZR should drop

      Has the WZR drop?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point3r
intents.question:
Before WZR drops the point RLR should latch up, representing point lever going reverse. 
       Has the point RLR latched up ?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point3n
intents.question:
Before WZR drops the point NLR should latch up, representing point lever going Normal. 
       Has the point NLR latched up ?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point4r
intents.question:
As the point RLR is now latched up. 
       Is the NZLPR down, and the RZLPR remained up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point4n
intents.question:
As the point NLR is now latched up. 
       Is the RZLPR down, and the NZLPR remained up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point5r
intents.question: Has RWR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point5n
intents.question: Has NWR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point6r
intents.question:
Has WJR (7. 
      5 seconds) timer started?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point6n
intents.question:
Has WJR (7. 
      5 seconds) timer started?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point7r
intents.question:
The point RLR up and RWKR down so out of correspondence,

      this picks up the RWMR so the points can move to get correspondence. 


       Has RWMR which feeds the motor picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point7n
intents.question:
The point NLR up and NWKR down so out of correspondence,

      this picks up the NWMR so the points can move to get correspondence. 


       Has NWMR which feeds the motor picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point8r
intents.question:
Feed applied to point motor. 

      points moving. 
      . 
      . 


       Has the RWKR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point8n
intents.question:
Feed applied to point motor. 

      points moving. 
      . 
      . 


       Has the NWKR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point9r
intents.question:
The RWMR drops when the RWKR picks up 

      (points with supplementary drive also have  RWK1R & RWK2R),

      and the feed to the WJR timer stops. 

      Has the RKLPR picked?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point9n
intents.question:
The NWMR drops when the NWKR picks up 
 
      (points with supplementary drive also have  NWK1R & NWK2R),
 
      and the feed to the WJR timer stops. 

      Has the NKLPR picked?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point10r
intents.question:
points Set Locked and Detected Reverse. 

      Has the UCR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Points Failed1
intents.question: Is it a point failure?

intents.name: WH RI Points Failed2
intents.question: Are the points deadlocked by a track locking track?

intents.name: WH RI Points Failed1b
intents.question:
Need to throw points to desired position. 

          Recommend local procedures or S2530 L16 (for Heathrow Only) 
      the release of the deadlocked track locking track to throw points to desired postion. 
       It must be authorised by EOCR Duty Signal manager and actioned by DSIM. 

          The Maintenance Organisations point release allows a local Technical Officer at Heathrow T5
      to throw points with the track locking circuit de-energised. 
       



    Are staff satisfied that it is safe to release the track locking tracks to throw the points. 


       Has DSIM been issued with AWC?

intents.name: WH RI Points Failed1c
intents.question: Carry out a full site test out?

intents.name: WH RI Route To Point10n
intents.question:
points Set Locked and Detected Normal. 

      Has the UCR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Up On1
intents.question:
So route NLR is de-latched, RUR is up, meaning route lever is 'seen' reverse, points are in correct position. 

       
      If Limit of Control (L.O.C ) is clear, then the GR will pick up 
      A green aspect will be displayed and the Trainstop will lower. 

       
      Is the GR up?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Up On
intents.question:
Check everything in the signals limit of control: 
      Are all the Tracks - up 
      Points - set locked and detected 
      Position Detectors - down, 
      Speed Control - timer zero 
      Approach Lock (ALSR) timer - set to zero 
      Wrong Road Trainstops - fully ON 
      GSR - down (so all the route cancelling (NOT seen reverse) is proved (RUR down)). 

       
 
    Is all the above as required?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Up On2
intents.question: Is the GR up?

intents.name: WH RI Signal Clear4
intents.question:
Check GR, if there is two GR's its because of diversity, check both GR's. 

          Check UCR contacts is up (so Limit of Control is clear) 
      Check ALSR contact is down (so route Approach Locked as required) 
      Check UJCR(15) up so BackLock timer is proven to be zero 
 
      Have you completed all checks??

intents.name: WH RI Signal Clear2
intents.question: Is the signal (Green Light - DE) illuminated at aspect level?

intents.name: WH RI Signal Clear3
intents.question:
Check green light (DE) circuit or re-lamp signal. 
       Is the signal illuminated at aspect level?

intents.name: WH RI Signal Clear
intents.question:
Route operation to clear signal complete. 

       
      Would you like to commence route cancel operation?

intents.name: WH RI Route Cancel Commence
intents.question:
Route cancel operation can be achieved by: 
      - Train Operated Route Release (TORR) 
      - A Manual Route Cancel Request by pulling button
 
      Will route be cancelled by TORR?

intents.name: WH RI Button pulled
intents.question:
Pull route button to break (F)M contact. 

       
      Has route button been pulled to Cancel Route?

intents.name: WH RI Button Pulled 2
intents.question:
FM contact broken. 
      
 
      Is (F)M relay down?

intents.name: WH RI Button Not Pulled
intents.question:
A Train has approached and is sitting on Berth Track with a Green (clear to go) signal showing. 

          TORR 'stage 1' (step 1) has commence, which means TAS(1)R should now be up
      (if the the Berth Track is down and the replacement track is up and signal clear)

      Is TAS(1)R up?

intents.name: WH RI FM R down
intents.question:
So (FM) R relay is down. 
       Did the RUR drop?

intents.name: WH RI FM R down2
intents.question: Is the ULCR up?

intents.name: WH RI FM R down3
intents.question:
(FM) R relay down should drop RUR. 
       Is the RUR down?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Starts
intents.question:
Now the train passed the signal and taken the route. 

      Has both the Berth Track and the Replacing Track dropped?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Starts2
intents.question:
TORR stage 1 (step2) commences. 
       This is TAS(1)R up and when Berth Track picks up the TASR picks and sticks up. 

      Did the TASR pick and stick up?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Starts3
intents.question:
The train continues in the route and should have the following:

      GSR down
      UCR down
      GR down
      Red aspect in signal
      TAS1R down
      TASR up
      Trainstop 'ON' so VCR and GVCR is up. 

      Is the above correct?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Starts4
intents.question:
As the TASR is up, this should cause the ALSR to pick up. 

      Is the ALSR up?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Stage1
intents.question:
TORR stage 1 (step 2) complete. 

          The signal is no longer Approach Lock. 

          However the signal is still Back Locked and requires TORR stage 2 (step3) to pick up the ULCR. 

      Once the train has passed the last point locking track. 

      The UZSR(15) should pick and stick up and UJCR(15) should drop, 

      then 15 seconds timer will start and go to time, even if the train hits Position Detector to picks up the ULCR. 


       Is the UZSR(15) up?

intents.name: WH RI GSR Up2
intents.question:
Once the train is clear of the replacing track the GSR should pick up. 
       Has the GSR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time Down1
intents.question:
Looks like TORR failed the Back Lock. 
       Should be slow to clear by 15 second. 
       and there is a Release failure (Track Cleared for Time failed). 
       Check/change UZSR relay and test required relays in circuit. 
       Is fault fixed?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time Down2
intents.question:
Do a full failure investigation. 
       Who you like to retest the route?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time Down3
intents.question:
Check/change UJR(15) relay and test required relays in circuit. 
       Is fault fixed?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time1
intents.question: Check the time relay (UJR(15)), has it started timing is LED showing?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time2
intents.question: After 15 seconds, has UJPR(15) relay picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time3
intents.question:
After 15 seconds,  with UJPR(15) up. 
       Has UJCR(15) relay dropped?

intents.name: WH RI Backclear For Time4
intents.question:
After 15 seconds, with UJPR(15) up. 
       Has UJSR(15) relay picked up?

intents.name: WH RI GSR Up2
intents.question:
Once the train is clear of the replacing track the GSR should pick up. 
       Has the GSR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Stage2
intents.question: Have you observed TORR stage 2?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Up3
intents.question:
Once Train has completed route this should cause ULCR (back Locking) to pick up after TORR stage 2. 

       
      Did the ULCR pick up?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Up4
intents.question:
Now that the Train has completed the route the NLR will latch up. 

       
      Is the NLR up?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Down
intents.question:
Appears to be a TORR failure. 
       A release is required!

      Has 'Track Cleared For Time' commenced, has the AZR pick up?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time Down
intents.question:
Looks like TORR failed and there is a Release failure (Track Cleared for Time failed). 
       Check/change AZR relay and test required relays in circuit. 
       Is fault fixed?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time Down2
intents.question:
Do a full failure investigation. 
       Who you like to retest the route?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time Down3
intents.question:
Check/change AJR(60) relay and test required relays in circuit. 
       Is fault fixed?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time1
intents.question: Check the time relay (AJR(60)), has it started to wind, is dim timing LED showing?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time2
intents.question: After 60 seconds, has AJPR(60) relay picked up?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time3
intents.question:
After 60 seconds,  with AJPR(60) up. 
       Has AJCR(60) relay dropped?

intents.name: WH RI Clear For Time4
intents.question:
After 60 seconds, with AJPR(60) up. 
       Has AJSR(60) relay picked up?

intents.name: WH RI ALSR Up1
intents.question:
Since the AJSR(60) is up. 
       Has ALSR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI ALSR Up2
intents.question:
Since the ALSR(60) is up, the AZR and AJR(60) would drop. 

      Has the NLR picked up?

intents.name: WH RI TASR Down2
intents.question:
Appears to be a TORR failure. 
       Is it a TORR stage 1 failure?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Stage 1 Fail
intents.question:
TORR stage 1 you need to run a train and observe TAS1R. 
       Is TAS1R working ok?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Stage 2 Fail
intents.question:
TORR stage 2 you need to run a train and observe TAS1R and TASR together. 
       Is both TAS1R and TASR working ok?

intents.name: WH RI TORR Stage 2b Fail
intents.question:
TORR stage 2 failure maybe cause by ALSR failing, you need to investigate ALSR circuit. 
       Is ALSR working ok?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Down Out
intents.question: Has the NLR latched up?

intents.name: WH RI NLR Now Up
intents.question:
Route Release operation complete. 
      
 
      Now that the route is cancelled, would you like to set another route?

intents.name: WH RI NLR Now Down
intents.question:
The route NLR can not latched up. 
       Is the ALSR down?

intents.name: WH ALSR Now Down
intents.question:
The ALSR cannot pick up as TAR is down. 
       Is a release required?

intents.name: WH RI No Availability
intents.question: Is any conflicting routes selected?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes
intents.question: no conflicting route, so route NLR is UP meaning NOT SET?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2a
intents.question:
Appears to be a relay interlocking signal failure. 
      


      Is the failure preventing route availability, UAR down?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2b
intents.question: Can you confirm no MTCE release or emergency release is being taken?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2c
intents.question: Can you confirm no possession, is the U(DL) link in?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2d
intents.question:
Can you confirm finger is off the button, anti-preselection. 
       So is the F(R) down (before reselecting again)?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2e
intents.question: Can you confirm points are SET in Line or FREE to be set in Line?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2f
intents.question: Check power supply, is all ok

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2g
intents.question: Check circuit wiring, is all ok?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2h
intents.question: Change UAR relay, is all ok

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i
intents.question:
Recommend irregular adjustment:

      S2530 to provide a partial service until fault found and repaired


      Has the escalation process for a temporary repair to restore 
      full service until permanent repair been considered?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I2
intents.question: Has a full repair with mitigrations for testing until engineering hours been considered?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I3
intents.question:
Has DSIM ensure fault finding, testing , and repair process is done to 
      the 5 Levels of fault rectification starting at level 1:


      S2530 L13, Like for like replacement?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I4
intents.question:
Level 2:


      S2530 L4, Mutual SWAP with relay that is NOT using fault contact?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I5
intents.question:
Level 3:


      S2530 L2 and L6, to reduce service impact by preventing circuit use. 
       Taking fuse,MCB and links out?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I6
intents.question:
Level 4:


      S2530 L12, Parallel in contacts within relay. 

          S2530 L9 and L11, Re-allocation by finding another up/down contact. 
      



      Has the requirements been implemented?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I7
intents.question:
Level 5:


      S2530 L9 and L11, Re-allocation by finding another up/down contact?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I8
intents.question: Would you like to view standard incident management and escalation procedure?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2i I9
intents.question:
Has all options been exhausted and requirements been implemented. 


       Is site ready for testing?

intents.name: WH RI No Conflicting Routes2j
intents.question:
Follow standard procedures to rectify  issues. 
       May required operational restrictions on train service. 
       Taking possession, S2530, mtce release, etc. 


       Has issue been resolved to standard procedure?

intents.name: WH RI Conflicting Route
intents.question:
Manually cancel all routes and conflicting routes, 
      may have to wait for timers (60 if ALSR is down, or 4. 
      5 seconds if ULCR is down 
      (Check Sub Route Charts for back lock details)), 
      or you may have to start a route availability failure investigation. 



       Have to start process from the beginning. 
       Are all routes cancelled?

intents.name: WH RI FM Up
intents.question:
Appears to be a failure, relay stuck up, or an irregularity. 

       Have you started a failure investigation?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Still Up
intents.question:
Appears to be failure, maybe a short circuit or earth, relay stuck up, or an irregularity. 
       Have you started a failure investigation?

intents.name: WH RI RUR Sig Irr1
intents.question: Click 'yes' to view the alleged Signalling Irregularity procedure PR0702?

intents.name: WH RI Slow To Clear
intents.question:
This is a signal failure in that the route is 'Slow To Clear'!  

      How Slow, is it approx 60 seconds slow?

intents.name: WH RI Slow To Clear2
intents.question:
'Slow To Clear' failure. 

      How Slow, is it approx 15 seconds slow?

intents.name: WH RI Slow To Clear3
intents.question:
'Slow To Clear' failure that takes approx 60 seconds indicates Approach Locking release failure, where 60 seconds timer in auto release fuunction to get out of troble. 

      Has the timer started timing?

intents.name: WH RI Slow To Clear4
intents.question:
'Slow To Clear' failure that takes approx 15 seconds indicates Backlocking release failure, where 15 seconds timer in auto started for every train. 

      Has the timer started timing?

intents.name: tbtc All2a
intents.question: Would like to check the Axle Counters?

intents.name: tbtc All2b
intents.question: Would like to check the VCC?

intents.name: tbtc All2c
intents.question: Would like to check the Intersig?

intents.name: tbtc All2d
intents.question: Would like to check the points?

intents.name: tbtc All2e
intents.question: Would like to check the Emergency Stopping Device?

intents.name: tbtc All2f
intents.question: Are you working with the Data Communication Systems?

intents.name: tbtc All2g
intents.question: Would you like to check the SMC?

intents.name: tbtc All2h
intents.question: Are you working on Central Computer Operation Terminal and wish to enter commands?

intents.name: tbtc All2i
intents.question:
Are you working at an 2. 
      Operations 'command' level, VCC operator?

intents.name: tbtc All2m
intents.question:
Are you working at an 3. 
      Activation level 
      for onboard train equipment (eg MRU and VOBC) and wayside (T.O. )?

intents.name: tbtc All2j
intents.question:
Whats the status of TBTC system. 

          Do you have any alarms or system failure?

intents.name: tbtc All2k
intents.question: Are you working at a Data Communication System Level?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All1
intents.question:
There are 3 levels of TBTC. 

      1. 
      Management 'request' level, SMC operator. 

          2. 
      Operations 'command' level, VCC operator. 

          3. 
      Activation level onboard train and wayside. 



       TBTC use loop Connecting these 3 levels is the Data Communication System (DCS),
      which is monitored via the Network Management System. 
      


      Are you working at the 1. 
      Management 'request' level, SMC operator?

intents.name: tbtc System All1
intents.question:
tbtc system operation still in development in this app. 
       Select another?

intents.name: tbtc Failure Relay1a
intents.question: Is there defective relay that requires changing?

intents.name: tbtc Failure Relay1b
intents.question:
To change a relay intersig will halt due to checkback, wth NLE 3rd generation VCC9 only it possible to escalation to

    T6 S2530 Irregular Adjustment tbtc type asset T6
      Operation of the CE command: 
      To enable the checkback halting of INTERSIG 'temporarily suspended function' 
      for a period of up to 2 minutes. 

      Has the EOCR Duty Signal Manager given authorised and AWC for this T6 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM?

intents.name: tbtc Failure Relay1c
intents.question:
For the DSIM actioned T6 S2530, staff must be satisfied that it is safe
    to enter the command before checkback halting of INTERSIG 
      temporarily suspended function is enabled. 

          Before authorisation to perform CE is given, the authoriser must be satisfied that: 
      a) Physical segregation implemented such that no further vehicles can approach the area of the site b) 
      All trains in the area of the site are confirmed stationary or c) 
      Traction current in the area of the site is discharged 
      Once the command has been entered successfully
    the checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function is enabled for 2 minutes or until the CD 

    (checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function soon as possible. 
       The relay must be tested 
      to the level agreed by the issuing authority. 
       Prior to removal of the above controls, 
      it must be confirmed that checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function
      is disabled. 
       disabled) command is issued. 


       It must be ensured that the relay is changed within the 
      two minutes and the checkback halting of INTERSIG temporarily suspended function is disabled. 
      



      Has T6 S2530 been correctly implemented?

intents.name: tbtc Failure ESD1a
intents.question: Is there an active ESD(TCI) that requires changing?

intents.name: tbtc Failure ESD1b
intents.question:
Escalation required for T2 S2530 Irregular Adjustment tbtc type asset T2
      Undertake ESD override on a activated ESD TCI device (VCC SO E Command)

      Has the EOCR Duty Signal Manager given authorised for this C3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to DSIM, SSM, and T.O. 
      ?

intents.name: tbtc Failure ESD1c
intents.question:
The reason for the ESD being active must be understood 
      and checks undertaken to ensure it is safe to operate trains before the ESD is overridden. 

      1. 
       Fixed red lights standing
      and illuminated 2. 
       Buffer stop

      train arrestor not struck or civils inspection of the buffer stop
      train arrestor resulting in formal approval to pursue override
      Staff must ensure that the override is reset once
      the condition has been rectified (RO command) on the next engineering hours. 
      



      Has T2 S2530 implementation been completed?

intents.name: tbtc Failure DLX1a
intents.question:
Do you have point circuit deadlocking contacts - AB relays failing, 
      so a 'Axle Counter Block relay contacts' failure?

intents.name: tbtc Failure DLX1b
intents.question:
To bypass of Axle Counter Block relay contacts in order to throw points. 
       Escalation will be required for the operation of the deadlocking override keyswitch (DLX). 
      

    Recommend T3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment TBTC type asset T3
      Operation of the deadlocking override keyswitch (DLX). 
      


      Has the SIM given authorised for this T3 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to T.O. ?

intents.name: tbtc Failure DLX1c
intents.question:
Ensure associated blocks are not disturbed or occupied. 

          AB relays confirmed in energised state. 
       No train movements in the controlled area. 
       Keyswitch to be operated locally and 
      the points swung via VCC command from control room. 



       Has T3 S2530 been implemented?

intents.name: tbtc Failure SCSab1a
intents.question: Do you have a disturbance to an SCS cluster requiring the need to disable the SCS interlocking?

intents.name: tbtc Failure SCSab1b
intents.question:
Escalation is needed to use the DI command to disable the local interlocking to allow movement of points 
      or disable the block occupancy clearance that has become locked as a result of SCS cluster. 

      This requires T4 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset T4

      Has the EOCR Duty Signal manager given authorised for T4 S2530 Irregular Adjustment to SIM?

intents.name: tbtc Failure SCSab1c
intents.question:
All SCS's within the cluster must be operational and in communication with the VCC. 


        Physical segregation implemented such that no further vehicles can approach the area of the SCS cluster. 


        All RS signals in the area of the SCS cluster are extinguished and released. 


       All trains in the SCS cluster are confirmed stationary and keyed off. 


        No RS signals in the area of the SCS cluster had been set immediately prior to the failure. 


       No Traction current in the area of the SCS cluster is discharged. 


       Use of the DI command should be undertaken in accordance with the relevant VCC workstation user guide. 
      


       Has T4 S2530 been implemented?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All2
intents.question: Is it VCC Single CC failure?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All3
intents.question: Is it Total VCC failure?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4a
intents.question:
Do you have a disturb Axle Counter Blocks during traffic 
      which can not be sweep (prep for reset failed)?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4aa1
intents.question: Is the block disturbed over a set of points?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4aa2
intents.question:
If points are not in the desired position and blocks are disturbed,
      you can use the T5 S2530 Irregular Adjustment Legacy type asset T5
      This is the Remote Point Deadlocking Override (RPDO), to throw points to the desired position
      Has the Emergency On Call Roster (EOCR) Duty Signal Manager,
      given authorised for this T5 S2530 Irregular Adjustment
      The DSIM will be issued an AWC for to T.O. walks track, 
      SSM inputs CCOT RPDO command and ensure safety procedures are in place. 

      Has this been implemented?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4e
intents.question:
Recommend a power cycle of the ACE/EAK. 
       T.O. should identified MCB needed to do power cycle the ACE. 
      


      Ensure all safety procedures are carried out (trains held at platforms etc). 

          Has power cycle fix fault?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4b
intents.question:
T.O. will confirm no trains in disturbed block area 
      and investigate cause of fault at the site. 

      The SSM will informed Line Controller and requested Signaller to do a Prep-For-Reset on the disturbed blocks. 

          This will confirm if the EAK is communication with the Axle Counter Evaluator (ACE). 
      


      Has this been implemented?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4c
intents.question:
SSM and T.O. should check SSP to identify the faulty Axle Counter, 
      that is causing the blocks to be disturbed. 

      Check prints Bookwiring Volume 1 Page 100 to 304 for 
      ACE, PDCU and EAK circuitry

      Also for cable and fuse analysis look at:
      bookwiring Volume 2 Page 2921 to 3060 (SCS1), 3921 to 5148 (SCS2). 



       T.O. arrive on site and started testing
      (ie PDCU output 100vAC input 2. 
      4vDC)

      Has T.O. observed ISDN indication, is it flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4d
intents.question:
T.O. should access GDI application via SMC 
      (ensure KVM selected in ACE rack is set to ATS(b position),  and put selector to correct ACE 1 or 2). 



       Has the TO. 
       been successful at interrogates ACE via GDI?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4e
intents.question:
Recommend a power cycle of the ACE/EAK. 
       T.O. should identified MCB needed to do power cycle the ACE. 
      


      Ensure all safety procedures are carried out (trains held at platforms etc). 

          Has power cycle fix fault?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4f
intents.question:
If service is severely affected recommend T1 S2530 escaltion
      for disturbed Axle Counter Blocks. 


       Immediate Block Reset of an axle counter block. 
       (VCC BR command)



      Has the EOCR authorised IBR T1 S2530?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4g
intents.question:
Is a T.O. with AWC onsite to walk the disturbed blocks
      and ensure no train wayside is in the area

      Also has DSIM and SSM made arrangement with service control for major site protection, 
      (ie, Traction current off, trains held, points reserved)?

intents.name: tbtc Failure All4h
intents.question:
IBR use in traffic must be done under strict control. 
      

    IBR must not be done if any doubts that train maybe in area. 

      Has all procedures and local checks for T1 S2530 been done successfully?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Power Status LED
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supply) on?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Software
intents.question: Are there any initial VCC alarms indicating a VCC to CPU connection disturbance?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Initial VCC Alarm Syntax Check
intents.question: Does the initial VCC alarm show 'VCC <X> CONNECTION WITH CPU <Y> DISTURBED'?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC CC Level Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization working properly?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Equalisation Check
intents.question: Are there three responses on CCOT for equalisation?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the output synchronization OK?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the input synchronization OK?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Output Path VLC
intents.question: For failed output path, is VLC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Input Path VLC
intents.question: For failed input path, is VLC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect Power Bar or CC Power Supply
intents.action: Inspect and test the power bar and CC power supply for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM or Wiring
intents.action: Inspect EPCM or wiring for synchronization issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM Output Path Failure
intents.action: Check EPCM for output path issues and verify connections.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM Input Path Failure
intents.action: Check EPCM for input path issues and verify connections.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Three Printbacks on CCOT
intents.question: Did the CCOT execute three printbacks following the SS command?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Execute SS Command on CCOT
intents.action: Execute the SS command on the CCOT as required.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Diagnosis
intents.action:
The diagnosis has concluded. 
       Perform the necessary actions based on the results.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check EPCM on 3G VC Rack
intents.question: Is there an error in binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check All EPCMs for Tracing Cursor
intents.action:
Check all 3 EPCMs; if there is a tracing cursor, 
       it indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Racks Observations
intents.question: Is the VCC Rack's observation consistent with the symptoms described?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnosis Continues
intents.action: Continue with further diagnostic steps as indicated in the flowchart.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Diagnosis with Error
intents.action:
The diagnosis has ended with an error. 
       Consult further technical support.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect VCC Racks Observation
intents.question: Are there any issues with the VCC Racks Observations?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Power Status LED EC
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (EC Power Supply) not illuminated?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect CC Power Supply Failure
intents.action: Check and replace the CC Power Supply if necessary.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect Power Bar Failure
intents.action: Check and replace the Power Bar if necessary.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Binary Checksums CRC ECPM
intents.question: Is there an error in binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Perform CRC Check on All EPCMs
intents.action:
Check all 3 EPCMs; if there's a tracing cursor, 
       it indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Cyclic Halt of EPCM
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM (3G VC Rack)?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect KRCNF Failure
intents.action: Inspect KRCNF for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect KRCNRF Failure
intents.action: Inspect KRCNRF for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
You have reached the end of the diagnostic flowchart. 
        Follow the necessary steps for resolution 
       or contact technical support for further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for Failed Output Path VGL
intents.question: For failed output path, is VGL availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check ASPF
intents.action: Inspect ASPF for issues and check connections.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnosis Continues After 5 Minutes
intents.action: Wait for approximately 5 minutes and then continue with the diagnosis.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for Failed Input Path VGL
intents.question: For failed input path, is VGL availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check LED Traffic and Data Bus Activity
intents.action: Check LED traffic and Data Bus activity on all S/P WDL cards.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
You have reached the end of the diagnostic flowchart. 
        Follow the necessary steps for resolution 
       or contact technical support for further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for FLTR
intents.question: Is the FLTR path failing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM FLTR Issue
intents.action: Check the EPCM FLTR components for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for Synchronization Issues
intents.question: Are there any synchronization issues with the system?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Verify CC Level Synchronization
intents.question: Can you confirm that the CC level synchronization is correct?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check RI via S/P-VGL Card
intents.question: Is the RI via S/P-VGL card functioning correctly?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM RI S/P Issue
intents.action: Check the EPCM RI S/P card for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Suspect EPCM RI VGL Issue
intents.action: Check the EPCM RI VGL card for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Verify Equalization Process
intents.question: Is the equalization process functioning correctly?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Issue Equalization Command
intents.action: Issue the command required for equalization on the system.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Input Synchronization
intents.question: Is the input synchronization operating correctly?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for VGL LED Issues
intents.question: Are the VGL LEDs indicating an issue?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Verify VGL LED Flashing
intents.action: Check if the VGL LEDs are flashing as expected and troubleshoot accordingly.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
You have reached the end of the diagnostic flowchart. 
        Follow the necessary steps for resolution 
       or contact technical support for further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Software Alarm
intents.question: Is there a VCC software alarm indicating a connection with the CPU is disturbed?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Binary Checksums
intents.question: Are there errors in the binary checksums (CRCs) for the EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Binary Checksums Error
intents.action:
Perform a detailed check of all EPCMs. 
        If a tracing cursor is present, this indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Level Alarm Status
intents.question: Is there a cyclic VCC alarm approximately every 90 seconds?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Alarm Syntax
intents.action:
Verify the syntax of the VCC alarm 
       and inspect for 'VCC <-> CC CONNECTION WITH CPU 0 DISTURBED'.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check if CC Halted
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM (3G VCC Rack)?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Halt Causes
intents.action: Inspect the VCC rack for causes of cyclic halting and address any found issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Output Synchronization
intents.question: Are there any issues with output synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Inspect the VGL CC availability LEDs and troubleshoot synchronization issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
You have reached the end of the diagnostic flowchart. 
        Follow the necessary steps for resolution or contact technical support for further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Input Synchronization
intents.question: Are there any issues with input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Inspect the VGL CC availability LEDs and check for synchronization issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Output Path VGL
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Failed Output Path VGL Issue
intents.action:
Wait approximately 5 minutes, 
       then check if the VGL CC availability LED starts flashing.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Input Path VGL
intents.question: For the failed input path, is the VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Failed Input Path VGL Issue
intents.action:
Check LL telegam traffic and Data bus activity on all SP6 WDL cards. 
        Wait approximately 5 minutes before checking again.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Observations - No Power
intents.question: Is there no power status LED (DC Power Supply) on the VCC Racks?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC No Power Status LED Issue
intents.action: Check the power bar, CC power supply, and EPCM for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Observations - CRC Error
intents.question: Is there an error in binary Checksums (CRC) for the EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC CRC Error Detected
intents.action:
Check all 3 EPCMs. 
       If there is a tracing cursor, 
       it indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Observations - Cyclic Halt
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM (3G VCC Rack)?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Cyclic Halt of EPCM Issue
intents.action: Check EPCM for Knn/knS/# and Knn/cR/# timing, and check FLTR for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Software Initial VCL Alarm
intents.question: Is there a 'VCC VCL C CONNECTION WITH CPU n DISTURBED' initial VCL alarm?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Software VCL Alarm Issue
intents.action: Check connection with CPU 1 and 2.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check CC Level Synchronization
intents.question: Are there any CC level synchronization issues?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC CC Level Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Inspect Ri via SP6/WL card and Qi via VgL/ein card.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Equalisation
intents.question: Are there 3 responses on CCQT or is SS Command required on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Equalisation Issue
intents.action: Perform equalisation checks and responses.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Output Synchronization
intents.question: Is there an issue with output synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action:
Verify VGL CC availability LEDs 
       and check for flashing indicating synchronization issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
No further issues detected or end of diagnostic branches. 
        Refer to manual or contact support if the problem persists.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Racks Observations
intents.question:
Do you observe any issues in the VCC Racks, 
       such as missing power status LED or CRC errors?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks No Power Status LED
intents.action: Investigate the power bar, CC power supply, and EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Error in CRC
intents.question: Is there an error in binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks CRC Error Detected
intents.action: Check all 3 EPCMs; a tracing cursor indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Cyclic Halt of EPCM
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Cyclic Halt Detected
intents.action:
Check the timing on KRnA/# and KRnC/#. 
       Also, verify FLTR.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Failed Output Path VGL
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Failed Output Path VGL
intents.action: Wait approximately 5 minutes, then check if the LED starts flashing.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Racks Failed Input Path VGL
intents.question: For the failed input path, is the VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Failed Input Path VGL
intents.action: Check LL telegram traffic and Data bus activity on all SP6 WDL cards.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart
intents.action:
No fault found, maybe try a system reboot. 
        If the problem persists, consult further technical documentation or contact support.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Output Synchronization
intents.question: Is the output synchronization process working as expected?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Verify the VGL CC availability LEDs and check for flashing.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Input Synchronization
intents.question: Is there an issue with input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Check the VGL CC availability LEDs and traffic and Data bus activity.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Diagnostics
intents.action:
No further issues detected. 
        If the problem persists, refer to the manual or contact technical support.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Three Print Backs on CCOT
intents.question: Are there 3 print backs on the CCOT for the command following the SS?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Three Print Backs Confirmed
intents.action:
Seems like its working ok, if not try a system reboot. 
        No further action required unless other issues are present.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Three Print Backs Failed
intents.action:
The expected three print backs have failed. 
        Refer to the troubleshooting guide for the CCOT or consult with technical support.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Final End of Diagnostics
intents.action:
Maybe try a system reboot. 
        If unresolved, escalate to the next level of support or consider a system restart.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check No Power Status LED
intents.question: Is the power status LED off?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose Power Bar Issue
intents.action: Inspect the CC power supply and power bar for issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Error in Binary Checksums
intents.question: Is there an error in binary checksums for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose EPCM Issue
intents.action:
Check all EPCMs. 
       If there is a tracing cursor, it indicates a failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Cyclic Halt of EPCM
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM (3G VCC Rack)?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose KRnC/# Issue
intents.action: Inspect for issues with KRnC/# or associated timing.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Output Path
intents.question: Has the output path failed with VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose VGL Issue
intents.action:
Check for issues with VGL or KRnBS/#. 
       If none, contact support.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Input Path
intents.question: Has the input path failed with VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose Input Path Issue
intents.action: Inspect for issues with PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, or associated data pathways.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check VCC Rack Observations
intents.question: Are there any observations on VCC Racks to be checked?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC No Power Status LED
intents.action: Confirm if the Power bar or CC power supply is the cause and perform necessary checks.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Error in Binary Checksums
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the EPCM indicated by the error in binary checksums?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Cyclic Halt of EPCM
intents.action: Verify EPCM connections, including KRnC/# timing and FLTR issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Diagnose Binary Checksums Issue
intents.action:
If binary checksums error persists, 
       check all EPCMs for tracing cursor indicating failure to connect with another EPCM.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Output Path LED
intents.question: Is the output path VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Path LED Issue
intents.action: Perform a check on EPCM, KRnBS/#, and ASPF for output path LED issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Input Path LED
intents.question: Is the input path VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Path LED Issue
intents.action: Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, and KRnC/# for input path LED issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Output Path VGL LED
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Action Check VGL, KRnBS/#, ASPF
intents.action:
Check EPCM, KRnBS/#, and ASPF. 
       If no issues found, contact support for VGL.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check Failed Input Path VGL LED
intents.question: For the failed input path, is the VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Action Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, KRnC/#
intents.action:
Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, KRnC/#. 
        If no issues found, contact support for data pathway problems.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Final No Issue Found
intents.action:
No further issues detected, do a system reboot. 
        If problems persist, additional support may be required.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Cyclic Halt of EPCM
intents.question: Is there a cyclic halting of the EPCM (3G VCC Rack)?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Verify EPCM Connections
intents.action: Check S/P-Wdlall, VglEin, KRnC/#, and FLTR for timing and connection issues.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for Failed Output Path LED
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Path LED Not Flashing Action
intents.action:
Check EPCM, KRnBS/#, and ASPF for output path LED issues. 
       If unresolved, seek further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Check for Failed Input Path LED
intents.question: For the failed input path, is the VGL CC availability LED flashing?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Path LED Flashing Action
intents.action:
Check PgUms, S/P-Wdl, KRnA/#, and KRnC/# for input path LED issues. 
        If unresolved, seek further assistance.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Diagnostics
intents.action: If all previous checks do not resolve the issue, further technical support may be required.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Software Alarm Check
intents.question: Is there a 'VCC SW CC' alarm showing with 'CONNECTION WITH CPU 0 DISTURBED'?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Initiate VCC Alarm Syntax Check
intents.question: Can you confirm the alarm syntax matches exactly as stated?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VCC Software Alarm Confirmed
intents.action: Perform a reset or follow standard troubleshooting procedures for VCC software alarm.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC CC Level Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the system showing a 'Working IO' disturbance in 'CC Level Synchronization'?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC RI Connection via S/P-Wdl Card Check
intents.question: Is 'RI via S/P-Wdl' card the active path?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Equalization Check
intents.question: Does the 'Equalization' process show 3 responses on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC SS Command Required on CCOT
intents.action: Proceed with issuing the 'SS' command as required on the CCOT.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are the 'VGL CC' availability LEDs flashing indicating output synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC VGL CC LEDs Flashing Check
intents.question: Confirm if 'VGL CC' LEDs are still flashing after approximately 5 minutes?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Final Action for Output Sync LEDs Flashing
intents.action: If the 'VGL CC' LEDs continue to flash beyond 5 minutes, further troubleshooting is required.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are the 'VGL CC' availability LEDs solid indicating input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc Single CC Final Action for Input Sync LEDs Flashing
intents.action: If the 'VGL CC' LEDs are flashing, wait approximately 5 minutes to confirm if the issue persists.

intents.name: tbtc Single CC End of Flowchart Path
intents.action:
No further issues detected. 
       If the problem persists, refer to the advanced diagnostics manual or contact support.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Power Status Check
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) on?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC No Power LED Response
intents.action: Check the PDU and 3GVCC (Power bar).

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Software Loaded Check
intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly with Binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Software Issue
intents.action: Reload VCC software and verify checksums.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC CC Level Synchronization
intents.question: Is CC Level Synchronization Ri via S/P-VL card and Oi via VgL/Eth card successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Check Ri and Oi paths for S/P-VL and VgL/Eth cards respectively.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Equalisation Check
intents.question: Are there 3 responses on CCOT for equalisation?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Equalisation Issue
intents.action: SS Command required in CCOT for equalisation.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is Output Synchronization successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Verify VGL CC availability LEDs and ensure they are solid, then check for failed output paths.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is Input Synchronization successful with VGL CC availability LEDs solid?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: Verify VGL CC availability LEDs and ensure they are solid, then check all LED status on VGL cards.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC End of Diagnosis
intents.action:
System checks out okay. 
       No further issues detected.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Power Status LED Check
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) off?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC PDU Check
intents.action: Check the PDU and 3G/VCC Power bar.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Software Loaded Check
intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Binary Checksums (RCGs) Check
intents.action: Check Binary Checksums (RCGs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC CC Level Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization correct?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC RI/OI Card Check
intents.question: Is Ri via SP, VI card and Oi via VIgILin card functioning correctly?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Card Synchronization Issue
intents.action:
There is a card synchronization issue; 

       check the Ri and Oi card connections and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Equalisation Check
intents.question: Does equalisation have 3 responses on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC SS Command Required Check
intents.action: SS Command is required on CCOT; execute and verify responses.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is output synchronization successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action:
There is an output synchronization issue; 

       check the output paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are VGL CC availability LEDs solid after input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action:
There is an input synchronization issue; 

       check the input paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Front End Diagnostics Check
intents.question: Are there any responses in the front end diagnostics?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC GUI Red Blanket Check
intents.action: Check the GUI for Red Blanket and closed boarder tracks.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Racks Observations Check
intents.question: Are there cyclic halting of the PEMCs (3G VCC Rack) approximately 90 secs?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Check
intents.action: Check TRG; there might be a cyclic halting issue with PEMCs.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Failed Output Path VGL LED Check
intents.question:
For the failed output path, 
       is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Action Check VGL, K8NSI8, ASPF
intents.action:
Check EPCM, K8NSI8, and ASPF. 
       If no issues found, contact support for VGL.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Redundant Path Recovery Check
intents.action:
All sub-system links can be recovered over the redundant path 
       for the 5 minutes prior to the halt.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Power Status LED Check
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) off?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC PDU Check
intents.action: Check the PDU and 3G/VCC Power bar.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Software Loaded Check
intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Binary Checksums (RCGs) Check
intents.action: Check Binary Checksums (RCGs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC CC Level Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization correct?

intents.question: Is Ri via SP, VI card and Oi via VIgILin card functioning correctly?

intents.action: There is a card synchronization issue; check the Ri and Oi card connections and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Equalisation Check
intents.question: Does equalisation have 3 responses on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC SS Command Required Check
intents.action: SS Command is required on CCOT; execute and verify responses.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is output synchronization successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action: There is an output synchronization issue; check the output paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are VGL CC availability LEDs solid after input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: There is an input synchronization issue; check the input paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Front End Diagnostics Check
intents.question: Are there any responses in the front end diagnostics?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Initial SMC Check
intents.action:
Check the Initial SMC: VCC System Status (white on red) and GUI (Red Blanket). 
       Also, ensure closed border tracks.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Racks Observations Check
intents.question: Are there cyclic halting of the PEMCs (3G VCC Rack) approximately 90 secs?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Check
intents.action: Check TRG; there might be a cyclic halting issue with PEMCs.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Failed Output Path VGL LED Check
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Action Check VGL, K8NSI8, ASPF
intents.action:
Check EPCM, K8NSI8, and ASPF. 
       If no issues found, contact support for VGL.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Redundant Path Recovery Check
intents.action: All sub-system links can be recovered over the redundant path for the 5 minutes prior to the halt.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Intlv/VCC Alarm Syntax Check
intents.question: Is the Intlv/VCC alarm syntax showing THROUGH/SGHTM NOT EXPECTED or CPU H OUTPUT ERRORS?

intents.name:
tbtc TotalVCC Halt Error Post Approx. 
       5 Minutes Check
intents.action: If there are errors after approximately 5 minutes, further investigation is needed for Intlv/VCC alarm syntax issues.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC No Responses Check
intents.question: Are there 0 responses to the initial SMC check?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Closed Boarder Tracks Check

intents.question: Are there 0 responses to the initial SMC check?

intents.action: Check for closed boarder tracks and GUI (Red Blanket).

intents.name:
tbtc TotalVCC Halt Error Post Approx. 
       5 Minutes Check
intents.action: If there are errors after approximately 5 minutes, further investigation is needed for Intlv/VCC alarm syntax issues.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC System Status Check
intents.question: Is the VCC System Status (white on red)?

intents.action: Check all LED status on the TGC cards.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC GUI Red Blanket Check
intents.question: Is the GUI showing a Red Blanket?

intents.action: Investigate the GUI for Red Blanket issues.

intents.action: Investigate for issues related to closed border tracks.

intents.action: Perform final checks and if issue persists, contact support.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC System Status Check
intents.question: Is the VCC System Status white on red?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check All LED Status on TGC Cards
intents.action: Check all LED status on TGC cards for issues.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check GUI Red Blanket
intents.question: Is the GUI showing a Red Blanket error?

intents.action: Investigate GUI for Red Blanket error and resolve.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Closed Border Tracks Check
intents.question: Are there closed border tracks indicated?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Closed Border Tracks Action
intents.action: Investigate and address the closed border tracks issue.

intents.question: In VCC Rack Observations, is there no Power Status LED for power supplies?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC PDU Area Under Suspicion

intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the PEMCs on the VCC Rack?

intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.action: Attempt to recover all sub-system links over the redundant path.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Final Action
intents.action: If all checks are done and the issue persists, escalate to technical support.

intents.question: In VCC Rack Observations, is there no Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies)?

intents.action: Check the PDU and 3G/VCC Power bar.

intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded correctly (Binary Checksums)?

intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization correct?

intents.action: There is a card synchronization issue; check the Ri and Oi card connections and configurations.

intents.question: Does equalisation have 3 responses on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC SS Command Required in CCOT
intents.action: SS Command is required on CCOT; execute and verify responses.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is output synchronization successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Issue Action
intents.action: There is an output synchronization issue; check the output paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Are VGL CC availability LEDs solid after input synchronization?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue Action
intents.action: There is an input synchronization issue; check the input paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Front End Diagnostics Responses Check
intents.question: Are there any responses in the front end diagnostics?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Initial SMC Check
intents.action:
Check the Initial SMC: VCC System Status (white on red) and GUI (Red Blanket). 
       Also, ensure closed border tracks.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Cyclic Halting of PEMCs Check
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the PEMCs (3G VCC Rack) approximately 90 seconds?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Area Under Suspicion
intents.action: Check TRG; there might be a cyclic halting issue with PEMCs.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Failed Output Path VGL LED Check
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VGL Action Check
intents.action: Perform necessary checks on the VGL and related components.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Redundant Path Recovery Check
intents.action: All sub-system links can be recovered over the redundant path for the 5 minutes prior to the halt.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - Cyclic Halting
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the PEMCs (3G VCC Rack) approximately 90 seconds?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Area Under Suspicion
intents.action: Check the TRG area as it is under suspicion for issues.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - Failed Output Path
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VGL Action Required
intents.action: Perform necessary checks on the VGL and related components.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Subsystem Links Recovery
intents.action: Attempt to recover all sub-system links over the redundant path.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - No Power Status LED
intents.question: In VCC Rack Observations, is there no Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies)?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - VGL CC Availability
intents.question: Are VGL CC availability LEDs solid on?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Failed Output Path VGL LED Check
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Action Check VGL, K8NSI8, ASPF
intents.action:
Check EPCM, K8NSI8, and ASPF. 
       If no issues found, contact support for VGL.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Redundant Path Recovery Check
intents.action: All sub-system links can be recovered over the redundant path for the 5 minutes prior to the halt.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Final Fallback Action
intents.action: If all previous checks and actions do not resolve the issue, escalate to technical support.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - No Power Status LED
intents.question: In VCC Rack Observations, is there no Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies)?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - VGL CC Availability
intents.question: Are VGL CC availability LEDs solid on?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - Cyclic Halting
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the PEMCs on the VCC Rack?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Rack Observations - Failed Output Path
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Area Under Suspicion
intents.action: Check TRG; there might be a cyclic halting issue with PEMCs.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check All LED Status on TGC Cards
intents.action: Check all LED status on TGC cards for issues.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VGL Action Required
intents.action: Perform necessary checks on the VGL and related components.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Subsystem Links Recovery
intents.action: Attempt to recover all sub-system links over the redundant path.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC PDU Area Under Suspicion
intents.action: Check the PDU and 3G/VCC Power bar.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Final Fallback Action
intents.action: If all previous checks and actions do not resolve the issue, escalate to technical support.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check Power Status LED
intents.question: Is the Power Status LED (CC Power Supplies) off?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC PDU Suspicion
intents.action: Check the Power Distribution Unit (PDU) and 3G/VCC Power bar.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC VCC Software Check
intents.question: Is the VCC software loaded?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check Binary Checksums
intents.action: Check the Binary Checksums (CRCs) for EPCM on 3G VCC Rack.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC CC Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is the CC level synchronization correct?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check RI and OI Cards
intents.question: Are RI and OI via VIgILin cards functioning correctly?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Card Synchronization Issue
intents.action: There is a card synchronization issue; check the RI and OI card connections and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Equalization Check
intents.question: Does equalization have 3 responses on CCOT?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC SS Command Required
intents.action: An SS Command is required on CCOT; execute and verify responses.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is output synchronization successful?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Output Synchronization Issue
intents.action: There is an output synchronization issue; check the output paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Check
intents.question: Is input synchronization successful with solid VGL CC availability LEDs?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Input Synchronization Issue
intents.action: There is an input synchronization issue; check the input paths and configurations.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Check Front End Responses
intents.question: Are there any responses from the front end diagnostics?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Initial SMC Check
intents.action:
Check the Initial SMC: VCC System Status (white on red) and GUI (Red Blanket). 
       Also, ensure closed border tracks.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Rack Observations Cyclic Halting
intents.question: Is there cyclic halting of the PEMCs (3G VCC Rack) approximately 90 secs?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC TRG Suspicion
intents.action: Check TRG; there might be a cyclic halting issue with PEMCs.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Failed Output Path VGL LED
intents.question: For the failed output path, is the VGL CC availability LED not flashing?

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Action Check VGL
intents.action:
Check EPCM, K8NSI8, and ASPF. 
       If no issues found, contact support for VGL.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Subsystem Recovery Check
intents.action: All sub-system links can be recovered over the redundant path for the 5 minutes prior to the halt.

intents.name: tbtc TotalVCC Final Action
intents.action: Perform final checks and if issue persists, contact support.

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1a
intents.question: View APCC and AWC process, or Category One/Two/Three incident procedure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1a
intents.question: View procedure for reporting incidents to APCC, or AWC process?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1a A1
intents.question:
Procedure 0540 starts with report incidents to APCC. 
       The responsibilities of the APCC/FRC include: 
      Receive and log fault. 
       Assign fault / work order number. 
       Notify the Duty-SIM of full details. 
       Enter fault information into Maximo Asset Data Management System. 
       Register AWCs. 


       

      Has the APCC/FRC receives notification of a signal failure, or view types of notification options?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt K1
intents.question: Is it a SPAD?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1c
intents.question: Is it a fault that self cleared or no cause is found?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1d
intents.question: Is the fault related to signalling computer software?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt Fault1e
intents.question: Is the fault identified not a signal asset based?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A1
intents.question: Would like to view Category One/Two/Three Incident procedure or discuss The APCC/FRC process?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A1
intents.question:
The APCC/FRC receives notification of the fault, 
      is it logged into the Maximo asset data management system?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A1b
intents.question:
APCC will log fault to asset management Maximo system. 
       Have you receive maximo email?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A2
intents.question:
The asset data management system then assigns the fault number. 


       Has the Duty-SIM been notified of the full details of signalling fault?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A3
intents.question:
The Duty-SIM records the fault details and undertakes an initial assessment 

      Has the DSIM assess criticality and potential impact of signal failure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A3b
intents.question: The DSIM must determine how serious this incident is, so as to set its priority, have they done this?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A4
intents.question:
Based on this initial assessment, 
      Has the DSIM allocates a priority and where the need to escalate the fault 
      via the appropriate management channels?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A4
intents.question: Is it a right side, fail-safe, signal failure been reported?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt A4
intents.question: Has a Signalling irregularity been alleged, a wrong side failure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B1
intents.question:
The Duty-SIM identifies the appropriate TO who is competent for the activity in question 
      in accordance with Cat Standard S1203 to attend the fault. 


       The competencies must also include equipment awareness, Safety Critical Licence 

      and On-Track safety certification where applicable. 


       
      Has a T.O. or multiple T.O. 's been notified and sent to the signal failure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B2
intents.question:
When issuing and Authority to Work Certificate (AWC) , 
      the Duty SIM also checks the live AWC list to ensure that the TO has current Safety Critical Licence 
      and is not restricted to work on the signalling equipment/system/area in question. 


       
      Is DSIM done the required AWC checks?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B3
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM provided applicable details to the TO 
      and agrees a method of travel to site with the T.O.?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B4
intents.question:
Agree a safe system of work with the Technical Officer including Live Working briefings. 


       Has the DSIM completed live working briefings and filled in form 

       Power off at all times unless emergency exception. 

       Fuse Out, or escalate for Wire Off (a terminal) for testing?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B4b
intents.question:
Special consideration should be given if any of the following is involved: 

      
      Working at Height 
      Working or Testing on Live Circuits 
      COSHH 
      Asbestos 
      Traction Current 
      Train Movement. 


       

      Has a risk assessment be done?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B4c
intents.question:
Workplace risk assessments which cover fault finding and fault rectification activities, 

      as far as is reasonably practicable, are published and available on the intranet. 


       
      Has the online risk assessment been checked?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B4b
intents.question:
No Live Working, where ever possible, fault finding should be undertaken with feed removed, 

      have traction current off and safe isolation of supply been attempted, 
      or considered if not possible to increase staff safety?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B5
intents.question:
If a delay has been caused, or could be caused, to passenger service. 
       Has there been a liaison between the Duty-SIM and DOME/DOE to ensure full awareness 
      and agreement of the situation or service implications?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B5b
intents.question:
Has DSIM notify NOE and Service Managers of signal failure, 

      if there's a posiblity of service disruption?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B6
intents.question:
On arrival at the fault location, the TO confirms the failure symptoms, 
      updates the Duty SIM to confirm their time on site and agrees the required testing?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B7
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM will keep the DOME/DOE informed of progress 
      and Estimated Restoration of Service (ERoS) on a regular basis 
      (approximately 15 minutes) or as appropriate. 
      ?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt B8
intents.question:
The TO will carry out the agreed checks and tests 
      and update the Duty-SIM every 10 minutes to discuss progress?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C1
intents.question:
Has the TO will inform the Duty-SIM of fault/defective equipment. 


       Is the fault is signalling related?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C2
intents.question: The Duty-SIM will assess if an AWC is required and issue accordingly, is AWC required?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C3
intents.question:
Has the TO completed the permanent or temporary repair as appropriate 
      and inform the Duty-SIM when complete?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C4
intents.question:
On completion of the incident the DSIM will close the failure investigation. 


       
      Has the DSIM updated the relevant details in the Maximo asset data management system?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C5
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM ensure that the TO has completed 
      a detailed failure report with findings 
      and actions and distributed to relevant stakeholders?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C6
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM preserve a copy of the failure report 
      in the approved electronic storage area (Live Link or SharePoint site) 
      accessible to other stake holders for an audit trail?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C7
intents.question:
If a temporary repair has been carried out. 
       Has the Duty-SIM recorded the details of the work 
      that has been completed and any further work that may still be required?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C8
intents.question:
If additional resources are required from other areas 
      e. 
      g. 
       Maintenance, the Duty-SIM will inform the Signals Maintenance Manager (SMM) 
      or Maintenance Operations Manager (MOM) 
      Has the corrective work request been raised?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C9
intents.question:
Has the details of temporary repairs requiring further corrective 
      and/or remedial works that has been communicated verbally to the maintenance units must be followed 
      by confirmation in writing prior to these works being undertaken?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt C10
intents.question:
On completion of the corrective/remedial works. 


       
      Has the SMM/MOM 
      will ensure that the TO has completed a detailed report 
      and informed the Duty-SIM in writing inclusive of the report?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D1
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM will also preserve these reports 
      in the approved storage with the relevant incident failure reports?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D2
intents.question: Is it a fault that self cleared or no cause is found?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D3
intents.question: Has the TO checked through affected circuit(s)?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D4
intents.question:
Has the T.O. recorded applicable information and inform the Duty-SIM 
      forwarding any relevant recorded information?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D5
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM will discuss the facts available 
      and attempt to find a reason for the fault. 
       and has the Duty-SIM will check previous fault history?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D6
intents.question: If no cause can be found, close the failure investigation, inform the APCC?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt D7
intents.question:
Has the TO completed the F0341 Signals Failure/Fault report 
      or complete the failure report using asset data management system?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt E1
intents.question:
If the fault identified is not a signal asset based, 
      has the TO inform the Duty-SIM. 
       Has the Duty-SIM discussed with the TO to confirm that the fault is not a signals based asset, 
      and has the Duty-SIM informed the APCC and request the re-allocation of the failure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt E2
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM will close the failure investigation and inform the TO, 
      and completed and forward F0341 Signals Failure/Fault report 
      or a failure report completed within Asset Data Management System?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt F1
intents.question:
Is the fault related to signalling computer software, 
      has the TO checked and inform the Duty-SIM, 
      has the Duty-SIM discuss details with the TO to confirm that 
      the fault is related to signalling computer software?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt F2
intents.question:
For signalling computer software related faults, 
      the Duty-SIM updates the asset data management system, and informs the APCC 
      and requesting 2nd and 3rd line support as appropriate. 


       
      Has 2nd or 3rd Line been informed?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt G1
intents.question: Has the TO closed the AWC?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt G2
intents.question: Has the Duty-SIM to confirm AWC closure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt H1
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM liaise with the Signals Reparable Manager 
      regarding equipment failures as necessary using the appropriate controlled paperwork and processes?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt H2
intents.question:
Has the Duty-SIM liaise with the Emergency Response Unit (ERU) 
      regarding equipment failures as necessary using the appropriate controlled paperwork and processes?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I1
intents.question:
Investigation of a signalling failure.
