       verify the report to ensure that all the facts are known. 


       
      Has it been reported and recorded correctly?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I2
intents.question:
Interrogate Trackernet and other logging devices, 

      
      has this been done?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I3
intents.question:
remote monitoring records, computer printouts and other recorded data, 

      
      has this been done?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I4
intents.question:
Have you ascertain how the signalling equipment functioned 
      at the time of the allegation of the alleged signalling failure?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I5
intents.question: Have you checked and tested the wiring of the signal concerned including all associated equipment?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt I6
intents.question: Have you checked  a operation of the signal concerned including all associated equipment?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt J1
intents.question:
Has checks been done when required in infollowing areas:

      Interlocking Machine Rooms, 
      Signals, 
      Track Circuits, 
      Axle counter blocks, 
      Trainstops, 
      Points and position of time of failure, 
      Safety Equipment, 
      Non Safety Equipment, 
      Safety Wiring, 
      Non Safety Wiring?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt K1
intents.question: Has a method statement been made for testing following a SPAD?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt K2
intents.question:
Has checks been doone to interrogate Trackernet and other logging devices, 
      computer printouts and other recorded data, 
      remote monitoring records to ascertain how the signalling equipment functioned at the time of the SPAD?

intents.name: PR0540 Inmgnt K3
intents.question:
Has checks and test be done on the wiring and operation of the signal concerned, 
      including all associated equipment including:      

      Track Circuits, 
      Relevant Axle counter blocks, 
      Trainstops, 
      Points, 
      Safety and Non Safety Equipment, /n       Safety and Non Safety Wiring?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_A1
intents.question:
So there a disturbance to working signal assets. 


       Has a Signalling irregularity been alleged?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_B1
intents.question:
Has the Duty Signal Incident Manager (DSIM) ensured that the integrity of 
      the Signalling System is maintained by withdrawing from service the asset 
      and any signals which authorise train movement over the asset?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_B2
intents.question:
Has withdrawal of the asset wth alleged irregularity been achieved by: 

      Instructing London Underground (LU) Operations or the Signaller controlling the asset 
      that the route button/switch or lever is to be collared?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_C1
intents.question:
Has the DSIM arrange for: 

      Written statements from any witnesses to the alleged irregularity?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_C2
intents.question:
Has the DSIM arrange for: 

      Witnesses to the alleged irregularity remain available for interview, 
      via LU Operations or applicable line management?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_C3
intents.question:
Has the DSIM arrange for: 

      Attendance of Signal technician, normally call Technical Officer (TO)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_C4
intents.question:
Has the DSIM arrange for: 

      Escalation to the on-call Duty Signal Manager or Lead Incident Manager (LIM)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_C5
intents.question:
Has the DSIM arrange for: 

      Discussion and agreement regarding the interview stage, 
      on the levels of attendance with all key stakeholders?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_D1
intents.question:
It should be noted that direct signals department input is desirable at the interview stage. 


       Has signal departmant been involve in developing the appropriate interview questions, 
      that are being formulated?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_D2
intents.question:
Has the DSIM ensured that any interviews will result in a written statement, 
      being produced within 24 hours of the interview?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_E1
PR0702_Temp_Rep_E2
intents.question:
Is the DSIM aware of any additional measures maybe instructed to be carried out, 
      by the Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_F1
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the Duty Signal Manager 
      and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 


       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: Lifting relay(s) lids?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_F2
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Removal of electrical fuses?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_F3
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Removal of electrical links?

intents.name: pr0702_temp_rep_f4
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Removal of controlling signal lamps?

intents.name: pr0702_temp_rep_f5
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Removing air supplies?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_F6
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Scotching and clipping of points?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_F7
intents.question:
Measures maybe instructed to be carried out by the 
      Duty Signal Manager and /or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Is DSIM aware that these measures may include: 

      Maintaining Signals at Danger?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_G1
intents.question:
At all times has every practicable effort been taken to preserve evidence, 
      whilst ensuring the integrity of the Signalling System is maintained?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_G2
intents.question:
Has the DSIM and Service Control (Operatons) noted that through maintaining 
      the integrity of the Signalling System there is potentially 
      of adverse effect on quality and possibly levels of evidence preserved?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_G3
intents.question:
In order to maximise preservation of evidence it may be necessary to consider the possibility of: 

      Diverting the train service?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_G4
intents.question:
In order to maximise preservation of evidence it may be necessary to consider the possibility of: 

      Suspending the train service?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H1
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H2
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Asset status?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H3
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Monitoring systems (transmitton, computer logs, etc)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H4
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Photographic?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H5
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Written witness statements?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H6
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Recorded witness statements?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H7
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Closed Circuit Television images?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H8
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Records of communications, i. 
      e. 
       text messages, e-mails?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H9
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with the Duty Signal Manager 
      and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE)Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      Hard evidence, i. 
      e removed or damaged assets?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_H10
intents.question:
The level of evidence requiring preservation shall be agreed with 
      the Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE). 
       Types of evidence can be: 

      computer Logs (lever arrays etc)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_I1
intents.question:
Has the DSIM deemed it necessary to liaise with the Maintenance Managers 
      and their teams if service is returned following temporary repair?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_I2
intents.question:
Has the DSIM deemed it necessary to liaise with the Maintenance Managers 
      and their teams if service is returned 
      and further investigations during engineering hours are required?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_I3
intents.question:
Has the Maintenance teams are fully informed and briefed as to the nature 
      of the incident prior to any further corrective action or remedial works commencing?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_I4
intents.question:
The Maintenance teams are fully informed and briefed as to the evidence 
      required prior to any further corrective action or remedial works commencing?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_J1
intents.question:
Returning Signalling assets to service following an allegation against 
      the Signalling System will be agreed by the On-Call Duty Signal Manager 
      and/or DSSE following review of results of investigations and resultant evidence?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_J2
intents.question:
Dependent on the circumstances of the incident 
      other parties may need to be involved in these deliberations?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_J3
intents.question:
Examples of other parties that may need to be involved are:  

      The Professional Head of Signalling (or their nominated representatives) 
      or the Signalling Design Authority?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K1
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Identify the appropriate level of staff competence required to carry out the investigation?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K2
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Identify the appropriate level of staff competence required to reinstate the signalling?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K2
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Critical Incident testing?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_k3
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Fault Tree Analysis?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K4
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Identify the appropriate level of testing to be carried out 
      and this has been completed?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K5
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Any remedial actions have been carried out?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K6
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      All supporting documentation has been properly completed?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_K7
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      All supporting documentation has been available for review?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_L1
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Review Authority to Work Certificates?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_L2
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Review wire count sheets?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_L3
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Review circuit diagrams?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_L4
intents.question:
Before returning the signalling assets to operational service 
      Has the On Call Duty Signal Manager and/or Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE) will: 

      Review test plans?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_M1
intents.question:
Dependent on the circumstance the key stakeholders will discuss 
      and agree whether a partial hand-back is applicable?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_M2
intents.question:
Dependent on the circumstance the key stakeholders will discuss 
      and agree whether a full hand-back is applicable?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N1
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      Full discussion with LU Operations, 
      including notification to the Chief Operation Officer (COO)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N2
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      A documented test plan covering maintenance?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N3
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      A documented test plan covering functional testing?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N4
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      A documented test plan covering wire counting?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N5
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      A documented test plan covering anything deemed appropriate 
      and agreed in discussions for hand-back?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_N6
intents.question:
If a full hand-back is to be undertaken, 
      then prior to hand-back there must be: 

      A documented test plan covering discussions for hand-back and Formal written notification 
      to the Maintenance unit of any further corrective or remedial works required?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O1
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      Alternative routes if available?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O2
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      points clipped and scotched?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O3
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      signal Route Lights removed?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O4
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      offer debate to LU Operations on train service in degraded mode, e. 
      g. 
       Station to Station?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O5
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      Removal of fuses?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O6
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      agreed plan for next steps, including arrangements for test plan?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O7
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      agreed plan for next steps, including arrangements for appropriate peer review?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O8
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      agreed plan for next steps, including arrangements for assurance?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_O9
intents.question:
If a partial hand-back is decided, 
      then prior to hand-back consideration must be given to: 

      agreed plan for next steps, including arrangements for Engineering Hour testing. 
      ?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_P1
intents.question:
Full documented records will be maintained, in electronic 
      and hardcopy format as deemed most applicable, in a structured and accessible manner?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_P2
intents.question:
Responsibility for the collection and maintenance of said records will lay 
      with the DSIM at the time of the alleged irregularity being recorded?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_Q1
intents.question:
On closure of the alleged irregularity the DSIM will 
      forward the appropriate details to the applicabale Maintenance unit?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_Q2
intents.question:
On closure of the alleged irregularity the DSIM will forward the appropriate details 
      to the Lead Incident Manager (LIM) considering and discussing with the LIM what if 
      any records need to be maintained within the incident management team for training?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_Q3
intents.question:
On closure of the alleged irregularity the DSIM 
      will forward the appropriate details to the Lead Incident Manager (LIM) considering 
      and discussing with the LIM what if any records need to be 
      maintained within the incident management team for reference purposes?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_Q4
intents.question:
The Signal Infrastructure Manager for the applicable maintenance unit will consider 
      on receipt of records the appropriate local retention times, prior to records being archived?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_Q5
intents.question:
In line with Cat 1 standard requirements, records are to be maintained 
      for the working life of the assets in question?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_R1
intents.question:
Primary responsibilities lay with the DSIM, the Lead Incident Manager (LIM), 
      the Duty Signal Manager and the Duty Senior Signalling Engineer (DSSE)?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_R2
intents.question: Secondary responsibilities lay with the Management teams from the Maintenance Units?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_S1
intents.question:
Asset based Workplace Risk Assessments including coverage of fault rectification activities 
      on Signals assets are published and available on the Intranet?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_S2
intents.question:
Asset based Environmental Risk Assessments (Aspects and Impacts registers) including coverage of 
      fault rectification activities on Signal assets are published and available on the Intranet?

intents.name: PR0702_Temp_Rep_A1
intents.question:
Alleged Signalling irregularity procedure 702 is complee. 
        Return to home menu?

intents.name: PR53AWC_A1
intents.question:
Lets establish if an Authority to Work Certificate (AWC) is required. 
      



      Does the work on signalling either interrupts or interferes 
      with the workings of the commissioned signal system?

intents.name: PR53AWC_A2
intents.question:
Authority to Work Certificate (AWC) is not required. 
      

      Would you like to continue the AWC procedure?

intents.name: PR53AWC_A3
intents.question: Does a pre-commissioning work involve a level of risk to the commissioned signal system?

intents.name: PR53AWC_A4
intents.question: Is it planned work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_A5
intents.question: Is it emergency work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_B1
intents.question:
T.O. 
      has received an AWC. 
      

      \n   Has the AWC authoriser added details of the specific scope 
   
      and the work prior to it being undertaken?

intents.name: PR53AWC_B2
intents.question:
Is T.O. 
      aware of the required work that the AWC will certify on completion?

intents.name: PR53AWC_B3
intents.question:
Is T.O. 
      aware to use the AWC to record the details of what was undertaken, 
   when 
      and by whom, for retention 
      and archiving?

intents.name: PR53AWC_B4
intents.question:
Is T.O. 
      aware that the AWC forms part of a Safety Critical Process for managing 

      
      and recording all work on the signal 
      and control systems?

intents.name: PR53AWC_b5
intents.question:
Has the T.O. 
      checked that the scope of all interference is appropriately defined?

intents.name: PR53AWC_C1
intents.question:
Has the DSIM formally authorised AWC 
      and registered with the LU ACC prior to commencement?

intents.name: PR53AWC_C2
intents.question:
Is T.O. 
      
      and DSIM aware that Interference shall be undertaken only by persons who are competent to do so?

intents.name: PR53AWC_C3
intents.question:
The outcome of the interference, 
      and the return to operational service, shall be controlled 
      and recorded?

intents.name: PR53AWC_D1
intents.question:
AWC required for any signal engineering task on the operational railway which: 

      Interrupts or interferes with the workings of the commissioned signal system 

      (such as a disconnection, or the removal of a component in order to change it)?

intents.name: PR53AWC_D2
intents.question:
AWC required for any signal engineering task on the operational railway which: 

      Makes an adjustment or alteration to a working system (such as a track circuit feed, or the angle of a signal head)?

intents.name: PR53AWC_D3
intents.question:
AWC required for any signal engineering task on the operational railway which: 

      Disturbs a working system in a way which carries a significant risk of affecting its correct operation shall only be undertaken following the issue of an AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_D4
intents.question:
The determination of what constitutes a significant risk 
      is generally a matter to be decided between the Issuer 
      and the Receiver of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_E1
intents.question:
AWCs issued either as a: a) Safety AWCs, 
      which shall be used for all work on vital systems 
      (including diverse monitoring systems such as Programmable Logic Controllers used to directly restrict vital functions), 
      but excluding solely mechanical work on the airmain?

intents.name: PR53AWC_E2
intents.question:
AWCs issued either as a: Non-Safety AWCs, 
      which shall be used for all other work not covered by (a) above?

intents.name: PR53AWC_E3
intents.question:
Every AWC shall have a unique identifier, 
      prefixed by the letter S for Safety AWC 
      and NS for Non-Safety AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_F1
intents.question:
F0337 An Authority to Issue/Receive AWCs  Verification Checklist 
      is forwarded to the IRSE Assessing Agent Manager for all staff authorised to issue 
      and/or receive AWCs?

intents.name: PR53AWC_F2
intents.question:
Additionally for all agency 
      and external AWC issuers 
      and receivers, F5398 the Competence Matrix Checklist shall be completed 
      and forwarded to LU?

intents.name: PR53AWC_F3
intents.question: For all LU internal staff competence is recorded through SAP , Versatility Matrices or any other suitable means?

intents.name: PR53AWC_F4
intents.question:
In all cases all AWC receivers 
      and Issuers must be approved by LU 
      and their names will then appear on the AWC list?

intents.name: PR53AWC_G1
intents.question:
For IRSE licence workplace/competence assessment purposes only, 
      AWCs may be issued to unlicensed staff?

intents.name: PR53AWC_G2
intents.question:
On completion of the work involved in the assessment, 
      the AWC shall be signed off by the person to whom it was issued 
      and countersigned by the licence holder attending the assessment in each place where the person being assessed has signed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_G3
intents.question:
In this case the name of the supervising IRSE licensed person, 
      who must have a valid entry on the current AWC list, will have to be supplied to the LU ACC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H1
intents.question: The AWC entry for the Issuer on the AWC list will incorporate a note to this effect?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H2
intents.question:
The Issuer of the AWC shall validate 
      and sign Section 1 of the AWC. 
      In signing Section 1 the Issuer is authorising the task prior to it being carried out?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H3
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The scope of the work is properly defined?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H4
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      that the Issuer 
      and the Receiver of the AWC interpret the scope in the same way?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H5
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The scope of the work shall always be properly defined?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H6
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      but it is accepted that in certain cases a degree of choice may be permitted?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H7
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      This might apply, for example, to the disconnection 
      and reconnection of track circuits by a Signal Technician operating in support of a Track Maintenance gang, where the exact details of which track circuits will need to be disconnected cannot be known beforeh
      and?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H8
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      In signing off the AWC the Receiver shall indicate the exact details of the work actually undertaken?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H9
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The accountable person for the work (i.e. 
      the Receiver) is named?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H10
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The proposed task is a right 
      and proper piece of work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H11
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      It is right to do it at the time that is proposed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H12
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The nominated accountable person is authorised to receive AWCs 
      and is competent to undertake the work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H13
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The necessary pre-conditions have been satisfied. 
      This may include such things as the satisfactory completion of pre-testing where appropriate, or the confirmation of existing blockjoint positions against the scale plan before track renewal or points correlation activities?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H14
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The necessary preparations have been made. 
      This may include such things as ensuring that appropriate resources 
      and information are available?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H15
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The appropriate sections of the AWC certificate are correctly completed prior to the commencement of work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H16
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      Where the Issuer is the person who registers the AWC, then the Issuer must make the request verbally by telephone; irrespective of whether or not a copy of the AWC is subsequently e-mailed to the LU ACC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H17
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      The Receiver is suitably licensed 
      and suitably trained 
      and all external 
      and agency staff must also hold a valid F5398 Competence Matrix Checklist 
      and in date Medical certification?

intents.name: PR53AWC_H18
intents.question:
Authorising an AWC involves verifying that: 
      All LU internal staff must have their training 
      and competence records locally held through SAP, Versatility Matrices or any other suitable means?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I1
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      They are themselves recognised by the IRSE Assessing Agent Manager as licensed to undertake the class of work they are authorising, 
      and they hold an appropriate supervisory appointment (or above) as direct employees?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I2
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      They are accredited in writing by the Professional Head Signals/Lead Maintenance Assurance Engineer, T&C Asset Engineer or their delegated representative, to issue AWCs for particular purposes?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I3
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      This category shall apply to Senior Managers?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I4
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      This category shall apply to Professional Head of Signals, Lead Maintenance Assurance Engineer, 
      and T&C Asset Engineer?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I5
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      This category shall apply to previously IRSE licensed persons or others whose present role does not require them to maintain a current IRSE licence, but does require them to issue AWCs 
      and whose competence has been established 
      and acknowledged by the Head of Profession or the delegated authority such as Lead Maintenance Assurance Engineer, T&C Asset Engineer 
      and must be registered with IRSE Assessing Agent Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I6
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      This category shall apply to competent employees of contractors, consultants, LUL or other agencies, nominated by their employers for accreditation?

intents.name: PR53AWC_I7
intents.question:
Issuers shall be deemed to be accredited to issue AWCs if: 
      This category shall apply to An Authority to Issue/Receive AWCs  Verification Checklist F0337 
      and Competence Matrix Checklist has been completed 
      and forwarded to the IRSE Assessing Agent Manager for acceptance, where authorisation has been provided by the Head of profession or delegated authority?

intents.name: PR53AWC_J1
intents.question:
For Safety AWCs, 
      Issuers shall normally be at least one grade senior to the Receiver. 
      Permitted exceptions to this are where: 
      an IRSE licensed Tester-in-Charge holds an overall AWC for a piece of work 
      and issues further AWCs to other Testers under their comm
      and for the execution of parts of that work. 
      The accountable TIC can on small pieces of work have the sole accountable AWC to cover all works?

intents.name: PR53AWC_J2
intents.question:
For Safety AWCs, Issuers shall normally be at least one grade senior to the Receiver. 
      Permitted exceptions to this are where: 
      AWCs are issued by an IRSE licensed Principles Tester?

intents.name: PR53AWC_J3
intents.question:
For Safety AWCs, Issuers shall normally be at least one grade senior to the Receiver. 
      Permitted exceptions to this are where: 
      an Incident or Maintenance Manager issues an AWC to a colleague of the same grade 
      who is acting in a lesser capacity for the specific task detailed in the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_K1
intents.question:
Use of AWC - Before the authorised work commences, the AWC shall be registered with the LU ACC 
      and a target time for closure of the AWC agreed. 
      Registration may be carried out by the Issuer or the Receiver, but the Receiver shall be satisfied that it has been done?

intents.name: PR53AWC_K2
intents.question:
Use of AWC - Before the authorised work commences, 
      when the work is about to commence, 
      this shall be communicated to the LU ACC by the Receiver of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L1
intents.question:
The Receiver shall not exceed the scope of work detailed on the AWC. 
      Any other work required shall necessitate the issue of a further AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L2
intents.question:
a fully authorised amendment 
      and re-registration of the existing AWC by the original Issuer 
      or the Receiver to update LU ACC following agreement with issuing authority?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L3
intents.question:
On satisfactory completion of the work, including all necessary testing, 
      the Receiver shall complete Section 2 of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L4
intents.question:
This shall include full details of the actual interference, 
      which in many cases will require amplification 
      of the scope statement given in Section 1 of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L5
intents.question:
If no temporary irregular connections have been made 
      then Nil or None shall be entered in the Additional Declaration?

intents.name: PR53AWC_L6
intents.question:
The Receiver shall sign 
      and date both the Certification 
      and the Additional Declaration?

intents.name: PR53AWC_M1
intents.question:
In signing Section 2, 
      the Receiver is certifying that all the affected assets have been tested, 
      are working correctly 
      and safely, 
      and are fit for service?

intents.name: PR53AWC_M2
intents.question:
In signing Section 2, 
      that any temporary irregular connections needed for the work, 
      either electrical or mechanical, 
      are listed and have been removed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_M3
intents.question:
In signing Section 2, 
      that appropriate gauges have been used for critical tasks where required 
      and are listed on the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_M4
intents.question:
In signing Section 2, 
      This certification shall be complete before the affected 
      signal system is made available for operational use, 
      except as provided for in the use of AWCs for emergency work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_N1
intents.question:
If the Receiver becomes aware that the work cannot be certified 
      as required by clause 3.4.4, 
      the Line Controller shall immediately be informed 
      so that appropriate operational controls can be instigated?

intents.name: PR53AWC_N2
intents.question:
If the Receiver becomes aware that the work cannot be certified 
      as required by clause 3.4.4, 
      The Issuer shall also be informed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_N3
intents.question:
Certification shall be registered (commonly referred to as clearing the AWC) 
      with the LU ACC before (or concurrently with) the h
      andback of the signal system to the Operator at or before the closure time agreed. 
      If clause 3.4.5 applies, the situation shall still be registered?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O1
intents.question:
For emergency work when either the Issuer is unable to generate a written AWC, 
      or the Receiver is unable to physically receive the AWC, 
      then authorisation for the work may be given verbally provided that: a) the verbal authorisation is given directly from the Issuer to the Receiver (not via any third party)?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O2
intents.question:
For emergency work when either the Issuer is unable to generate a written AWC, 
      or the Receiver is unable to physically receive the AWC, 
      then authorisation for the work may be given verbally provided that: 
      the requirements of 3.3.2 clauses (a) to (j) excluding (h) are met?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O3
intents.question:
For emergency work when either the Issuer is unable to generate a written AWC, 
      or the Receiver is unable to physically receive the AWC, 
      then authorisation for the work may be given verbally provided that: the number of the AWC to be issued is notified to the Receiver, 
      ideally before the commencement of the work, or else as soon as practicable thereafter 
      and always by the end of the Receivers working shift; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O4
intents.question:
For emergency work when either the Issuer is unable to generate a written AWC, 
      or the Receiver is unable to physically receive the AWC, 
      then authorisation for the work may be given verbally 
      provided that: 
      The verbal AWC is registered with the LU ACC using a temporary dummy number 
      if the actual number is not immediately available. 
      The dummy number shall comprise the initials of the Issuer together 
      with their employee number or IRSE licence number, 
      if more than oner AWC needs to be issued it will be mark as /1, /2 
      and so on after the issuers employee or IRSE number; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O5
intents.question:
For emergency work when either the Issuer is unable to generate a written AWC, 
      or  the Receiver is unable to physically receive the AWC, 
      then authorisation for the work  may be given verbally provided that:  
      the written AWC shall be completed 
      and certified in retrospect, 
      within 24 hours  of the verbal authorization?

intents.name: PR53AWC_O6
intents.question:
Other than emergency tasks covered by clause 3.4.7 above, 
      no person shall be empowered to undertake work requiring an AWC unless they are in physical possession of the authorised AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_P1
intents.question:
Physical possession of an AWC (in relation to clauses 3.4.7 above) shall, 
      when necessary, be permitted to include a copy of the original AWC transmitted 
      via electronic means or e-mail, 
      provided it is clearly legible. 
      Where this arrangement is adopted: a) the Issuer 
      and Receiver shall confer, 
      to confirm that the copy is complete 
      and legible, 
      and of suitable durability; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_P2
intents.question:
Physical possession of an AWC (in relation to clauses 3.4.7 above) shall, 
      when necessary, 
      be permitted to include a copy of the original AWC 
      transmitted via electronic means or e-mail, 
      provided it is clearly legible. 
      Where this arrangement is adopted: 
      The Issuer shall, 
      on receipt of such confirmation, 
      endorse the original AWC across Section 2 with the words 
      SCANNED/PHOTOGRAPH /E-MAILED TO RECEIVER, 
      and print / retain it until such time as the completed AWC is returned for review, 
      after which the original shall be attached to this copy; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_P3
intents.question:
Physical possession of an AWC (in relation to clauses 3.4.7 above) shall, 
      when necessary, be permitted to include a copy of the original 
      AWC transmitted via electronic means or e-mail, 
      provided it is clearly legible. 
      Where this arrangement is adopted: 
      In this instance the scanned / photograph / electronic copy 
      shall be treated by the Receiver as if it were the original?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Q1
intents.question:
Copies printed on thermally sensitive paper are not sufficiently durable 
      and will not be accepted for this purpose. 
      Copies received on a plain paper fax machine are acceptable?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Q2
intents.question:
Completed AWCs, 
      whether originals, 
      e-mail copies, 
      must always be physically returned to the Issuer for review?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Q3
intents.question: An AWC must be available within 48 hours if requested?

intents.name: pr536awc_q4
intents.question:
Is DSIM aware that AWCs are not transferable, 

      so can not be given/issued to another person?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Q5
intents.question:
Review of AWCs 3.5.1 On completion 
      and certification of the work the Receiver shall return the AWC to the Issuer for review 
      and sign off?

intents.name: PR53AWC_R1
intents.question: The Issuer shall verify that all AWCs they have issued have been returned for review?

intents.name: PR53AWC_R2
intents.question:
The Issuer shall review the details of the completed AWC 
      to ensure that the procedure has been carried out correctly?

intents.name: PR53AWC_R3
intents.question:
The Issuer shall sign the final review section 
      and pass it to the Designated Manager for sign off?

intents.name: PR53AWC_s1
intents.question:
The Designated Manager shall review the details 
      of the completed certificate to ensure that 
      the AWC procedure has been correctly applied?

intents.name: pr536awc_s2
intents.question:
The Designated manager shall sign the final review section 
      and retain for archiving later?

intents.name: PR53AWC_S3
intents.question:
In clauses 3.5.2 and 3.5.3 the signatures 
      shall indicate that the review has taken place, 
      not that the result of the review has been satisfactory?

intents.name: PR53AWC_S4
intents.question:
Appropriate action shall be taken if the review indicates shortcomings 
      in the operation or application of the AWC procedure?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T1
intents.question:
Cancellation of AWCs 3.6.1 AWCs may be cancelled when: 
      The scope of work specified is substantially changed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T2
intents.question:
Cancellation of AWCs 3.6.1 AWCs may be cancelled when: 
      The work specified cannot be carried out?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T3
intents.question:
Cancellation of AWCs 3.6.1 AWCs may be cancelled when: 
      The person charged with completing the work on the AWC is changed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T4
intents.question:
Cancellation of AWCs 3.6.1 AWCs may be cancelled when: 
      An AWC is issued in error?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T5
intents.question:
When an AWC is cancelled, 
      this shall be clearly indicated on the certificate 
      by writing  'cancelled' across the length of the certificate?

intents.name: PR53AWC_T6
intents.question:
However it must still be signed off by the Issuer 
      and Designated Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC_U1
intents.question: The LU ACC shall be informed by the Issuer or the Receiver that the AWC has been cancelled?

intents.name: PR53AWC_U2
intents.question:
Responsibilities the Issuer of the AWC, 
      who is registered as competent 
      and authorised with the IRSE Assessing Agent Manager 
      is responsible for authorising the work before it can be carried out?

intents.name: PR53AWC_U3
intents.question: for reviewing the completed AWC after the work has been carried out?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V1
intents.question:
In authorising the work, 
      the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The scope of the work is properly defined, 
      and that the Issuer 
      and the Receiver of the AWC interpret the scope in the same way?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V2
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The accountable person for the work (i.e. 
      the Receiver) is named?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V3
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The proposed task is a right 
      and proper piece of work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V4
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      It is right to do it at the time that is proposed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V5
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The nominated accountable person is authorised to receive AWCs 
      and is competent to undertake the work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V6
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The necessary pre-conditions have been satisfied?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V7
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The necessary preparations have been made?

intents.name: pr536awc_v8
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      The appropriate sections of the AWC certificate 
      are correctly completed prior tothe commencement of work?

intents.name: PR53AWC_V9
intents.question:
In authorising the work, the Issuer shall verify that: 
      Where the Issuer is the person who registers the AWC, 
      then the Issuer mustmake the request verbally by telephone; 
      irrespective of whether or not a copyof the AWC is faxed or e-mailed to the LU-ACC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W1
intents.question:
the Receiver is suitably licensed for the task 
      and has the competence to workon the system 
      or equipment in question according to the training 
      andcompetence records 
      and a valid safety critical licence. 
      In case of external staffalso has a valid Competence Matrix Checklist 
      and Medical certification?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W2
intents.question: return AWC to your delivery area manager one month of issue date?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W3
intents.question:
The Issuer shall ensure that used AWC books issued for Internal 
      and External staffcontaining the bottom copies of the issued AWCs 
      are returned to the delivery areamanager (such as the Signal Manager) for retention?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W4
intents.question:
The Receiver of the AWC, who should be competent 
      and authorised to receiveAWCs, 
      is responsible for certifying that the task has been satisfactorily completed 
      before the assets are returned to service,?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W5
intents.question:
in particular that: 
      If they have concerns over their competence to carry out the particular work on 
      the AWC they must raise these with the Issuer of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W6
intents.question:
all the affected assets have been tested, are working correctly 
      and safely, 
      and are fit for service?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W7
intents.question:
any temporary irregular connections needed for the work are listed 
      and have been removed?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W8
intents.question:
appropriate 
      and calibrated gauges/equipment have been used for critical tasks where required?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W9
intents.question:
are listed on the AWC along with their serial numbers 
      andgauges record where available?

intents.name: PR53AWC_W10
intents.question:
The records of serial numbers 
      and calibrationdates of any calibrated equipment must be 
      recorded appropriately such as on the AWC, QAF or AMIS?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X1
intents.question:
Where the Receiver is unable to complete the work specified on the AWC they must, 
      as soon as possible during the work, 
      inform the issuing authority of the AWC 
      andtheir immediate manager of this?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X2
intents.question:
The Receiver is also responsible for: 
      Ensuring that the AWC is registered with the LU-ACC prior to thecommencement of work. 
      This must be done verbally by telephone, 
      irrespectiveof whether or not a copy of the AWC is faxed or e-mailed to the LU-ACC. 
      Thisis to ensure that the names of the Issuer 
      and Receiver can be checked againstthe current AWC list?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X3
intents.question:
The Receiver is also responsible for providing contact details 
      and a provisional Clearance Time for the AWC to the  LU-ACC?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X4
intents.question:
The Receiver is also responsible for: 
      When the work is about to commence informing the LU-ACC of this; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X5
intents.question:
The Receiver is also responsible for: 
      Registering the sign-off 
      or cancelling of the AWC with the LU-ACC on  completion of the work; ?

intents.name: PR53AWC_X6
intents.question:
The Receiver is also responsible for: 
      Immediately alerting the Line Controller 
      if the signal system cannot be certifiedas fit for service 
      and escalating this information to their local manager 
      and theDuty Incident Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Y1
intents.question:
Anyone being approved as an issuer for the first time, 
      or anyone previously removedfrom the AWC register 
      following a substantiated complaint must be interviewed &approved by an Authoriser?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Y2
intents.question:
If successful, the authoriser will complete F0337 
      and approve the applicant to issueSafety & Non-Safety AWCs 
      and/or Non-Safety AWCs only. 
      Where required, detailsof actual scope of work 
      and any associated constraints may also be listed on theform?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Y3
intents.question:
A controlled list of authorisers will be maintained by 
      the Principal Engineering Leader- Maintenance Assurance, 
      and those seeking to be added to the authorisers list 
      will be required to be interviewed 
      and seek final sign off by the PEL (MaintenanceAssurance)?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Y4
intents.question:
If the authoriser is not the employing manager, 
      the completed F0337 should then beforwarded to the Employing Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC Y5
intents.question:
The employing manager or a single nominated deputy will sign off F0337 
      to confirmthey are happy with the restrictions in place 
      and agree that the licence holder can beplaced on the AWC list 
      as a receiver or issuer accordingly?

intents.name: PR53AWC Y6
intents.question: The completed F0337 is forwarded to the Assessing Agency Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z1
intents.question:
The IRSE Assessing Agency Manager shall be responsible for establishing 
      andmaintaining an AWC list of Authorised Issuers 
      and Receivers, (including agency ordirectly employed contractors)?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z2
intents.question:
The IRSE Assessing Agency Manager shall be responsible with details of any restrictions, 
      permitted to: (A) Issue Authority to Work on Safety Systems Certificates?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z3
intents.question:
The IRSE Assessing Agency Manager shall be responsible with details of any restrictions, 
      permitted to: (A) Issue Authority to Work on Non-Safety Systems Certificates?

intents.name: PR53AWC_Z4
intents.question:
The IRSE Assessing Agency Manager shall be responsible with details of any restrictions, 
      permitted to: (B) Receive Authority to Work on Safety Systems Certificates?

intents.name: PR53AWC_z5
intents.question:
The IRSE Assessing Agency Manager shall be responsible with details of any restrictions, 
      permitted to: (B) Receive Authority to Work on Non-Safety Systems Certificates?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 A1
PR53AWC Z6 A2
intents.question:
The Assessing Agency Manager (AAM) will ensure; 
      Axiom is updated accordingly in order for the LU-ACC 
      to check when an AWC isregistered that the Issuer 
      and Receiver are shown on the AWC register 
      as beingauthorised to respectively issue 
      and receive AWCs?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 A3
PR53AWC Z6 A4
intents.question:
The Assessing Agency Manager (AAM) will ensure; For all agency 
      and external staff, 
      a signed copy of the Competence Matrix Checklist 
      F5398 will held by Assessing Agency?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B1
intents.question:
The Designated Manager / Delivery Area Manager shall be responsible for review 
      and final authorisation ofthe AWC, 
      arranging the retention of all completed AWC books for archiving later?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B2
intents.question:
F0337 Authority to Issue / Receive AWCs  verification checklist F0337 
      shall be used in order to authorise a licence holder to be placed on the AWC 
      provided the licence holder is in a position to be put on the AWC list 
      as soon as theyreceive their licence 
      i.e., this process should not be used for apprentices?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B3
intents.question:
Use of form F0337 for Receivers As part of the IRSE Licensing assessment, 
      if the applicant requires to go on the AWC list , 
      the Competency Assessor (CA) is also required to ensure the applicant underst
      ands the AWC process 
      and the role 
      and responsibilities of an AWC holder. 
      Once satisfied the CA will need to complete F0337 
      also recording any restrictions thatwould apply to the applicant for receiving AWCs?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B4
PR53AWC Z6 B5
PR53AWC Z6 B6
intents.question:
The F0337 will be completed by the CA for receivers of AWCs when; 
      Where restrictions require updating?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B7
intents.question:
Use of form F0337 for AWC Issuers The form F0337 
      shall be completed by the CA for issuers of AWCs 
      only when the applicant has previously been approved 
      and signed off by an authoriser 
      and employing manager (or representative) 
      and has previously been on the AWC list. 
      The AWC Verification form should be completed by a CA at an Issuer level in thisinstance?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 B8
intents.question: The completed F0337 is then forwarded to the Employing Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C1
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 
      The LU-ACC is responsible for Checking when the AWC is registered that the Issuer 
      and Receiver are shown on the AWC list as being authorised to respectively issue 
      and receive AWCs. 
      If either is not authorised then the request to register the AWC shall be refused. 
      In the case of contractors identified in paragraph 3.2.6 of this procedure the LU-ACC will check the name of the Issuer only against the AWC list. 
      The name of the Receiver will be registered 
      but need not be checked against the AWC list?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C2
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for The procurement 
      and issue of AWC books to staff authorised to issue AWCs?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C3
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Maintaining a register of book issue, 
      to include the name of the individual to whom the book is issued, 
      the AWC numbers contained in the book, 
      the issue date of the AWC book 
      and the return date for the completed book?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C4
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Retention of returned used AWC books containing the bottom copy of each issued AWC. 
      These are to be retained within the LU-ACC for a period of two years. 
      They shall then be archived 
      and retained for the lifetime of the asset?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C5
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Maintaining the AWC record database which shall include as a minimum the following details: 
      date of issue of the AWC, 
      AWC number, 
      site of work, 
      brief description of nature of work, 
      AWC Issuer, 
      AWC Receiver, 
      time AWC registered, 
      time work commenced, 
      time AWC cleared, 
      a record of receipt of reviewed 
      and authorised hard copy of the top sheet of the AWC?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C6
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Retention, storage 
      and eventual archiving of the reviewed 
      and authorised originals of the top sheets of the AWCs. 
      These shall be stored in numerical order 
      and retained within the LU-ACC to provide immediate access for 12 months. 
      They shall then be archived 
      and retained for the lifetime of the asset?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C7
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Where the AWC is not closed by the agreed target time (paragraph 3.4.1) escalation of this fact firstly to the Issuer of the AWC 
      and then to the Duty Incident Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 C8
intents.question:
London Underground Asset Control Centre (LU-ACC) 4.8.1 The LU-ACC 
      is responsible for Where the fully completed 
      and authorised AWC is not returned to the LU-ACC within one month of the issue date, this is to be followed up by firstly contacting the Receiver of the AWC 
      and then if necessary escalating the request for its return, firstly to the Issuer 
      and then to the designated Manager?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D1
intents.question:
LU Signals APCD Interim Arrangements for Procurement, Retention 
      and Archiving of AWC books: Due to recent re organization of LU-ACC 
      and recent issues with procurement of AWC books, 
      LU signals APCD were made aware that LU-ACC do not have 
      the resources to dispose of their full responsibility towards 4.5.1 b, c, d, f 
      and h above. 
      A working group of senior LU Signals professional 
      has agreed the following actions to manage the situation in interim. 
      While the LU Signals APCD will work out a long term solution?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D2
intents.question:
The following interim arrangement was agreed for management of AWC books 
      for LU Signals APCD on 09/09/2021. 
      LU Signals APCD will manage the procurement of AWC books as stores items?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D3
intents.question:
The following interim arrangement was agreed for management of AWC books 
      for LU Signals APCD on 09/09/2021. 
      The Delivery Area Managers for all LU Signals delivery areas 
      that use AWC books will be responsible to issue these AWC books 
      to the issuers in their areas in a controlled manner?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D4
intents.question:
The following interim arrangement was agreed for management of AWC books 
      for LU Signals APCD on 09/09/2021. 
      The Delivery Area Managers for all LU Signals delivery areas that use AWC books 
      will also be responsible to retain all used AWC books locally 
      so that these records can be preserved for archiving 
      and any single AWC or AWC book can be produced 
      when requested for any purpose such as an investigation, 
      a local surveillance or an Audit?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D5
intents.question:
The following interim arrangement was agreed for management of AWC books 
      for LU Signals APCD on 09/09/2021. 
      LU Signals Technical Services within LU-Signals APCD 
      will lead on formal review of the relevant Engineering Standards 
      and this procedure in view of all regulatory requirements, 
      NR/DLR etc best practices, 
      Use of the new AMIS system or any other form of Electronic AWC 
      and will fully consult with all custodians 
      and stakeholders before seeking approval 
      and implementation of the change?

intents.name: PR53AWC Z6 D6
intents.question:
The following interim arrangement was agreed for management of AWC books 
      for LU Signals APCD on 09/09/2021. 
      The proposed new solution shall seek to encompass all AWC management 
      across the combine without necessarily taking AWC books management under LU Signals APCD?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A1
intents.question:
Basic Signalling Priniciples 

       or 

       Advance Signalling Priniciples and testing 
       (Mtce/Incident/Verfication/Function)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A1 A1
intents.question:
There are two basic requirements that 
      any signalling system must fulfil: 

      The first is to allow trains to travel safely 
      without fear of de-railment or collision 

      Continue to other signalling principles?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A2
intents.question:
The second basic requirements that any signalling system must fulfil: 
      Is to regulate trains according to a pre-determined timetable?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A3
intents.question:
In the early years of railways this was achieved using Police men 
      armed with stopwatches and coloured flags stationed at regular intervals along the line. 
      The Policemen were quickly replaced by mechanical signals 
      controlled from local Boxes or Ground frames 
      which could be interlocked with points and other signals?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A4
intents.question: The distance between signalled sections was called the Block?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A5
intents.question: Using train detection systems such as Track Circuits allowed signals to be automatically returned to a Do not proceed aspect with the passage of a train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A6
intents.question: As the Signalman still has to clear the signals in the first place they can be deemed to be semi-automatic?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A7
intents.question: A fully automatic signal checks the section ahead for trains and if it is unoccupied will show a proceed aspect without the intervention of a Signalman?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_A8
intents.question: Like semi automatic, the fully automatic signals will also return to danger with the passing of a train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B1
intents.question: The Track Circuit is used to detect the absence of a train on a section of track?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B2
intents.question: Detects absence in that a relay picks up if the track circuit has no train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B3
intents.question: The two rails that the train wheels run on is called the Running rails?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B4
intents.question: Running rails are used by the Track Circuit for train detection?

intents.name: principles_sig1_b5
intents.question:
The Traction rails are the two remaining raised rails. 
      They carry the 630vDC traction power to the trains motors?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B6
intents.question:
Running rails are manufactured in varying lengths, usually 60 feet, 
      and connected together by metal joints called Fishplates?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B7
intents.question: The one of the rails is called the Continuous rail and its connected to earth?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B8
intents.question:
The other rail is called Section rail 
       where the track is divided electrically into section by insulated Fishplates, 
      known as Blockjoints (also known as Insulated Rail Joints or I.R.J.s)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_B9
intents.question: The electrical area between two Block joints is called a Track Circuit?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_C1
intents.question:
The Blockjoints only need to be inserted into one rail, 
      which is the Section rail?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_C2
intents.question:
The Blockjoints have extreme physical demands placed on it, 
      the Blockjoint can be prone to failure, 
      usually due to a breakdown in its insulation. ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_C3
intents.question:
The Blockjoints in areas of high rail wear tiny iron filings 
      or shards of rail (known as scaling) can collect around the Blockjoint, 
      bypassing its insulation and causing the track to fail?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_C4
intents.question:
Stripping down or replacing Blockjoints is difficult especially during busy periods 
      as the train service needs to be stopped while the work is carried out?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_C5
intents.question: The insulated section of track is not set in length and varies according to the signalling requirements of the area?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D1
intents.question:
There are four main types of track circuit used on London Underground: 

      A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 
      The Coded Track Circuit 
      Resistor Fed Track Circuit 
      Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D2
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      An electrical supply is fed into the circuit at one end 
      and passes through the rails to the opposite end where it feeds the coil of a relay?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D3
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      If no train is present on the track, the relay will be up (powered) 
      and its associated relay contacts (switches) 
      will be made to indicate the absence of a train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D4
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      When a train moves on to the Track Circuit its solid metal axles create a short circuit (electrical path) between the two Running rails. This prevents the electrical supply reaching the Relay?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D5
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      Starved of power, the track relay turns off?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D6
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      The contacts which were made when the relay was up now break 
      to indicate that the track circuit is occupied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D7
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      The capacitor between the supply and the rails allows the power to the relay to be adjusted?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D8
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      The capacitor also prevents the feed fuse blowing, 
      (dead short), 
      when the train is shorting out the rails?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D9
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      The voltage across the Running rails is usually lower than 25 volts?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D10
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      It should be noted that in order to work correctly, 
      track circuits require a good electrical connection 
      between the train wheels and the rails?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D11
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      If the top of the rails are rusty a good shunt cannot be ensured 
      and the track circuit may not detect a train causing a wrong side failure. 
      This will be reported as an allege irregularity?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_D12
intents.question:
A.C. Capacitor Fed Track Circuit 

      This can cause annual problems in areas of high leaf fall 
      where additional safety circuits are switched on to give extra protection between September and December?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E1
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      primary purpose of detecting the absence of a train, also this circuit was designed to send driving codes to the train via the Running rails?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E2
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      Require trains to be fitted with equipment which could read the codes and enabled them to be driven automatically by the signalling system?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E3
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      There are four codes that can be sent to the train, 
      although only one is selected at any particular time. 
      To create the codes an electrical supply is pulsed 
       at either 120, 180, 270 or 420 cycles per second?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E4
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      The required code is selected according to the occupancy of the line ahead 
      and fed to the rails via a Track Feed Set (TFS)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E5
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      At the other end of the track circuit a Code Acceptance Unit (CAU) 
      checks that the incoming signal is compared to the four known codes?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E6
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      If a match is found, 
      the track relay is energised to indicate that the section is unoccupied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_E7
intents.question:
The Coded Track Circuit 

      When a train enters the track, 
      the short circuit created by the axle prevents the code reaching the CAU 
      which in turn de-energises the track relay?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_F1
intents.question:
Resistor Fed Track Circuit 

      Are Track circuits in some sidings 
      and depots that are only occupied by non passenger trains, 
      the level of integrity can be reduced 
      and a simpler resistor fed track circuit installed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_F2
intents.question:
Resistor Fed Track Circuit 

      The circuit is principally the same as a capacitor fed track circuit. 
      A low voltage supply is fed to the rails via a large resistor?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_F3
intents.question:
Resistor Fed Track Circuit 

      At the opposite end of the track a transformer steps up the voltage 
      and picks up a post office style track relay?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_F4
intents.question:
Resistor Fed Track Circuit 

      When the train axle shorts across the Running rails 
      the relay drops to indicate that the section is occupied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_F5
intents.question:
Resistor Fed Track Circuit 

      The relays on some Resistor fed track circuits have been replaced 
      by electronic card units but the rest of the circuit remains the same?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G1
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      Uses the Westinghouses FSR2500 series Jointless Track Circuit (JTC) 
      for standard JTC installed or resignalled tracks. 
      As the name suggests, the circuit has been designed to work without Blockjoints?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G2
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      At each end of the track circuit a large bond is 
      connected across the two running rails. 
      The Track Circuit boundary starts 
      or ends at the mid point between the Bonds of two adjacent tracks?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G3
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      A dedicated track frequency is fed from a Transmitter (TX) into a Tuning Unit, 
      which in conjunction with the Termination Bond tunes the track to that frequency?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G4
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      At the opposite end an identical Tuning unit and Bond filter out 
      any spurious frequencies and send the signal to a Receiver (RX). 
      If the frequency and voltage levels are correct the RX will then 
      pick up a Track Relay to indicate the absence of a train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G5
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      If a train is on the track, 
      the voltage to the RX is removed and the Track Relay will be down?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G6
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      Like the Victoria line, the Central line also uses the track circuits 
      to send driving codes to the train, 
      One of up to 14 codes is selected by the signalling system 
      and fed to the Transmitter which will send it through 
      the Running rails where it can be read by the train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G7
intents.question:
Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      If a Jointless Track Circuit is shorter than forty metres in length, 
      one or more of the Tuned areas needs to be 
      replaced by a Termination Unit and Blockjoints?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_G8
intents.question:
For Jointless Track Circuits (J.T.C.) 
      This is also the case for tracks upto 150m long 
      when a Tuned Area cannot be installed due to space limitations. 
      This often occurs around junction work 
      where the Jointless Track Circuit will appear to be jointed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_H1
intents.question: A block has been defined as the fixed distance between two signals?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_H2
intents.question:
The number of signals and distance between them is set by the traffic requirements. 
      If the train frequency is high the number of signals in a given area 
      will be greater and the distance between them shorter?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I1
intents.question: In areas of low frequency it follows that there will be less signals and the distance between them will increase?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I2
intents.question: The number of trains passing a fixed point in an hour is called the T.P.H. (Trains Per Hour)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I3
intents.question:
When track circuits A and B are up it means that there are no trains in the Block 
      and the train can proceed to the next signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I4
intents.question:
As the train passes the signal the Block becomes occupied 
      and the signal displays a red aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I5
intents.question: A following train would now be allowed to proceed up to the first signal but no further?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I6
intents.question:
If the train attempted to pass the signal at red 
      its brakes would automatically be applied. 
      This action is called Tripping and is achieved by the interaction 
      between a Trainstop and the trains Tripcock?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_I7
intents.question:
As the original train moves fully off of Track Circuit B the Block becomes empty 
      and the train in theory could then move up to the next signal. 
      However, if the first train had stopped immediately after the second signal 
      a potentially dangerous situation could arise?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      The Overlap 

      If the second train doesnt manage to stop at signal A113 
      its brakes will be applied automatically. 
      The trains momentum will then cause it to collide with the rear of the first train. 
      To overcome this, the Block has been extended to include a safety braking distance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J2
intents.question: The Overlap - the Block has been extended to include a safety braking distance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J3
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The length of the Overlap is calculated at design time using a complex formula?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J4
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The key factors are: 

       The maximum speed that the train can approach the signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J5
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The key factors are: 

       The braking efficiency of the train stock?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J6
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The key factors are: 

       Geographical considerations such as the gradient of the track (up or down)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J7
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The results of the calculation determine the length of the track circuit immediately following the signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J8
intents.question:
The Overlap 

       The Overlap starts at the signals Trainstop (the equipment that operates the brakes) 
      and finishes at the end of this track?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J9
intents.question:
Limit Of Control 

      Signal A111 will now only display a green proceed aspect if its Block 
      and the next signals Overlap are clear?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J10
intents.question:
Limit Of Control 

      This controlling section of track ahead of 
      the signal is called its Limit Of Control?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_J11
intents.question:
Limit Of Control 

       In the example above this would relate to 
      Track Circuits A, B, and C detecting no train present?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K1
intents.question:
The Trainstop & Tripcock - 

      used to automatically stop a train if it attempts to pass a signal displaying a stop aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K2
intents.question:
The Tripcock is a lever connected to the trains brakes 
      and is mounted on the front right hand side of its leading bogey?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K3
intents.question:
The Tripcock arm is aligned mid way between the +ve Traction rail 
      and the Running rail. 

      Its lower tip is approximately 2 to 3 inches above the running rail?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K4
intents.question:
The Trainstop - 

      is an equipment box bolted to the sleeper on the right hand side 
      of the track in the direction of travel. ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K5
intents.question:
The Trainstop - 

       On the side of the box nearest the rails is a rectangular head 
      on the end of an air-operated arm?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K6
intents.question:
The Trainstop - 

       The arm is controlled by its associated signal 
      and can raise or lower the head from below the level of the Running rail 
      to 3 inches above it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K7
intents.question:
The Trainstop - 

       When the signal is displaying a stop aspect the head is raised 
       to its higher position and when the signal is displaying 
       a proceed aspect it is moved to its lower position?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K8
intents.question:
Under normal circumstances a train should never pass a red signal. 
      When it does, either for technical reasons or human error, 
      the action is called a S.P.A.D?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_K9
intents.question:
SPAD - stands for Signal Passed At Danger. 
      When a train has been tripped the Tripcock needs to be 
      reset manually by the driver before it can continue?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L1
intents.question:
Automatic Signals do not need any intervention from a person 
      or equipment (such as a computer) to control them?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L2
intents.question:
When their Limit Of Control is empty they will automatically show a green aspect 
      and when it is occupied they will automatically display red?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L3
intents.question:
They can easily be recognised by their identification plate, 
      which is normally attached to the signal post just below the bottom aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L4
intents.question:
prefixed with the letter A followed by three numerals 
      which are odd on the eastbound / northbound  
      and even on the westbound / southbound?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L5
intents.question: A typical Automatic signal on the eastbound would be labelled A771 and on the westbound A222?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L6
intents.question:
In the direction of travel, odd numbers increase and even numbers decrease, 
      so the next signals would be labelled A773 (EB) and A220 (WB)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_L7
intents.question:
