At night time when there are no trains on the track 
      Automatic Signals normally display a green aspect as their Limits of Control are unoccupied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M1
intents.question:
Controlled Signals  - 

       In areas where there are points and junctions the signalling needs to know 
      which route the train is to take before the signal can display a proceed aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M2
intents.question:
The two signals that both lead into a converging junction 
      and pass over number 18s points. 
      To enable either signal to clear (show a proceed aspect) 
      a signalman or timetabling system, such as a computer, needs to request it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M3
intents.question:
Before the signal is allowed to show a green aspect 
      the Limit Of Control (L.O.C.) needs to be clear 
      and all points in the route proved in the correct position. 
      When its L.O.C. is occupied the signal will display a red aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M4
intents.question:
Because the signal automatically goes from green to red 
       but needs intervention to go from red to green 
      it is known as a Semi-automatic or Controlled Signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M5
intents.question:
At night time Controlled Signals normally display a red aspect because, 
      although their L.O.C.s are unoccupied, 
      they are not being requested by the signalman?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M6
intents.question:
Each controlled area is identified by a two-letter site code. 
      The signals and points in that area are given a reference of 
      up to three numbers which relates to its controlling lever. 
      A signal controlled from lever number three at Northwood would be labelled JF3?

intents.name: principles_sig1_m7
intents.question:
In summary, Controlled areas tend to be where there are points 
      and Automatic areas where there arent?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_M8
intents.question:
In general the scheme of signalling on the Underground is two aspect, 
      red for stop and green for proceed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Four Aspect signalling - 

      On the Metropolitan line between Harrow and Amersham the tracks are shared 
      with Network Rail and utilise four aspect signals?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N2
intents.question:
Four Aspect signalling - 

      From the bottom of the signal head upwards the aspects are 
      red, yellow, green and yellow?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N3
intents.question:
Four Aspect signalling - 

      The sequence of these aspects is shown below. 
      If a signals Limit of Control is occupied it will display red (A117)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N4
intents.question:
Four Aspect signalling - 

      If the signals L.O.C. is unoccupied the aspect displayed 
      depends on the state of the 2 signals ahead?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N5
intents.question:
Four Aspect signalling works well for trains travelling 
      at high speeds that need long distances to stop?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_N6
intents.question:
Four Aspect signalling - 

      Has the multiple aspect sequence gives advance warning of a signal at danger 
      long before it is reached allowing plenty of time to apply braking?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O1
intents.question:
On a rapid transit system such as London Underground the trains are generally slower 
      and closer together allowing a simpler two-aspect system to be used?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O2
intents.question: If signal A113 is green its repeater will also display green and the train will maintain its line speed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O3
intents.question: There are occasions when a Repeater is placed on the same post as a stop signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O4
intents.question: This can give the impression that it is a four-aspect signal as the two Repeater aspects are below the stop signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O5
intents.question:
When two Repeater aspects is below the stop signal 
       There would be an ID plate for the signal and another one for the Repeater?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O6
intents.question: On the Central and Victoria lines the track circuits fulfil two purposes?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O7
intents.question: They are used primarily in safety signalling circuits, such as the signal selection, to detect the absence of a train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O8
intents.question: Additionally they are used to send codes to the train to allow it to be driven automatically by the signalling system?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O9
intents.question: Coils (antennas) mounted ahead of the trains leading axle, just above the Running rails, enable it to read the codes from the track circuit and drive the motors at the appropriate speed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_O10
intents.question: The particular code sent to an individual track or group of tracks is selected according to the occupancy of the line ahead?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      The Victoria line  - 

      Uses Coded track circuits throughout its entire length. The track circuit can pulse the supply to the Running rails at a rate of 120, 180, 270 or 420 cycles per minute (CPM). ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P2
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      The train interprets the codes as follows :-  ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P3
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      420 cpm - Allows the train to travel up to and maintain maximum speed 270 cpm?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P4
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      Allows the train to travel up to and maintain 22 M.P.H. 180 cpm ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P5
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      Allows a train to coast (no motors applied) up to 22 M.P.H. 120 cpm?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P6
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      This code is not recognised by a train and is used by 
      the signalling system Braking commands are transmitted to the train 
      by aerial loops located in the four foot way?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P7
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      These spot loops are placed set distances from stopping points 
      such as signals and are turned on if the train needs to be slowed down. 
      When the train reads the spot, the brakes are applied 
      at a rate which will bring it to a smooth stop at the correct position?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_P8
intents.question:
Victoria Line  - 

      The trains on the Victoria line can be driven in one of three modes. 

      Automatic 
      Coded Manual 
      Slow Manual ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Q1
intents.question:
Automatic - In this mode the train is driven by 
      the codes it receives from the signalling sytem. 
      In platform areas when its time for the train to proceed the driver closes the doors 
      and simultaneously pushes two start buttons. 
      The train is then driven automatically to the next station?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Q2
intents.question:
Coded Manual  - The train is driven manually by the driver 
      but must be receiving a valid 180, 270 or 420  code from the track. 
      If the speed ecceeds 25mph emergency braking is automatically applied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Q3
intents.question:
Slow Manual - This mode allows the train to be driven manually 
      when no code is being received from the track. 
      Slow manual is used on sections of line which are not track circuited, 
      such as P-way sidings, 
      or when there are certain train or track circuit faults. 
      If the train speed exceeds 10 mph emergency braking is applied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_R1
intents.question: The track circuit directly after a red signal or immediateIy behind a train is fed a 120 code?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_R2
intents.question: Unlike the other three codes, the 120 code has no meaning to a train and is only switched to the track to enable the CAU to re-energise the track relay?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_R3
intents.question: If a train moves on to a track circuit which has a 120 code the emergency brakes will automatically be applied?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_R4
intents.question: This brake application due to the train not receiving a recognised code (or no code at all) is called Code Tripping and at signals replaces the need for a Tripcock and Trainstop?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_S1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

     Central line 

 The Central line was re-signalled in the 1990s using Jointless track circuits which, like Coded track circuits, can be used to drive automatic trains?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_S2
intents.question: Central Line - To give a greater variety of train speeds, the number of codes was increased to 14?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_S3
intents.question: Central Line - These codes, which are known as A.T.P. codes (Automatic Train Protection) also send braking information to the train, therefore removing the need for spot loops?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_T1
intents.question: Track Circuit Codes - Each code sent to a train contains information regarding the maximum safe speed (MSS) at which a train can travel over the section of track?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_T2
intents.question: Track Circuit Codes -  the Target Speed (TS) that it must achieve by the end of it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_U1
intents.question: Braking And Accelerating - At the head of every platform, mounted in the four foot, there is a looped aerial connected to a unit in the SER known as the Platform A.T.O. Communicator (PAC)

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_U2
intents.question: Braking And Accelerating - When a train is fully berthed in the platform it is positioned above the loop allowing it to communicate with the PAC and upload information about the line ahead for a distance of two stations

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_U3
intents.question:
Braking And Accelerating - Among the information there is data on 
      the length and start position of all Code Blocks

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_U4
intents.question:
Braking And Accelerating - A Code Block is one or more track circuits 
      who share common ATP code inputs A.T.O. (Automatic Train Operation) 
      is the train borne equipment which is responsible 
      for the controling the motors and brakes

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_V1
intents.question:
The train is fitted with tachometers which can 
      count the number of wheel revolutions since the train enetered the Code Block?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_V2
intents.question:
This information along with track length data obtained from the PAC enable 
      the train to work out its exact position within the Code Block?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_V3
intents.question:
The most efficient braking distance prior to the signal can then be calculated. 
      When this point is reached the brakes 
      will be applied bringing the train to a smooth stop at the signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_V4
intents.question:
When this point is reached the brakes 
      will be applied bringing the train to a smooth stop at the signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_V5
intents.question:
If the train receives a higher speed code than the present one 
      it will accelerate at the maximum rate until the new speed is achieved?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_W1
intents.question:
Code Tripping - 

      If the trains speed exceeds the MSS for the code block 
      it will be emergency braked?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_W2
intents.question:
Code Tripping - 

      This will also be the case if no recognised code is read from the track 
      or the train is travelling faster than the TS at the end of the code block?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X1
intents.question:
Train Driving Modes - 

      A.T.P. equipped trains on the Central line 
      can be driven in one of the three modes, 
      selected by a Master Switch in the leading cab?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X2
intents.question:
The modes are - 

      Automatic Train Operation (A.T.O)  
      Coded Manual 
      Restricted Manual (RM)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X3
intents.question:
A.T.O. (Automatic Train Operation)  
      In this mode the train is driven by the codes it receives from the track circuit?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X4
intents.question: This is the default driving mode for passenger trains on the Central Line?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X5
intents.question:
When the driver closes the doors at a platform he pushes a start button 
      and the train moves to the next station automatically?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_X6
intents.question:
The trains current and Target Speeds 
      are shown on an L.E.D. display in the drivers cab?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Y1
intents.question:
Coded Manual - 
      When the Master Switch is set to Coded Manual acceleration 
       and braking are controlled by the driver?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Y2
intents.question:
Coded Manual - 
       If ,however, the train exceeds the Maximum Safe Speed the brakes 
       are automatically applied to bring it back within tolerance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_A1
intents.question:
Restricted Manual - 
       This mode allows the train to be moved manually at a maximum speed of 16 KPH (10 mph),  regardless of code?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_A2
intents.question:
Restricted Manual - 
       Can be used in the event of track failures (no code being received), certain train borne failures?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_A3
intents.question:
Restricted Manual - 
       Can also be used when the train needs to be driven over non-coded sections of rail such as depots?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_B1
intents.question:
Headway Posts & Block Marker Boards Signal aspects 
       give a driver advance warning of the state of the next Block 
ln       and Overlap ahead so that the trains brake or motors can be applied accordingly?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_B2
intents.question:
Headway Posts & Block Marker Boards Signal aspects 
       give a driver advance warning of the state of the next Block 

       If the train is driven by the signalling, not the driver, there is no need for a physical signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_B3
intents.question:
Headway Posts & Block Marker Boards Signal aspects 
       Nearing the signal the driver will note the red aspect 
       and brake smoothly to a halt in front of it. On the Victoria 
       and Central lines this will be performed automatically by the signalling system with no input from the driver, 
       therefore removing the need for the physical signal A113?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_B4
intents.question:
Headway Posts & Block Marker Boards Signal aspects 
       To show a driver that the train has stopped in a legitimate position 
       where there would normally have been a signal, 
       a post is placed at the side of the track?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_C1
intents.question:
On the Victoria line this is a black sign lebelled with the words Headway Post 
       and a white three digit reference number?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_C2
intents.question:
On the Central line the post has a white background 
       with a red stripe at 45 degrees 
       and a four digit reference number?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Aspect Signalling - 

      A green aspect in a signal means 

      That up to the next physical signal and its Overlap are clear?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D2
intents.question:
Aspect Signalling - 

      This doesnt take in to account Headway Post after limit of control
      so to overcome this the Victoria line signals have three aspects, they are  

      Red, 
      White, 
      Green?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D3
intents.question:
Aspect Signalling - 

      Red means Stop?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D4
intents.question:
Aspect Signalling - 

      White - Proceed as far as next Headway Post (automatic trains only)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D5
intents.question:
Aspect Signalling - 

      Green - Proceed as far as next physical signal The aspects in the previous layout can now be shown correctly?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_D6
intents.question:
Aspect Signalling - 

      For the sake of clarity any unlit aspects have been blacked out?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_E1
intents.question:
Signals are still required at the front of platforms 
      to let the driver know that its time to close the train doors?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_E2
intents.question:
If a train needs to be driven manually operational rules dictate that a driver 
      must adhere to the red and green aspects and ignore the white?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_E3
intents.question:
Where there are long runs between fixed signals additional ones may be installed 
      to increase the throughput of trains being driven manually?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_E4
intents.question:
There are also signals on the approach to station platforms 
      and junctions to show the driver which route to take?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F1
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      if two track circuits B and C form the Signal Block 
      and would have the same codes switched on to them?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F2
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      One or more Track Circuits which share the same code inputs 
      are grouped together to form a Code Block?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F3
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      Track circuit D which represents the next signals Overlap will have its own Code 
      and can be considered to be a Code Block in its own right?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F4
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      It can be seen therefore that the signal needs 
      two Code Blocks clear before it can show a proceed aspect?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F5
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      With the following signal at danger 
      the proceeding Code Block may have a code 12 on it. 
      When the train receives the code 
      it will maintain speed (no more than 27.5 kph) 
      until it nears the signal and then it will apply 
      the breaks and bring the train to a halt at the signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F6
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      If for some reason the train passed the signal 
      the following track would have a code 14 on it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_F7
intents.question:
Code Block - 

      This is similar to the 120 Victoria line code as it is not recognised 
      by the train and would cause it to code trip?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_G1
intents.question:
The Central line 
      Has Headway posts with a similar meaning to those 
      on the Victoria line but is called Block Marker Boards?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_G2
intents.question:
The Central line 
      Also used in conjunction with three aspect signals (red, white and Green)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Interlockings - 

      An Interlocking is a piece of equipment that prevents conflicting routes being set up?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H2
intents.question:
Interlockings - 

      If two or more conflicting signals were to show a proceed aspect at the same time 
      this could bring two trains in to collision. 
      An Interlocking prevents this by allowing only one 
      of the routes to be set at a time 
      and also locks that route while a train is passing through it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H3
intents.question:
Because Automatic signals do not have conflicting routes Interlockings 
      are only found in Controlled areas?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H4
intents.question: There are many types of Interlocking in use :- N  style  V Style?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H5
intents.question:
Interlockings - 

      N  style 
      These are manually operated mechanical lever frames found in signal boxes. 
      Each lever controls a set of points or signal 
      and must be moved to its correct position each time the signal is required?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_H6
intents.question:
Above the Frame line diagram indicates the position of all trains 
      in the area and the state of all Controlled signals?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I1
intents.question:
Other information such as train destination 
      and miscellaneous signalling data are also displayed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I2
intents.question:
The locking between levers is performed by intricate locking blocks 
      which are all hand cut for a specific frame?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I3
intents.question:
The lever catches hold the lever normal or reverse 
      and must be operated before the lever is moved?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I4
intents.question:
N2 - 

      This is an N style frame that been converted for remote operation?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I5
intents.question:
The catches have been removed from the levers 
      and two air motors fitted to each shaft, 
      one to power it normal and one to power it reverse?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I6
intents.question:
If its air supply is removed, using an adjacent isolating cock, 
      it can be operated in the same way as an N style frame?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_I7
intents.question: The N2 frame with lever catches removed?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J1
intents.question:
V Style - 

      This was the first and only purpose built remote mechanical frame 
      on the Underground and like the N2 is air operated. ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J2
intents.question:
V Style - 

      To save space its components are mounted in a vertical plane?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J3
intents.question:
V Style - 

      The frame is supplied as a standard 12-lever section 
      which can be joined to other sections to create a larger frame?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J4
intents.question:
V Style - 

      The locking pieces are predefined shapes, 
      which are bolted on to the lever shaft as required, 
      and therefore do not need to be hand cut?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J5
intents.question:
V Style - 

      This makes it easy to build a frame that is specific to a particular site?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J6
intents.question:
V Style - 

      At present the V style frame is the most commonly used interlocking on the Underground?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_J7
intents.question:
V Style - 

      Although it is designed to be operated remotely, 
      an air cock adjacent to the frame allows it to be controlled manually 
      by removing the air to the lever valves?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_K1
intents.question:
Mechanical frames, although quite reliable, 
      need regular maintenance and arent easily expanded?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_K2
intents.question:
Mechanical frames are also powered by an air supply which itself 
      can be susceptible to changes in pressure and failur?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_L1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Relay Interlocking - 

      At West Ruislip the mechanical frame was replaced by a 
      British Rail style Interlocking based on relays which mimics a conventional frame. 
      The Interlocking is controlled from a local site computer connected 
      to the Control Room at White City?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_L2
intents.question:
Relay Interlocking - 

      Because the Interlocking has no physical levers 
      a push button Maintainers Panel is installed in the equipment room 
      to allow the signalling to be operated during maintenance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M1
intents.question:
A secondary Emergency Local Control Panel has also been fitted 
      in the Station Supervisors office to allow local control 
      in the event of a loss of communication with the Control room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M2
intents.question:
Westrace - Westinghouse Interlocking called Westrace. 
      It not only replaced the frame 
      but also many of the signalling circuits as well?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M3
intents.question:
The unit is a computer-based design running a software program called Ladder Logic, 
      which makes each standard Westrace cubicle site specific?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M4
intents.question:
Westrace is currently the Interlocking of choice and will be installed 
      as part of any new re-signalling projects?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M5
intents.question:
Computer Based Interlocking (C.B.I.) Mechanical frames were eventually superseded 
      by relays and computers?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M6
intents.question:
The first large-scale computer Interlocking was installed at 
      Neasden Depot in the late 1980s?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M7
intents.question:
CBI uses three Interlocker computers which work together 
      using a majority voting technique?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M8
intents.question:
Each Interlocker has the state of the depot railway fed in to it 
      and using software interlocking data stored 
      on microchips evaluates whether a set of points or signal can be set?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M9
intents.question:
The results from all three Interlockers are compared 
      and if at least two of them agree the outputs can be set?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M10
intents.question:
If one of the Interlockers was not in agreement with 
      the other two it is then voted Offline in case there is a problem with it?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M11
intents.question:
CBI was a big step forward as the site-specific data 
      was held in software allowing it to be easily amended?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M12
intents.question:
However, the hardware was very unreliable 
      and was never installed anywhere else outside of Neasden Depot?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_M13
intents.question: The red cards on the third shelf detect inputs and set outputs Interlocker A?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_N1
intents.question:
Vital Processor Interlocking (V.P.I.) In the late nineties the East London Line 
      was resignalled and a Vital Processor Interlocking installed at New Cross. 
      The interlockingcontrols all areas south of Surrey Quays, 
      which includes New Cross, New Cross Gate and Canal Junction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_N2
intents.question:
Vital Processor Interlocking (V.P.I.) VPI is similar to Westrace in that 
      it is a processor based interlocking but was designed by AdTranz?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Signalling Control Boxes - 

      The individual levers when grouped together are collectively known as a Frame. 
      Above the Frame is a line diagram which indicates the position of 
      all the trains in its area and the state of the Controlled signals?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O2
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms - 

      With advances in technology the Signal boxes became responsible for larger areas 
      and were renamed Regulating Room and the Signalmen Regulators?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O3
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms - 

      The manual levers were replaced by route buttons 
      which now controlled air operated Frames many miles away?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O4
intents.question:
The Regulating Room at Barking controls six Frames, 
      two at Barking, as it is such a large site, 
      and others at Upney, East Ham, Plaistow and Bromley?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O5
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms - 

      On the main desk in the room there is a three position push button for every available route?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O6
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms - 

      The button is pushed to call for a route, 
      pulled to cancel it and is sprung to a neutral mid position?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_O7
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms - 

      The body of the button displays three colours 
      to indicate signal at danger (red), 
      route called for (yellow) and signal green (green)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_P1
intents.question:
Above the desk is a line diagram similar to those found in a Signal box, 
      which shows the state of the signals, points, 
      track circuits and train destination information?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_A1
intents.question: The position of trains is indicated by the red illuminated sections of track?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q1
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      Although the rooms covered much larger areas than Signal boxes 
      the Regulator was still responsible for clearing the signals 
      at the correct time and logging the information on timetable sheets?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q2
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      The introduction of the Programme Machine, a mechanical device on to 
      which a pre-determined timetable can be loaded, 
      changed all this?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q3
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      A Programme machine can read the information from 
      its timetable and operate the signals 
      at the appropriate time for the relevant train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q4
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      With only a few machines at each site this 
      allowed entire lines to be operated from one room, 
      renamed once again to a Control Room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q5
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      The Victoria Line Control Room is at Euston 
      and requires only two staff to look after the entire line?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q6
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      In an ideal world they would have nothing to do all day 
      as the Programme Machines ensure the smooth running of the train?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q7
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      In reality there are always problems do deal with, 
      such as cancelled or extra trains and passenger incidents which affect the service?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Q8
intents.question:
Control Rooms - 

      As lines are re-signalled Programme Machines are being replaced 
      by more reliable and flexible computer systems and the Regulator now uses a mouse, 
      keyboard and several screens to interact with the signalling?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R1
intents.question:
Local Control - 

      Non-manual Interlockings are normally controlled 
      from remote sites such as Control Rooms?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R2
intents.question:
If communication between the two sites is lost or maintenance 
      needs to be carried out the Interlocking can be controlled locally?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R3
intents.question: This should only be done with the Signalman / Regulators permission?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R4
intents.question:
The method of local control depends on the type of Interlocking. 
      N2 and V Style An air cock and pressure gauge are situated on or near these frames?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R5
intents.question: An air cock and pressure gauge are situated on or near these frames?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_R6
intents.question:
When the air cock is turned to the off position the air is removed from 
      the motors on the frame enabling the levers to be moved manually?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_S1
intents.question:
Relay Interlocking - 
      On the Central line an Interlocking can be controlled 
      from two local sources as well as the Control Room 
      Emergency local Control Panel (E.L.C.P.) and Maintainers Panel (M.P.)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_S2
intents.question:
Emergency local Control Panel (E.L.C.P.) - 

      The E.L.C.P. is situated in the Station Masters office 
      and can be used when the site has lost communication with the Control room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_S3
intents.question:
Emergency local Control Panel (E.L.C.P.) 

      The panel has facilities for setting and resetting routes 
      and indications for track circuit, signal and other miscellaneous information?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_S4
intents.question:
Emergency local Control Panel (E.L.C.P.) - 

      The panel shown in figure 6.8 is located at North Acton. 
      When the Panel is turned on it over-rides the Control Room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_T1
intents.question:
Maintainers Panel (M.P.) - 

      The Maintainers Panel in the Signal Equipment Room (SER) enables 
      the site to be controlled by a signal technician during maintenance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_T2
intents.question:
Maintainers Panel (M.P.) - 

      The panel has all the functions of the E.L.C.P. 
      as well as switches to operate points 
      and place Temporary Speed Restrictions (T.S.Rs) on sections of the line?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_T3
intents.question:
Maintainers Panel (M.P.) - 

      When the Panel is turned on it over-rides the Control Room and E.L.C.P?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U1
intents.question:
Westrace is controlled in a similar way to Relay Interlocking 
      but the Maintainers Panel has been replaced by a 
      Maintainers Terminal (M.T.) The M.T. 
      is a VDU, 
      mouse 
      keyboard 
      located in the SER which plugs in to 
      the Westrace unit and allows it to be controlled during maintenance?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U2
intents.question:
As sections of lines were upgraded some Signal boxes began to control 
      larger areas traditionally associated with Regulating Rooms. 
      However as a general rule of thumb Signal boxes 
      contain manual lever frames and cover signalling in a small localised area?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U3
intents.question:
Regulating Rooms control several sites from a push button consul. 
      Control Rooms cover entire lines or significant sections of them and use computers 
      or Programme Machines to run the trains to a timetable?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U4
intents.question:
North of Wembley Park the Metropolitan Line is 
      controlled by signal boxes at Harrow on the Hill, 
      Rayners Lane, 
      Rickmansworth 
      Amersham. 
      Amersham which also controls Chalfont and Latimer uses a route button desk similar to Barking. 
      On top of the N style frame at Rickmansworth there is 
      a route button panel that controls Watford and Watford Junction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U5
intents.question:
Watford is the only site on the Metropolitan line 
      to utilise a Programme Machine (explained later in the module). 
      At Harrow an N style frame with route levers controls three slave N2?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U6
intents.question:
Interlockings in the north, central and south areas of the station. 
      The three V style frames at: 
      Rayners Lane, 
      Ruislip 
      Uxbridge 
      are all controlled from Rayners Lane. 
      At Baker Street there is a Control Room which is responsible for 
      the line between Wembley Park and Aldgate. 
      A Train Movements Room (TMR) at Neasden operates 
      the Computer Based Interlocking within the depot area?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U7
intents.question:
Hammersmith & City (H & C) The signal boxes at 
      Hammersmith and Edgware Road are N and B style respectively. 
      From Baker Street to Aldgate the tracks are shared with the Metropolitan line 
      and controlled from its Baker Street Control Room. 
      Liverpool Street is home to LULs only remotely operated?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_U8
intents.question:
B style frame (B2). After Aldgate the trains run as far as Barking 
      on the District line tracks?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V1
intents.question:
The Controlled areas of The Bakerloo line Control Room is located at Baker Street station 
      and is responsible for the running of the entire line from Elephant and Castle to Queens Park. 
      Computers situated in each Controlled area 
      interact with V style frames to control the signalling?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V2
intents.question:
They also relay Track Circuit, 
      Point and Signal information back to a main computer 
      at Baker Street which then displays it 
      on a Line Overview diagram and the Regulators VDU?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V3
intents.question:
Lambeth North 
      and Elephant & Castle are controlled by the frame at Waterloo. 
      north of Queens Park the trains run over Network Rail tracks 
      but at Stonebridge Park there is a Control Tower 
      which signals trains locally within the depot area?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V4
intents.question:
The Controlled areas of The Central Line Control Room, 

      which is responsible for the entire line, is at 10b Wood Lane White City. 
      The majority of Interlockings are Westrace 
      with some Westinghouse Relay Interlockings to the west end of the line?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V5
intents.question:
There is the facility to transfer stock to the 
      Metropolitan line at Ruislip via West Ruislip depot. 
      At Hainault there is a control tower 
      which allows routes to be set within the depot?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V6
intents.question:
The Controlled areas of the Victoria Line - 

      The Victoria line shares its Control Room with the Northern line 
      at Cobourg Street which is close to Euston Station. 
      Although more recently built than Warwick Road 
      it still has similar style push button desks and line diagram ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V7
intents.question:
At Northumberland Park there is a small Control Tower 
      which is responsible for the signalling in the depot area. 
      V style frames are used throughout the entire line?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V8
intents.question:
Position Detectors, dectect the presence 
      of the train can be determined by Track Circuit B. 
      Its exact position however is unknown as 
      the Track Circuit only indicates that a trains axle is somewhere within its boundary?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V9
intents.question:
When a more precise location is needed a Position Detector can be used. 
      There are currently three types in use on LUL: 
      Delta, 
      Treadle 
      Siemens Wheel Detector?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V10
intents.question:
Delta - The Delta unit is connected to the Running Rails 
      at the required position by track wires. 
      A high frequency is fed into the track circuit 
      creating a spread area 40 feet in either direction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_V11
intents.question:
When a train moves on to Track Circuit B 
      its relay turns off to indicate the presence of a train. 
      As the train moves on to the spread area the Delta relay, 
      which was down, now picks up to indicate its presence. 
      The relay will stay up all the time an axle is within its spread are?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_W1
intents.question:
Treadle - Because Jointless Track Circuits use complex frequencies Deltas, 
      which inject a 10 KHz signal in to the rails, cannot be connected to them. 
      The Bakerloo line was the first to use JTC throughout 
      and when it was resignalled the Deltas were replaced by Treadles. ?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_W2
intents.question:
The Treadle -  is a small Position Detector which bolts to the inside of the Running Rail 
      but is electrically independent of the track circuit. 
      On the side of the of the Treadle is a damped lever 
      which is pushed downwards by the wheel flange of a passing train. 
      The lever is connected to internal switches which then pick up a relay in the equipment room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_W3
intents.question:
Because Treadles are mechanical they require regular maintenance 
      and can be unreliable?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_W4
intents.question:
Siemens Wheel Detector  - 

      The resignalling of the Central line saw the introduction of Siemens Wheel Detectors 
      which have subsequently been used on other lines. The system uses two components, 
      a sensor unit bolted to the inside of the Running Rail which creates a small magnetic field 
      above it and a detector card in the equipment room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_W5
intents.question:
When a metal train wheel passes over the sensor it interrupts 
      the magnetic field and is detected by the card in the room. 
      As there is no physical contact between the wheel 
      and the Sensor it needs minimal maintenance and is very reliable?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X1
intents.question:
(click 'no' to restart app) 

      Train Description (T.D.) On a Signalmans diagram the track circuit indications show 
      the position of any trains in the area?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X2
intents.question:
Train Description (T.D.) - 

      To ensure that they are correctly signalled along the line a system known as TD is used 
      to additionally indicate their destination and in some cases stopping pattern 
      (all stations, semi fast and fast etc)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X3
intents.question:
When the system was installed every northbound 
      or southbound destination was designated 
      a code using using the letters A to E. A combination of these five letters 
      gives the potential for thirty one different destination codes?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X4
intents.question:
At the start of the line the signalman sets up 
      the TD information using a panel on his frame?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X5
intents.question:
The panel has an individual button for each destination 
      and when pushed stores the appropriate code on five relays labelled A, B, C, D and E. 
      Each group of five relays is known collectively 
      as a code holding set of which there is one per controlled signal?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X6
intents.question:
When the train passes signal BC1 it sends the code forward to BC2s 
      code holding set and then clears down the code for platform 5. 
      As the train travels along the line its code follows it from site to site. 
      In the Signal box the codes can be read and displayed on the line diagram 
      or even the Dot Matrix display on the platform?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_X7
intents.question:
The Signalman has the facility to change a trains description 
      at key points in his area such as platforms 
      and major junctions?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y1
intents.question:
BC9 is the last controlled signal in area BC 
      and EF1 the first controlled signal entering the next site. 
      If there were 12 auto signals between them there would 
      need to be 13 code holding sets inclusive of EF1. 
      Because trains passing BC 9 can only exit via signal EF1 
      the individual Code Holding sets can be replaced by a TD Receiver?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y2
intents.question:
Receiver is an electronic box located in the equipment room 
      at the exit of the automatic section 
      which can store the codes for many trains?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y3
intents.question:
When the train at BC9 passes the signal it transmits 
      the code ahead to the receiver at the next site. 
      The code enters the unit at position 12 
      and then cascades down to the first available empty slot?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y4
intents.question:
When the next train passes BC 9 its code is 
      also passed forward and cascades down to position 2?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y5
intents.question:
At site EF the signalman clears signal 1 for 
      the first train which then proceeds past it. 
      This will clear the code from slot 1 
      and cause the following codes to move forward one space?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y6
intents.question:
This will be repeated for every train that entered 
      the section until the store is empty?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y7
intents.question:
Some faults can cause a description to be sent twice 
      or not at all causing a mismatch between the number of trains 
      in the section and the number of codes in the receiver?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y8
intents.question:
If there are more codes than trains the Receiver is said to be Plus 
      or Minus if there are less?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z1_Y9
intents.question:
Three codes in the Receiver with only one train in section 
      would mean that the Receiver is Plus 2?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A1
intents.question:
In areas that still have signal boxes every train 
      has to be signalled through a site by the Signalman?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A2
intents.question:
The point levers need to be moved to the 
      required position followed by the Signal lever, 
      which then locks them in position?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A3
intents.question:
At a large site with complicated junctions this can result in many lever operations 
      and sometimes a second Signalman to assist during busy periods?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A4
intents.question: The number of levers movements made by the Signalman can be reduced using Route Control?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A5
intents.question:
If a signal allow a train to move up to the next signal. 
      To set the route for the Signalman will reverse several levers. 
      When the train has passed through the route 
      it will normalise all the levers in the reverse order. 
      The total number of lever movements made is many. 
      When this is multiplied by the number of trains using the signal every hour 
      and the total number of routes for the site this represents a lot of work for the Signalman?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A6
intents.question:
If a signal allow a train to move up to the next signal. 
      To set the route for the Signalman will reverse several levers?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A7
intents.question:
When the train has passed through the route 
      it will normalise all the levers in the reverse order?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_A8
intents.question:
The total number of lever movements made is many. 
      When this is multiplied by the number of trains using the signal every hour 
      and the total number of routes for the site 
      this represents a lot of work for the Signalman?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_B1
intents.question:
Route control 

      Enables many levers to be moved by operating only one lever or button. 
      Every route at a site has an associated three-position button in the?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_B2
intents.question:
Regulating or Control Room 

      To call a route the button is pushed, 
      to cancel a route the button is pulled 
      and when the button is released it will return to a neutral mid position?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_B3
intents.question:
The associated route control circuits will automatically replace all the levers 
      in the correct sequence when the train has completed the route. 
      For example, a route which needed eight inputs from the Signalman, now only requires one?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_B4
intents.question:
3 position Route buttons. 


      Each button can be lit by three different aspects, they are: 


      Red 
      (Signal is not requested and displaying a red aspect) 


       Yellow 
      (Signal is requested and displaying a red aspect) 


      Green (Signal is requested and displaying a proceed aspect)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C1
intents.question:
Programme Machines - The introduction of Route control 
      allowed a single Regulating Room to replace several signal boxes. 
      This increased the area that a Signalman could supervise 
      but each route still had to be called manually?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C2
intents.question:
The next step was to install a system that could 
      route trains automatically according to a pre-defined timetable. 
      Prior to the widespread commercial availability of computers 
      this was achieved using Programme Machines?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C3
intents.question:
The Programme Machine is an electro mechanical device 
      which can control the signals at a converging or diverging junction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C4
intents.question:
As most controlled areas have more than one of these junctions 
      there are usually several machines per site?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C5
intents.question:
The text represents number 1 Sequence Machine 
      (another name for Programme Machine) 
      which is controlling signals 15 and 16 at a converging junction. 
      Machine S3 is controlling the 
      two routes associated with signal 19 at a diverging junction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C6
intents.question:
The Programme machine holds its timetable on a punched roll. 
      For each train there is a line of data that relates to the signal to clear, 
      destination, number and time of departure?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C7
intents.question:
The Sequence machine is operated from the control room 
      and can be put into any of four modes ranging from 
      manual (routes called by push button) 
      to fully automatic (routes called by timetable information)?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C8
intents.question:
The current train number, destination and expected time 
      on the timetable roll is sent back to the control room 
      where it is displayed on the overview line diagram?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_C9
intents.question:
There is also a multi-aspect lamp to indicate 
      which mode of operation is currently selected?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D1
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      The Interlocking Machine Rooms at Acton are controlled from Warwick Road Control Room

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D2
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      Track circuit, signal and Programme Machine information needs to be sent to from the I.M.R. and to the Control Room to be displayed on the line diagram?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D3
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      Control data such as the desk buttons and Programme Machine controls are also sent in the opposite direction?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D4
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      Assuming each function requires a single wire this amounts to several hundred lines between the two sites. As the distance between the sites increases the costs in materials and man-hours to install the cable also increase?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D5
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      Scanning is designed to reduce the amount of cables by sending multiple information along each wire?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D6
intents.question:
Scanning - 


      There are many Scanning systems in use on LUL of which Slow Speed, S2, Serks and TEML are the most common?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D7
intents.question:
When Scanning is used a transmitter unit it installed 
      in room A and a receiver unit in room B. 
      All 20 switches are fed in to the Scanning in room A 
      which then packages the data and sends it along 2 or 4 cables to room B?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D8
intents.question: The Receiver then reads the data and sets the corresponding output?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D9
intents.question:
Functionally the Scanning has no effect on the circuits fed in to it, 
      when switch one in room A is closed it will illuminate lamp 
      one in room B as if were wired directly?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D10
intents.question:
The Scanning cost saving however is significant. 
      Slow Speed Scanning, which is the oldest still in use, 
      can send five functions along a single wire, 
      High Speed 108 along 2 wires and S2 512 in two pairs?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_D11
intents.question:
In modern Interlocking rooms one half of the Scanning 
      can be used as an interface to input and output data to the site computer?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_E1
intents.question:
The Control Room is connected to a site computer in an I.M.R. 
      The site computer holds the timetable and its outputs 
      can operate the levers to route trains automatically?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_E2
intents.question:
Track circuit, point and relay information is fed in to the computer 
      via an S2 scanning interface and transmitted 
      to the Centre computer at Baker Street over a modem link?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_E3
intents.question:
The Centre computer is connected in the same way 
      to every other controlled site in its area. 
      The information from all these sites is displayed on CPUs 
      on the Regulators desk and an overview line diagram 
      mounted at the front of the Control Room?

intents.name: Principles_Sig1_Z2_Z1_E4
intents.question:
Any alterations to the timetable such as cancelled 
      or extra trains are entered in to the desk using a trakerball 
      and sent via the Centre computer to the relevant Site computer?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A1
intents.question: Would you like to discuss events in CBTC point failure?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A2
intents.question:
The VCC has lost points status, so the point position is unknown. 


      Do you have an SMC alarm showing points disturbed?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A3
intents.question:
Are trains 'Emergency Breaking' (Train EB) in vicinity of points, 

      so its failing intemintently?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A4
intents.question: Is VCC not allowing trains to send route reservations over points?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A5
intents.question:
The VCC has loses the ability to move points 
      but the points status is Normal or Reverse and locked. 

      Do you have an SMC alarm showing points non-movable?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_A5
intents.question: Points may go disturbed if an attempt to swing points is made. Is an attempt to swing points via SMC made?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_B1
intents.question: Has SSM checked CCOT print back, for alerts and status on points?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_B2
intents.question: Has SSM inform DSIM?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_B3
intents.question: Has DSIM dispatched a T.O. ?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C1
intents.question:
Has SSM got permission from Service Manager (SM), 
      may have to get permission from multiple  SM, 

      from other lines) to swing points using CCOT SP command?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C2
intents.question: Has SSM alerted and got permission from Controller to swing points using CCOT SP command?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C3
intents.question: Has SSM got informed signaller that swing points command, CCOT SP command is about to be used?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C4
intents.question:
Operations will hold all trains in area. 
      Are all trains in the vicinity held, at a station or Immediate Stopping Point (ISP)?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C5
intents.question:
Has signallers performed a type 2 release, 
      EB idle and release reservation been taken, 


      to pull back all reservations away from the disturbed point?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C6
intents.question:
Once trains in the vicinity are stationary 
      and its safe to do so, 


      Has SSM attempted to swing points using CCOT SP command?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C7
intents.question: Have the SSM confirmed that points are failing both ways N and R?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C8
intents.question: Did the swing point get detected back one way?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_C9
intents.question: So failing both ways?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_D1
intents.question:
If there is detection one way has points been reserve points (VS command) 
      in working direction where there is detection?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_D2
intents.question: Has Job been raised with APCC?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_E1
intents.question:
Has SSM checked prints and also aware of importants of preseving evidence, 

      keeping a timeline of events?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_E2
intents.question: Has SSM discuss remedial actions with the DSIM?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_F1
intents.question: Has T.O. arrivied at site?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_F2
intents.question:
T.O. on site, 

      SSM got permission to test points with T.O. on site?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_F3
intents.question: T.O. on site, SSM to swing points using SP command?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_F4
intents.question: Are the points failing both N and R?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_G1
intents.question: Suspect that the common wiring is good (unless there is more than one fault)?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_G2
intents.question:
Test the common o/g WK feed. 0v, chase back. 

      50v, the fault is outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H1
intents.question: Has an Intersig changeover been considered?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H2
intents.question: Does the fault clear with an Intersig changeover?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H3
intents.question:
Intersig changeover clears fault, then all common wiring is good. 


      Lost of redundancy further testing required on faulty side 
      of Station Controller Subsystem (SCS) intersig?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H4
intents.question:
Chase the missing input to the affected Intersig. 
      Fault found?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H5
intents.question:
Fault does NOT clear with Intersig changeover. 


      Is it 4ft points?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_H6
intents.question:
What type of points is it 


      Is it a Surelock?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I1
intents.question:
Assuming these are 4ft points that are failing oneway (ie from N to R), 


      Has the RLR (or NLR if failing R - N ) latched up?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I2
intents.question:
Fault does NOT clear with Intersig changeover, 
      and RLR is NOT latched. 

      Is NLR de-latched?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I3
intents.question:
Fault does NOT clear with Intersig changeover, 
      and RLR is NOT latched, 
      NLR de-latched . 

      Test the RLR pick up, is the RLR up?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I4
intents.question: Which LED is alight on the incoming WK surge suppressors - none?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I5
intents.question: Which LED is alight on the incoming WK surge suppressors - Reverse?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I6
intents.question: Which LED is alight on the incoming WK surge suppressors - Normal?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_I7
intents.question:
If reverse LED is alight on incoming WK surge suppressor 
      then test wiring that is common to both Intersigs?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_J1
intents.question:
Test incoming R WK MCBs. 

      Do you have 50V DC?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K1
intents.question:
Found 50V DC on Reverse (R) WK mcb's. 

      Test wiring that is common to both Intersigs?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K2
intents.question:
Found 0V on Reverse (R) WK mcb's. 

      The points have not achieved R detection?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K3
intents.question:
Found 0V on Reverse (R) WK mcb's. 

      The points have not achieved R detection. 

      Drop the WL using the o/g WL MCB. 

      Does the LED alight on the N WK surge suppressor?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K4
intents.question:
LED lit on the N WK surge suppressor. 
      Points should of moved reverse, but points have remained Normal. 
      Replace the WL MCB?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K5
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has a feed. 
      Points have remained Normal. 


       Call the points back to Normal, then N to R?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K5c
intents.question: If N WK surge suppressor remains ON , then this Indicates that the RWMR isnt energising?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K5c
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has a feed. 
      Points have remained Normal. 
      Test the o/g RW MCBs. 

      0v, chase back?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K6
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has a feed. 
      Points should of moved reverse, 

       Call the points back to Normal, then N to R 
      
      Test the o/g RW MCBs. 

      , the fault is outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K7
intents.question:
LED NOT lit on the N WK surge suppressor. Test incoming N WK MCBs. 

       Do you have 50V DC?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K8
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has a feed. 
      Points should of moved reverse, 
      but points have remained Normal. 
      Test the o/g RW MCBs. 

      0v, chase back?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K9
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has a feed. 
      Points should of moved reverse, 
      but points have remained Normal. Test the o/g RW MCBs. 

      100v the fault is outside.?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_K10
intents.question:
LED NOT lit on the N WK surge suppressor. 
      Test incoming N WK MCBs. 

       There was 0V?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_L1
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has NOT got a feed. 

       Points moved normal position?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_L2
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has NOT got a feed. 
      Points moved normal position, 

       Replace the WL MCB?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_L3
intents.question:
N WK surge suppressor has NOT got a feed. 
       Points moved normal position, 
       Replace the WL MCB, 

       The fault is outside.?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M1
intents.question: The WL is de energised?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M2
intents.question: Test the o/g WL feed. 0v, chase back. 100v, fault outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M3
intents.question:
Found 0V on Reverse (R) WK mcb's. 

      The points have not achieved R detection, 
      Drop the WL using the o/g WL MCB. 

      Does the LED alight on the N WK surge suppressor?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M4
intents.question:
LED is NOT lit on the N WK surge suppressor. 
      Test incoming N WK MCBs. Do you have 0 V?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M5
intents.question:
The points have moved from N. Replace the WL MCB. 

      The fault is outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_M6
intents.question:
The points have moved from N. Replace the WL MCB. 

      The fault is outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_O1
intents.question: The fault is outside?

intents.name: 4ft Points CBTC Fail1_O2
intents.question: Faulty Relay, card change or wiring issue?

intents.name: Cat1inc A1
intents.question:
***The management of Category One, Two and Three incidents*** 


      Discuss responsibility on the railway  both Network wide and local?

intents.name: Cat1inc B1
intents.question:
All staff must be competent and appropriately licensed 
      to carry out activities for all incidents: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer 
      Service Manager 
      Controller?

intents.name: Cat1inc B2
intents.question:
All staff must be competent and appropriately licensed 
      to carry out activities for all incidents: 

      Network Operations Manager 
      Operations Engineer (Asset Control Centre) 
      Network Operations Engineer (Asset Control Centre) 
      Network Incident Response Manager?

intents.name: Cat1inc B3
intents.question:
All staff must be competent and appropriately licensed 
      to carry out activities for all incidents: 

      Duty Manager 
      Customer Service Supervisor 
      customer Service Manager?

intents.name: Cat1inc C1
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer is accountable for the real time operation of the Network and 
      for co-ordinating activities across lines where necessary?

intents.name: Cat1inc C2
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer: 
      During formal incident management they must carry out the Gold Control role?

intents.name: Cat1inc C3
intents.question:
Formal incident management must only be declared: 

      by the LU Senior Operating Officer, 

      and for Category One incidents?

intents.name: Cat1inc C4
intents.question:
Must declare Category One for extreme circumstances such as terrorism, 
      a major derailment involving multiple fatalities 
      or incidents involving external bodies, 

      the LU Senior Operating Officer can handover the Gold Control role?

intents.name: Cat1inc C5
intents.question: Gold Control must seek advice from technical experts when required?

intents.name: Cat1inc D1
intents.question: Gold Control will appoint the appropriate Silver Control for incidents?

intents.name: Cat1inc D2
intents.question: Gold Control will decide if the incident requires on-site management?

intents.name: Cat1inc D3
intents.question:
If the incident escalates, 
      Gold Control will review the actions required, 
      and might appoint an alternative Silver Control 
      with more appropriate skills or experience?

intents.name: Cat1inc D4
intents.question:
Silver Control must appoint bronze control 
      to carry out specific actions for the recovery plan?

intents.name: Cat1inc E1
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer should consider waivers to rules 
      which would resolve the incident safely and more quickly?

intents.name: Cat1inc E2
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must base waivers to the rule book 
      on a recorded real time risk assessment 
      which provides adequate controls to mitigate risk?

intents.name: Cat1inc E3
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer 
      must also consider consulting appropriate persons 
      such as engineers or subject matter experts 
      depending on the nature of the incident?

intents.name: Cat1inc E4
intents.question:
The Service Manager 
      and LU Senior Operating Officer 
      must prioritise the safety 
      and welfare of customers on trains between stations?

intents.name: Cat1inc F1
intents.question:
There are three incident categories: 

      Category One incidents require formal incident management
      Category Two incidents require local incident management
      Category Three incidents require monitoring?

intents.name: Cat1inc F2
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      when formal incident management is implemented. 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must declare an incident to be Category One, and 

      implement formal incident management?

intents.name: Cat1inc F3
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      trains to be stalled for more than 30 minutes?

intents.name: Cat1inc F4
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      

      full or partial line suspension?

intents.name: Cat1inc F5
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      

      serious infrastructure damage?

intents.name: Cat1inc F6
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      

      serious injury or loss?

intents.name: Cat1inc F7
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      

      more than one line affected?

intents.name: Cat1inc F8
intents.question:
In a Category One incidents the LU Senior Operating Officer: 

      LU Senior Operating Officer must carry out the role of Gold Control 
      and declare an incident to be Category One, if there is the potential for: 

      

      multiple locations to be affected.?

intents.name: Cat1inc F9
intents.question:
There might be other incidents, 

         the LU Senior Operating Officer must declare a Category One incident for: 

       A radio system failure 
        major power failure 
       major flooding incident 
       a confirmed terrorist attack?

intents.name: Cat1inc F10
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must declare a Category One incident for (aswell as other incidents): 

       a major fire 
       a code red message to all trains on a line 
       an evacuation of the Underground 
       a person under a train?

intents.name: Cat1inc G1
intents.question: The Service Manager will decide if an incident is to be declared as Category Two?

intents.name: Cat1inc G2
intents.question:
The Service Manager must declare an incident to be Category Two 
      and implement local incident management when: 

      the incident is limited to one line or location 

      trains are likely to be stalled in tunnels for less than 30 minutes.?

intents.name: Cat1inc G3
intents.question:
There might be other incidents, 

         The Service Manager must declare a Category Two incident for incidents such as: 

      A radio cell failure 
      a local temporary loss of traction current 
      trackside fires 
      trespassers 
      defective trains or signalling equipment?

intents.name: Cat1inc G4
intents.question:
The Service Manager must declare a Category Two incident for incidents such as: 

      Full or partial closure of a security category A station 
      persons ill on a train 
      security incidents 
      where there is an impact on local events.?

intents.name: Cat1inc G5
intents.question: The Service Manager will decide if an incident is to be declared as Category Three?

intents.name: Cat1inc G6
intents.question:
The Service Manager must monitor any incident which does not directly affect the train service, such as: 

      escalator closure 
      full or partial closure of a station that is not security category A 
      station control measures?

intents.name: Cat1inc G7
intents.question: Category Two incidents, is Service Manager managing incidents locally?

intents.name: Cat1inc G8
intents.question:
Service Manager must continually review the status of the incident. 

      Service Manager must tell the Duty Network Operations Manager 
      what actions are to be taken, by whom and when. 
      Service Manager must keep the LU Senior Operating Officer updated of the situation?

intents.name: Cat1inc H1
intents.question:
The Duty Network Operations Manager must: 

      Confirm which radio incident talk group will be used throughout the incident 
      actively monitor the incident status and train positions 
      positively confirm with the Service Manager the operational?

intents.name: Cat1inc H2
intents.question:
The Duty Network Operations Manager must: 

      Status and proposed incident management actions 
      take an overview of the rest of the Network which could have a 
      bearing on the management of the incident?

intents.name: Cat1inc H3
intents.question:
The Duty Network Operations Manager must: 

      Evaluate the probable scenarios that the incident could develop into and advise the LU Senior Operating Officer 
      inform other Service Managers who might become affected by the incident?

intents.name: Cat1inc H4
intents.question:
Service Manager 
      Duty Network Operations Manager 
      Network Operations Engineer must make the LU Senior Operating Officer aware of 


      anything which could cause the incident to escalate: SM DNOM and NOE must consider: 
      how long the incident has been on-going 
      how long it is likely to be before normal operations are resumed 
      the impact beyond the incident location?

intents.name: Cat1inc I1
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer aware 
      of anything which could cause the incident to escalate. 
      The LU Senior Operating Officer must consider: 
      whether other agencies such as the emergency services are required 
      anything else which is likely to cause the incident to escalate?

intents.name: Cat1inc I2
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer aware 
      of anything which could cause the incident to escalate. 
      The LU Senior Operating Officer must: 
      try to resolve the incident safely and more quickly by authorising waivers to the rules 
      decide if the incident needs to be upgraded to a Category One incident 

      tell the Service Manager, 
      Duty Network Operations Manager, 
      Network Operations Engineer, your decision.?

intents.name: Cat1inc I3
intents.question:
When the incident has been classified as Category One, 
      The LU Senior Operating Officer must: 

      declare formal incident management 
      act as Gold Control 
      appoint Silver Control?

intents.name: Cat1inc I4
intents.question:
A conference call can be arranged by 
      the Duty Network Operation Manager, if required. 

      The LU Senior Operating Officer would lead the conference call?

intents.name: Cat1inc I5
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must agree: 

      which radio incident talk group will be used throughout the incident 
      what the aim is operationally 
      what actions are to be taken, by whom and when?

intents.name: Cat1inc I6
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must also identify: 

      milestones, 
      decisions 
      and estimated times, 
      including a realistic time for the incident to be resolved. 

      The LU Senior Operating Officer must record any decisions that is made?

intents.name: Cat1inc J1
intents.question:
The Duty Network Operations Manager is responsible for: 

      monitoring the incident milestones 
      and providing updates?

intents.name: Cat1inc J2
intents.question:
The Duty Network Operations Manager must, 
       agree with the LU Senior Operating Officer, 
      who will be responsible for co-ordinating with external agencies, 

      such as: 
      the British Transport Police 
      the London Fire Brigade 
      the London Ambulance Service 
      the Rail Accident Investigations Branch (RAIB) 
      the Office of the Rail and Road (ORR).?

intents.name: Cat1inc J3
intents.question:
Every 15 minutes, 
      and as The Duty Network Operations Manager receive information, 

      they must: 
      update changes to the milestones 
      communicate those changes to all concerned 
      record any decisions that Duty Network Operations Manager make?

intents.name: Cat1inc K1
intents.question:
Gold Control will appoint the person with the most appropriate specialist skills, 
      and experience as Silver Control. This could be, for example: 

      a Network Incident Response Manager, or 
      local Duty Manager, or 
      a Network Operations Engineer (Asset Control Centre), or 
      another suitable person.?

intents.name: Cat1inc K2
intents.question:
Silver Control is the single point of contact 
      from the incident site to the incident control centre?

intents.name: Cat1inc K3
intents.question:
When Silver Control arrive at the incident site, 

      Silver Control must: 

      establish Silver Controls authority to local staff, 
      the emergency services and the LU Senior Operating Officer 

      establish a location where Silver Control can be easily contactable, 
      with radio or established communications available?

intents.name: Cat1inc K4
intents.question:
When Silver Control arrive at the incident site, 

      Silver Control must: 

      make sure Silver Control wear your Silver Control tabard 
      have your hand portable radio with you and 
      make sure it is on the agreed incident channel 

      and talk group 

      determine the status of the incident?

intents.name: Cat1inc K5
intents.question:
Silver Control must also: 
      identify yourself to staff as Silver Control 
      clarify with the local staff what remains under their control?

intents.name: Cat1inc K6
intents.question:
Silver Control must also: 
      appoint bronze control to carry out specific incident management duties 
      update Gold Control and the Service Manager every 15 minutes?

intents.name: Cat1inc K7
intents.question:
Silver Control must update Gold Control 
      and the Service Manager 
      if at any point the situation changes?

intents.name: Cat1inc K8
intents.question:
If Silver Control have been appointed for the emergency services, 

      Silver Control must: 

      identify emergency services Silver Control and brief them on the status of the incident 
      establish each Silver Controls responsibilities for control and boundaries?

intents.name: Cat1inc K9
intents.question:
If Silver Control have been appointed for the emergency services, 

      Silver Control must: 

      update the emergency services Silver Control on any changes to the incident status, as they occur 
      attend meetings with emergency services and other agencies, if required?

intents.name: Cat1inc K10
intents.question:
If Silver Control have been appointed for the emergency services, 


      Silver Control must make sure the member of staff at the rendez vous point: 

      is able to update the arriving emergency services 
      with both service and incident information 

      has a radio with them which is set up on the incident talk group?

intents.name: Cat1inc L1
intents.question:
When normal operations can resume. 
      Silver Control must tell the LU Senior Operating Officer 
      when the incident has cleared on site 
      and normal operations are resuming?

intents.name: Cat1inc L2
intents.question:
LU Senior Operating Officer must tell the following when formal incident management is no longer required: 

      Duty Network Operations Manager 
      Network Operations Engineer 
      senior managers 
      Service Manager?

intents.name: Cat1inc L3
intents.question:
At the end of formal incident management 
      the LU Senior Operating Officer must arrange 
      for staff undertaking incident roles to resume normal working?

intents.name: Cat1inc L4
intents.question:
At the end of formal incident management 
      If as a result of the incident the area cannot function as part of the operational railway, 

      the area will be secured and isolated?

intents.name: Cat1inc M1
