intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must pass control 
      to the relevant body depending on the type of incident: 

      LU Engineering Professional Head or nominee 
      British Transport Police if the incident area has become a crime scene 
      Rail Accident Investigations Branch (RAIB) for incidents such as derailments or deaths 
      London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority (LFEPA) for incidents involving fires?

intents.name: Cat1inc M1
intents.question:
The LU Senior Operating Officer must encourage a hand back 
      of assets at the earliest opportunity?

intents.name: R0489 Testing A1
intents.question:
Maintenance and Incident testing 

                   or 

      Verification and Function testing?

intents.name: R0489 Testing A2
intents.question:
Maintenance and incident Circuit and System Testing: 
      The following circuit tests shall be employed following 
      maintenance or incident replacement work as a minimum 
      or as agreed by the issuing authority of the 
      Authority to Work Certificate or person authorising the task?

intents.name: R0489 Testing A3
intents.question:
Operational test: 

      Exercise equipment to confirm that it physically operates as expected. 

      (NOTE: In all testing, every test should be repeated 3 times to confirm result) 

      For equipment that comprise active switchable contacts 
      e.g. 
      circuit controllers, 
      relays, 
      MCBs, 
      fuses, 
      links, 
      plungers, 
      limit switches, 
      lever bands etc?

intents.name: R0489 Testing B1
intents.question:
The following tests should be undertaken. 

      BX Selection test: Confirm that the circuit feed fuse is in accordance with the circuit diagrams. 

      With multi-meter connected to the feed side of contact and earth. 
      Observe feed voltage present. 
      Remove circuit feed fuse. Observe loss of voltage on multimeter. 
      Replace feed fuse and observe that the voltage returns?

intents.name: R0489 Testing B2
intents.question:
Contact Orientation test: 
      Place multi-meter between return side of contact to earth. 
      Observe feed voltage present. 
      Break feed side of contact and observe loss of voltage on multi-meter. 
      Make contact and observe that the voltage returns?

intents.name: R0489 Testing B3
intents.question:
Periodic maintenance verification activities would 
      only require an operational test to be conducted, 
      whereas an annual certified test activity would require 
      all the tests detailed below to be conducted?

intents.name: R0489 Testing B4
intents.question:
Confirmation of operation against design: 

      Set up conditions for energisation of each end function (e.g. GR). 
      Break and make contacts of the maintained 
      or replaced equipment to confirm that 
      the end function responds appropriately 
      and in accordance with the site specific drawings. 
      Where feasible, repeat for all individual contacts 
      of the maintained or replaced equipment?

intents.name: R0489 Testing B5
intents.question:
For some equipment, e.g.:  

      Q style relays 
      or sealed contact boxes. 

      It may not be practicable to exercise 
      each individual contact without adopting strap 
      and function testing. 

      In these cases logical functioning of the equipment is permissible?

intents.name: R0489 Testing C1
intents.question:
The following system tests shall be undertaken to confirm the correct operation 
      of the signalling affected by the maintained 
      or replaced equipment in accordance wit the area:?

intents.name: R0489 Testing C2
intents.question:
Automatic area: 

      Confirm correct operation of affected signalling in the local area?

intents.name: R0489 Testing C3
intents.question:
Semi-Automatic area: 

      Carry out manual test 
      of affected signalling from Power Frame 
      or Interlocking Machine?

intents.name: R0489 Testing C4
intents.question:
Semi-Automatic area: 

      Carry out remote route call 
      and cancellation test of affected signalling from the Control Centre?

intents.name: R0489 Testing D1
intents.question:
Its important to define the minimum testing requirements 
      to be carried out after signalling equipment has been maintained, 
      repaired or replaced as part of: 


      Planned maintenance 

      Preventative or corrective maintenance 

      Incident / fault rectification?

intents.name: R0489 Testing D2
intents.question: The replacement of signalling equipment includes planned routine change activities?

intents.name: R0489 Testing E1
intents.question:
Maintenance and Incident testing For Vital Signalling Equipment 
       to any task which interrupts or interferes with 
       the commissioned signalling system and which: 


       On completion returns the signalling to exactly the same design configuration 
       as before (commonly referred to as like-for-like)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing E2
intents.question:
Maintenance and Incident testing For Vital Signalling Equipment 
       to any task which interrupts or interferes with 
       the commissioned signalling system and which: 


       Is of limited extent and complexity?

intents.name: R0489 Testing F1
intents.question:
The objective of Maintenance and Incident testing is to verify that 
      the repaired or maintained signalling system 
      including equipment replaced on a like for like basis, 


      Is correctly adjusted?

intents.name: R0489 Testing F2
intents.question:
The objective of Maintenance and Incident testing is to verify that 
      the repaired or maintained signalling system 
      including equipment replaced on a like for like basis, 


      Operating within the defined critical parameters?

intents.name: R0489 Testing F3
intents.question:
The objective of Maintenance and Incident testing is to verify that 
      the repaired or maintained signalling system 
      including equipment replaced on a like for like basis, 


      Operates within the defined critical tolerances?

intents.name: R0489 Testing F4
intents.question:
The objective of Maintenance and Incident testing is to verify that 
      the repaired or maintained signalling system 
      including equipment replaced on a like for like basis, 


      That the signalling logic is functioning in accordance 
      with the relevant design drawings?

intents.name: R0489 Testing F5
intents.question:
Testing shall be sufficient and appropriate 
      to ensure the integrity of the assets being worked upon, 

      including any associated assets?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G1
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      Inadequate protection of the operational railway during testing?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G2
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


       The presence of redundant, 
      uncommissioned or decommissioned equipment on site 
      (particularly if these are not shown in the site records)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G3
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      The poor condition of existing equipment 
      (e.g. degraded or damaged wire insulation)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G4
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      Non-standard equipment 
      (e.g. trainstops having non-standard contact arrangements)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G5
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


       the masking of certain controls by other controls leaving part untested 
      (e.g. track circuit controls being masked by timer down-proving)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G6
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      replacement of memory components 
      (e.g. gravity bias or magnetically latched relays), 
      or polarity-critical components (e.g. polarised relays)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G7
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      transfer of critical-identity data modules 
      (such as site-specific or version-specific EPROMs) 
      to replacement sub-systems, 
      or replacement of the data modules themselves?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G8
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      replacement of configurable components 
      (e.g. switch-encoded processor cards, or adjustable timers)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G9
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      replacement of components by physically interchangeable items 
      which may not be  operationally equivalent 
      (e.g. DEV Line and Track relays)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G10
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      hazards associated with temporary or irregular connections, 


      such as 

      test equipment 
      or as in S2530 Irregular adjustment to the signalling system?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G11
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      out-of-date records, 
      or discrepancies between site records and the physical installation on site, 


      for example: 

      relay contacts with wiring to armature 
      and front terminals reversed?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G12
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      out-of-date records, 
      or discrepancies between site records and the physical installation on site, 


      for example: 

      outside terminal boxes at older sites, 
      which may not be shown on wiring plans?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G13
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      A testing environment that increases fatigue or impedes tester effectiveness 
      (e.g. high noise levels or poor lighting)?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G14
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


      Unintended damage to equipment during storage, transit or installation?

intents.name: R0489 Testing G15
intents.question:
Hazards that need to be considered and that may also arise 
      from or be associated with  maintenance activities 
      and / or incident testing: 


       The experience and knowledge of the person undertaking 
      the activity to enable  assessment of the correct 
      and adequate level testing required for the task?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H1
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 
      Agreement shall be gained between the person instructing the activity 
      and the person undertaking the activity on the required work 
      and the level of testing to be undertaken?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H2
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing:  
      Should take into consideration the effectiveness 
      of the planned tests to identify any risks that could impair 
      the safety or integrity of the signalling system?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H3
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 
      Noting the examples of the hazards that may arise 
      or be associated with maintenance 
      and incident testing activity?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H4
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 

      It shall be confirmed that the equipment has been installed 
      and or maintained in accordance with the relevant Work Instruction?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H5
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing:  

      Or replaced in accordance with the pre-authorised replacement task instructions?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H6
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 

      The equipment shall be inspected 
      and assessed for signs of damage that could affect the correct operation 
      or render the component unfit for purpose?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H7
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 

      The security devices to protect the component during transportation 
      where installed shall be carefully removed?

intents.name: R0489 Testing H8
intents.question:
For preparation for maintenance and incident testing: 

      It shall be confirmed that test equipment 
      and gauges to be used during the testing whether electrical 
      or mechanical are calibrated 
      and fit for purpose in accordance with generic requirements?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I1
intents.question:
A review of site specific drawings, 
      plans and schedules shall be carried out by the person undertaking 
      the work to identify equipment specific characteristics 
      (e.g. individual contact type and circuit usage) 
      that need to be considered and understood before devising 
      and formalising the specific test requirements or test plan?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I2
intents.question:
For hard wired equipment additional safeguards are required 
      to control the risk of replacing such equipment 
      and the risks associated with misrouting of wire?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I3
intents.question:
Equipment may employ a non-standard contact arrangement. 
      It is therefore necessary to confirm the configuration 
      through reference to the site specific drawings 
      and visually to the replacement part?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I4
intents.question:
The tester, fault finder or maintainer shall identify 
      and record all of the functions and / or circuits affected by the repair, 
      maintenance or replacement activity that require testing. 
      This is to ensure that all relevant tests are identified 
      and when implemented may be evidenced as completed?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I5
intents.question:
The list of planned tests and the way they are to be carried out 
      shall be revised to include any required mitigations 
      and defences to control any key hazards that have been 
      identified prior to commencing the work / change out activity?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I6
intents.question:
Upon completion of the required testing, 
      the testing conducted must be formally detailed on the Authority to Work Certificate 
      or the relevant maintenance specific quality assurance form (QAF) 
      for non authority to work certificate activitie?

intents.name: R0489 Testing I7
intents.question:
These documents will form part of the testing evidence on 
      the completion and hand back of the asset into operational service?

intents.name: R0489 Testing J1
intents.question:
Routine change of Signalling Assets Routine change activities 
      for signalling equipment are prescribed in S2533 
      Routine Change Periods for Signalling Assets?

intents.name: R0489 Testing J2
intents.question:
The routine change interval is mandated for signalling equipment with 
      potentially unsafe failure modes due to progressive degradation 
      that cannot be satisfactorily addressed by maintenance 
      and testing of the equipment at its installed position?

intents.name: R0489 Testing K1
intents.question:
Testing of the component/s or system verification testing 
      shall be conducted following any routine change 
      activity to ensure that all circuits associated 
      with the renewed equipment operate correctly and as designed?

intents.name: R0489 Testing K2
intents.question:
As the complexity of the routine change activity 
      can be extensive and simultaneous, 
      this shall managed through the production of a test plan to control, 
      assess the required testing and reduce any potential risk?

intents.name: R0489 Testing K3
intents.question:
The test plan will be retained in support of the authority to work certificate 
      for the activity as evidence on the completion 
      and hand back of the asset into operational service?

intents.name: R0489 Testing L1
intents.question:
Incident testing Signal Incident testing is normally 
      in response to a failure of the signalling system 
      whether a component failure or another fault in the 
      functionality of the system or in the application?

intents.name: R0489 Testing L2
intents.question:
Normal incident management controls are covered in engineering standards 
      S2530 Irregular adjustment to signalling system 
      and S2529 Signalling and signalling control systems 
      safety critical processes standards?

intents.name: R0489 Testing L3
intents.question:
Where a failure of the signalling system requires 
      a like for like component replacement in the operational environment, 
      the task authorisation and comprehensive testing 
      shall be agreed between the issuing authority 
      and the receiver of the authority to work certificate?

intents.name: R0489 Testing M1
intents.question:
There may be situations where it is not practicable to undertake 
      comprehensive testing of the signalling system following asset replacement 
      prior to resumption of the train service?

intents.name: R0489 Testing M2
intents.question:
In such circumstances, 
      where it is not practicable to undertake comprehensive testing. 
      Limited verification testing is permissible 
      but only after assessment of the risks, 
      identification of any specific mitigations 
      and controls that may be applied to safeguard 
      the operational railway during the period at risk 
      and until comprehensive testing can be completed. 

      The assessment and mitigation identification should be recorded?

intents.name: R0489 Testing M3
intents.question:
When considering limited testing during traffic hours, 
       care should be taken to consider all the credible threats 
       to the effectiveness of the reduced testing 
       and the required mitigation controls as a minimum 
       to reduce any adverse effects on the safety and operation of the railway?

intents.name: R0489 Testing N1
intents.question:
Where full testing of the component 
       or system is required to enable an asset to be returned 
       into full service this should always be undertaken. 

       E.g. blockjointless track circuits - 
        the change of a transmitter power setting 
       would require a full track set up to be performed?

intents.name: R0489 Testing N2
intents.question:
Where full testing of the component 
       or system is required to enable an asset to be returned 
       into full service this should always be undertaken. 

       E.g. blockjointless track circuits - 
        cannot be verified through the controlled movement of a train(s) 
       in the area and monitoring the track circuit operation?

intents.name: R0489 Testing O1
intents.question: The testing of electronic and computer based systems should be appropriate to the risk?

intents.name: R0489 Testing O2
intents.question:
Where such systems run self-tests 
      and checks during initialisation, 
      then testing may limited to checking that 
      such self-tests have been completed successfully?

intents.name: R0489 Testing O3
intents.question:
Sub-systems should be checked to ensure that they are correctly configured, 

      e.g. setting of links, 
      correct software 
      and firmware?

intents.name: R0489 Testing P1
intents.question: Safety testing is not required where configuration errors are self-revealing?

intents.name: R0489 Testing P2
intents.question:
Peripheral equipment such as 

       relays, 
      point systems, 
      indication boxes etc. 


      which cannot subject to system self-tests and diagnostics 
      must be tested in a manner appropriate to their function and application?

intents.name: R0489 Testing P3
intents.question:
Information Recording and certifying the test results, 
      so the completed testing shall be detailed on the Authority to Work Certificate?

intents.name: R0489 Testing Q1
intents.question:
Where the work is considered more complex, 
      extended or simultaneous than typical routine maintenance preventative 
      and corrective activities a test plan will need to be formalised and retained?

intents.name: R0489 Testing Q2
intents.question:
A test plan example; 

      routine change or major track works?

intents.name: R0489 Testing Q3
intents.question:
The reference number of the test plan 
      shall be recorded on the issued Authority to Work Certificate?

intents.name: R0489 Testing Q4
intents.question:
The Authority to Work Certificate should record test plan 
      reference number covering the work and the required testing?

intents.name: R0489 Testing R1
intents.question:
Any additional tests or deviations from the agreed testing 
      will need to be agreed by the AWC issuing authority?

intents.name: R0489 Testing R2
intents.question:
Any additional tests or deviations from the agreed testing 
      will need to be detailed on the Authority to Work Certificate?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A1
intents.question:
Verification and Cable Testing 

      or 

      Strap and Function testing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A1
intents.question:
There are 2 types Function test, 

      Basic functional testing, and a Strap n Function test. 


      Both involve making and breaking contacts 
      and observing loss of function of the load?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A2
intents.question:
Verification and Correlation 

      or 

      Start a Cable Test?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A2
intents.question:
Correction Test 

      or 

 discuss Verification?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A3
intents.question:
What is Verification - 

      Verification is Wire Proving a circuit to its intended design. 
      After every install there is: 

      V&F testing, 
      priniciples testing, 
      Mtce, so the circuit architecture is maintained as per design intention. 

      A new system and cables should last minimun 25 years. 
      The end life cycle of a system / circuit is De-Commissioning stage?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A4
intents.question:
For NEW INSTALLATION it essential to maintain independence of testing. 

      Also independent testing required for MODIFICATIONS as its a change to the way it works, 

      and for ALTERATIONS an independent tester is needed to prove that it works the same as before the alteration?

intents.name: Cable Test1 A5
intents.question:
Verification is proving the correct wire goes to the correct termination and position. 

      Verification should be done with power supply off. 
      Ideally with Wires Off and MCB out, Fuses removed. 

      Also a separate independent tester should be used 
      when Verification is done?

intents.name: Cable Test1 B1
intents.question:
What is Correlation - 

      Hand Tracing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 B2
intents.question:
What is Correlation - 

      Continuity Testing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 B3
intents.question:
What is Correlation - 

      Wire Count?

intents.name: Cable Test1 B4
intents.question:
What is Correlation - 

      Profiling, 
      does the drawings and physical site agree?

intents.name: Cable Test1 C1
intents.question: Multi core / Multi pair cables carry a higher risk of cores touching?

intents.name: Cable Test1 C2
intents.question:
Multi core / Multi pair cables carry a higher risk 
      of circuit migration from insulation degradation?

intents.name: Cable Test1 D1
intents.question:
Concentric cables carries a lower risk as it has: 

      a solid inner core (Bx) 
      insulation 
      spiral outer core (Nx) 
      Outer insulation?

intents.name: Cable Test1 D2
intents.question:
Concentric cables carries a lower risk of inner to inner core 
      circuit migration due to the physical make up of the cable?

intents.name: Cable Test1 D3
intents.question:
Very important to know the cable type before making an Irregular Adjustment.  
      As it will dictate the risk assessment and scope of testing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 E1
intents.question:
Insulation Resistance testing (IR Testing) - Meggering 

      Applies a high voltage to the circuit 
      and measures the amount of current 
      that flows through the insulation?

intents.name: Cable Test1 E2
intents.question:
Insulation Resistance testing (IR Testing) - Meggering 

      If no current is measured in Insulation Resistance testing, 
      this confirms insulation is good between the cables being tested?

intents.name: Cable Test1 E3
intents.question:
Meggering is carried out on a cable, wires and cables are different. 

      A cable have multiple wires within and the wires contain core conductors. 


      A cable (two or more wires) require meggering 
      to test insulation between the wires in the cable?

intents.name: Cable Test1 E4
intents.question:
Insulation Resistance testing (IR Testing) - Meggering 

      Rule of thumb 
      Set Megger meter to double the normal circuit operating voltage?

intents.name: Cable Test1 E5
intents.question:
Insulation Resistance testing (IR Testing) - Meggering 

      Rule of thumb 
      Bx100 circuit, set Megger meter to 200V or above (250V) setting. 

      or for a 230V circuit, then set Megger meter to 500v?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F1
intents.question: Procedure PR0912 states Insulation Resistance of new or existing cable must be 10M Ohms or greater?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F2
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states if Insulation Resistance is less than 10M Ohms 
      then it must be escalated to the senior on call Duty Signal Manager (DSM)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F3
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states 500K Ohms (is same as 0.5M Ohms). 
      This is the low threshold that the DSM will keep a cable in commision?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F4
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states Cable Insulation Resistance below 250K Ohms (0.25M Ohms) 
      Then the cores within the wire that form the cable is in trouble, 

      must be escalated to DSM immediately?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F5
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states a Time Domain Reflectometer (TDR meter) is used when: 

      There is a cable fault. 
      It is used to determine the Dielectric Constant?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F6
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states that the Dielectric Constant of the core 
      (the core in the wire that makes up the cable) 

      Is a measure of its ability to store electrical energy. 
      The TDR meter determines how much electric flux the core holds and the impedance?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F7
intents.question:
Procedure PR0912 states that for Optical Fibre cable 

      A Optical Time Domain Reflectometer (OTDR meter) is used?

intents.name: Cable Test1 F8
intents.question:
The OTDR meter tests the integrity of a optical fiber cable 
      and is used for the building, certifying, maintaining, 
      and troubleshooting fiber optic systems?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G1
intents.question:
Polarity Test 

      When testing a two core cable a polarity test is carried out?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G2
intents.question:
The Polarity Test is carried out by putting a DC battery on one end 
      and a meter on the other end to prove correct polarity, 
      and ensure cores have not been crossed?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G3
intents.question:
Earth Test 

      When testing Earth Resistance, 
      the test is made from pre-determined Test Core to earth 
      with a meter at one end and a test loop (Strap) at the far end?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G4
intents.question:
The Earth Resistance ( Ohms) reading should be lower than the lowest core resistance. 


      This important so that if earth fault occurs, 
      electricity will take earth route as its should have the lowest impedance?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G5
intents.question:
Types of Cable Faults - 

      Crossed Cores (Insulation / Cable repair) 

      Open Circuit Cores 

      Core to Core 

      Core to Earth?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G6
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 1 - 

      (i) Cores Intact - 
      Test identifies Crossed Cores and O/C Cores?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G7
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 2 - 

      (ii) Cores In-Contact - 
      Test identifies Cores not in-contact with other cores?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G8
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 2 (Cores In-Contact) - 

      should be tested with a Spider (Wig// Bunch) Tester?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G9
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 2 (Cores In-Contact) - 

      Spider (Wig// Bunch) Tester saves time when testing, 
      and if multicore cable is degraded the insulation resistance reading 
      is even lower (like resistors in parallel) highlighting faults even more?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G10
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 2 (Cores In-Contact) - 

      Spider (Wig// Bunch) Tester Is better method for new cable. 
      However for Annual core to core Insulation testing 
      then a Megger without Spider is best?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G11
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 3 - 

      (iii) Cores In-Contact with Earth - 
      Test identifies Cores not in-contact with Earth?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G12
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 3 (Cores In-Contact with Earth) - 

      This will be tested with a Megger + a Spider?

intents.name: Cable Test1 G13
intents.question:
Multi Core Cable Test 3 (Cores In-Contact with Earth) - 

      If an Earth exist it will only be on one core, 
      as multiple cores to earth would have shown in Test 2 Cores in Contact?

intents.name: Cable Test1 H1
intents.question:
Testing in  Ohms setting would show a core thats dead (in contact) to earth. 
      But it can potentially miss a partial degraded core to earth. 

      Therefore must use M setting to get an accurate insulation test reading?

intents.name: Cable Test1 H2
intents.question:
Resistance values of a Multi-Core cable - 

      Set test meter to lowest resistive setting (not on Bell setting)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 H3
intents.question:
Test the Resistance values of meter leads, 
      its important to note that LONG LEADS can add significant resistance to meter readings. 

      Hence why adjustment to calculations will be required, 
      or meters adjusted to null to compensate for extra Meter Lead resistance?

intents.name: Cable Test1 H4
intents.question: Test Resistance values of test loop (Straps) and adjustments made to null the strap resistance to meter readings?

intents.name: Cable Test1 I1
intents.question:
Zero out your meter, to the meter leads and test loop resistance value, 
      or record resistance to be deducted later on?

intents.name: Cable Test1 I2
intents.question: Recording as you go, tell the test assistant put the loop (Strap) on and come off, strap on c1 strap off c1?

intents.name: Cable Test1 I3
intents.question: Tester put meter on C1, tell the test assistant strap on c1, record results, tell test assistant strap off c1?

intents.name: Cable Test1 I4
intents.question:
Use the equation L1 = C1+C3 , L2 = C1+C2 , L3 = C2+C3 . 

       note: 
       'C' means - Core 
       'L' is the core resistance. 


      ((L1 + L2) - L3) / 2 = Test Core Resistance?

intents.name: Cable Test1 J1
intents.question:
The 'Test Core' is normally designated as Core 1 

      (Note: Air main can be used as a test cable)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 J2
intents.question:
Using the Test Core (ie; Core 1) as reference
      Measure each Core in turn to Core 1 

      Now subtract the Test core resistance value (calculated earlier from the equation)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 J3
intents.question:
Using the Test Core (ie; Core 1) as reference
      Now subtract the Test core resistance value (calculated earlier from the equation), 
      from each core reading to get each individual core resistance value?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K1
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (1) Cores Intact test - 
      Requires a test assistance at the other end with a test Loop (Strap)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K2
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (1) Cores Intact test - 
      Use the Test Core (ie; Core 1) as reference to test 

      each individual core. 

      This test identifies Crossed Cores and O/C?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K3
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (1) Cores Intact test - 
      Use the Test Core (ie; Core 1) as reference to test 

      the Internal 'Earth Core' (if applicable) 
      and the Local Earth?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K4
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (1) Cores Intact test - 
      Earth Resistance reading should be lower than the lowest core resistance 

      Earth readings should be recorded?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K5
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (1) Cores Intact test - 
      If Crossed or O/C Cores are identified: 
      They must be proved 
      Rectified 
      and the entire test must be repeated before progressing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K6
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (2) Cores In-Contact test - 
      Use a Megger and Spider to test each core to all other cores 


      (excluding Earth Core / local Earth stud)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K7
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (2) Cores In-Contact test - 
      Use a Megger and Spider test identifies cores not in-contact with other cores 
      (Interconnections, Short circuits)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K8
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (2) Cores In-Contact test - 

      When using a Megger 
      Set the test voltage to twice the value of the normal circuit voltage?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K9
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (2) Cores In-Contact test - 
      If using a Megger without the Spider 
      then test each core to all other cores individually 
      (eg; core 1 to all, core 2 to all, etc)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K10
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (2) Cores In-Contact test - 
      If interconnections, short circuit cores are identified: 
      They must be proved 
      Rectified 
      and the entire test must be repeated before progressing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K11
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (3) Cores In-Contact with Earth test - 
      Use a Megger and Spider to test all cores to Earth 


      This test identifies Cores not in-contact with Earth?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K12
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (3) Cores In-Contact with Earth test - 

      A 0 reading indicates that a Core is down to Earth 

      You must then drop off one core at a time from the Spider, 
      until you get an adequate reading (500K minimum)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K13
intents.question:
Testing a Multi-Core (3) Cores In-Contact with Earth test - 
      Re-proved the last Core remove as the faulty core 
      Rectified 
      and the entire test must be repeated before progressing?

intents.name: Cable Test1 K14
intents.question:
Important! 

      Once all Meggering is complete ensure all cores are discharged to EARTH?

intents.name: Cable Test1 L1
intents.question:
Forms: For New Cable Installations or a large Multicore (>14 cores) use: 

      F0684 - AO Signals Cable Test Forms?

intents.name: Cable Test1 L2
intents.question:
Forms: For Annual Cable Insulation Tests (Meggering) (<14 cores) use: 

      F0747 AO Signals Cable Megger Test Form?

intents.name: Cable Test1 M1
intents.question:
Check Marker (LUL) Standards - 

      Installation / Testing / Modification / Recovery - 

      Blue Paper Copies 
      Pink Paper Copies 
      White Paper Copies?

intents.name: Cable Test1 M2
intents.question:
Check Marker (LUL) Standards - 
      Installation / Testing / Modification / Recovery - 

      Blue Paper Copies 
      Instalation Copy, check marked by 'Installer' to record progress of Installation?

intents.name: Cable Test1 M3
intents.question:
Check Marker (LUL) Standards - 
      Installation / Testing / Modification / Recovery - 

      Pink Paper Copies 
      Tester Copy, check marked by 'Tester' to record progress of Commissioning?

intents.name: Cable Test1 M4
intents.question:
Check Marker (LUL) Standards - 
      Installation / Testing / Modification / Recovery - 

      White Paper Copies 

      Commissioned Copy, 'As Built' Copy?

intents.name: Cable Test1 N1
intents.question:
Both Installer and Tester to use unique colour - 

      Colour should be identified by Signing and Dating the sheet?

intents.name: Cable Test1 N2
intents.question:
Note: LUL installers also Test 

      So the intaller is able to Check Mark the Blue Paper copy using unique colour?

intents.name: Cable Test1 O1
intents.question:
Circuit Colours on a print: - 

      BLACK - A commissioned circuit?

intents.name: Cable Test1 O2
intents.question:
Circuit Colours on a print: - 

      RED - A modification or Alteration to a circuit 

      (Alteration - to change form or structure to circuitry) 
      (Modification - to make partial changes to circuit to improve it)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 O3
intents.question:
Circuit Colours on a print: - 

      BLUE - A circuit is in stage works / commision at later date 

      (To stage work a circuit is to prepare it finely for a commit, 
      so it is working but uncommisioned)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 O4
intents.question:
Circuit Colours on a print: - 

      BROWN - A circuit is in stage works / commision at an even later date 

      (To stage work a circuit (coloured brown) is to prepare for a commit at much more later date, 
      so it is working but uncommisioned)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 O5
intents.question:
Circuit Colours on a print: - 

      GREEN - A circuit to be recovered?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P1
intents.question:
To avoid confusion with design office colours 
      and colours used for modifying circuit drawings. 

      Installers and Testers MUST NOT use ink colours of: 

      BLACK, RED, BLUE, BROWN, GREEN, and ORANGE?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P2
intents.question:
RED INK - 
      A circuit 'Alteration' - 

      Circuit is altered but functionality hasn't changed. 
      eg ; Faulty wires swapped over to a spare pair?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P3
intents.question:
RED INK - 
      A circuit 'Modification' - 

      Circuit functionality has been changed, Modified?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P4
intents.question:
If a circuit is Altered or Modified the Red Ink modification drawings are admended at site. 

      The DSIM's copy, 
      the Control Room T.O. copy 
      and Drawing Office copy is also admended?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P5
intents.question:
Copies of RED INK modified drawings are not to be used for recording 
      the progress of a commissioning?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P6
intents.question:
When removing an Irregular adjustment (Red Ink - modified drawings), 

      the removal will be actions in BLUE?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P7
intents.question:
The drawing Alteration colours: 

      1st - RED 
      2nd - GREEN 
      3rd - BLUE 
      4th - ORANGE 
      5th - PURPLE 
      6th - BROWN?

intents.name: Cable Test1 P8
intents.question:
S2530 Alteration removal will be actioned in BLUE, 
      if BLUE not available then next colour ORANGE is used, or PURPLE, or BROWN, etc?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q1
intents.question: Correlation is a Design Activity the term meaning to carry out a survey with varying scope?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q2
intents.question:
Correlation includes: 

      Profiling 
      Wire Count 
      Continuity Test 
      Hand Trace - Hand trace also Verification)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q3
intents.question:
Correlation (PROFILING) - 

      Profiling is checking that the drawings 
      and physical site conditions are in agreement 
      (eg; Location, position, labeling, equipment type, Aspects, 
      Cable type, (Relay racks, Fuse bays, CTB, etc))?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q4
intents.question:
Correlation (WIRE COUNT) - 

      Instructing a test assistant to prove a physical wire count 
      correlates to the prints / circuit diagrams?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q5
intents.question:
Correlation (CONTINUITY TEST) - 

      Using a continuity tester (Bell), 
      Bell test each subject wire TWICE 
      and Check MARK continuity test (CT)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q6
intents.question: A Tone continuity tester can hightlight an unexpected wire resistance with a tone change?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Q7
intents.question:
Correlation (HAND TRACE) - 

      Ideally two hand tracers (one following the other) 
      will follow the wire end to end to positively prove it is to print / circuit drawing. 
      This will be Checked Marked 'HT'?

intents.name: Cable Test1 R1
intents.question: WIRE COUNT - Check Marks on wire counting prints are to be made with RED and GREEN ink ONLY, no other colours to be used?

intents.name: Cable Test1 R2
intents.question:
WIRE COUNT - RED and GREEN check marks should be identified by: 

      Signing and Dating the sheet?

intents.name: Cable Test1 R3
intents.question: WIRE COUNT - GREEN check marking ink denotes where the drawings and site conditions are in agreement?

intents.name: Cable Test1 R4
intents.question: WIRE COUNT - RED check marking ink denotes a discrepancy / anomaly between the drawings and site conditions?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S1
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      The scope of a correlation task should be set out by the AWC issuer?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S2
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      The scope of a correlation task should be denoted on the: 
      print 
      circuit diagram 
      drawing 

      by a RED box?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S3
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      The AWC issuer (Issue Certificate) should set out specific details (eg; Correlation to be undertaken; ie. Profile , WC, CT, HT)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S4
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      Where relay wire count schedules show circuit identities or destination of wires. 

      These should NOT be Checked Marked unless the AWC issuer has requested it?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S5
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      Circuit identities on fuse bay schedules are to ticked (in green) if fuse label and schedule agree?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S6
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      If circuit identities dont agree or no lable is fitting this should be shown as a discrepancy ' # '(in red)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 S7
intents.question:
Correlation scope - 

      Where a discrepancy / anomaly is identified during Verification Task , 
      this will be investigated and findings marked on the wire Count drawings in RED ink?

intents.name: Cable Test1 T1
intents.question:
New Works - 

      The scope of Functional testing (FT) Strap and Function can be reduce 
      with Verification (V) evidence. 

      This allows you to cut testing down to only one contact 
      either side of the circuit path under test?

intents.name: Cable Test1 T2
intents.question:
Older Assets - 

      The scope of Functional testing (FT) Strap 
      and Function can not be reduced without a full Hand trace (HT) 
      and Wire Count(WC) of the entire circuit pathunder test 
      and additional one contact away either side proved?

intents.name: Cable Test1 U1
intents.question:
Verification (Wire Proving) - 

      Wire Count (WC) 
      Continuity Test (CT) 
      Hand Trace (HT) will prove a wire?

intents.name: Cable Test1 U2
intents.question:
Verification (Wire Proving) - 

      Circuit architecture is as per design intention. 
      Correct wire to correct positions. 

      WC + CT = * 
      WC + HT = ** 
      WC + CT + HT = *** (best wire proving method)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 V1
intents.question:
Wire Count: 

      Ensuring the wire count is correct to print?

intents.name: Cable Test1 V2
intents.question:
Wire Count: 

      Ensuring the wires is correctly labelled?

intents.name: Cable Test1 V3
intents.question:
Wire Count: 

      Ensuring the wires is correctly beaded?

intents.name: Cable Test1 V4
intents.question:
Wire Count: 

      Ensuring the wires is correctly crimped?

intents.name: Cable Test1 V5
intents.question:
Wire Count: 

      Ensuring the wires has correct colour correlation to prints and drawings?

intents.name: Cable Test1 W1
intents.question:
Continuity Test: 

      Wire Off For Testing (WOFT) both ends 
      and Continuity test (BELL) wire twice?

intents.name: Cable Test1 W2
intents.question:
Hand Tracing: 

      Purest form of wire proving, 
      but also most intrusive 

      (may not be possible to do intrusive Hand Trace if there's a problem of wire degradation?

intents.name: Cable Test1 W3
intents.question:
Wire Off For Testing (WOFT) - It must be insulated!!! 

      (Clapham Junction Signal WF138 disaster 1988)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 X1
intents.question:
Verificaton Task - Parallel Paths 

      When a circuit has parallel paths it must be Hand Traced. 
      All parallel paths HT when there are more than two paths?

intents.name: Cable Test1 X2
intents.question:
Verificaton Task - Parallel Paths 

      Best practice is to start at the single wire end 
      and Hand Trace and Check Mark back to the first relay contact in the parallel path, 
      the first relay contact then doesn't need to be HT 
      and can just be wire counted 
      (e.g. two wires counted) 
      individual wires are not proved to their destinations?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Y1
intents.question:
Relay Labelling 

      If brackets are used e.g. (B)LJR the letter in brackets 
      This doesn't follow Signalling Nomenclature (Alphabet) 
      and can stand for anything e.g. Signalling Nomenclature B = Block, 
      but (B) in (B)LJR = Back (for Back Lock)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Y2
intents.question:
MOD States - 

      How thw MOD state box is read is a manufacturer standard and not LUL. 
      So you must find Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) manual to find out?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 A1
intents.question:
Wire Installation - 

      If a new wire is added to a commissioned asset / fuse bay 

      The new check Marked print must remain on site?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 A2
intents.question:
Wire Installation - 

      1. Run Wire  (tick) 

      2. Fit Labels  (L) 

      3. Continuity Test  (CT)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 A3
intents.question:
Wire Installation - 

      4. Crimp Both Ends  (P_). 

      Use Calibrated crimper. 
      A sample crimp (pre and post work) is to be made up on sample wire 

      Pre and Post work Wire crimp Samples will be: 
      labelled, 
      bagged 
      and kept as evidence for 3 months?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 A4
intents.question:
Wire Installation - 

      5. Terminate both ends  () 

      6. Independent wire count (|)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 A5
intents.question:
Wire Installation - Labels 

      A Label is made for each end of the wire. 

      A RED label is used for Recovery and De-commissioning?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B1
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Run a different colour to that used in that location. e.g. Yellow Wire / Cable?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B2
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Wire /  cable not to be properly dressed in - it should stand out that it is temporary?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B3
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Labels should be added?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B4
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Site prints must be red inked.?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B5
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Additional copies of red inked prints should be sent over to the DSIM and Control Room T.O.?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B6
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Labels should be writen with Red ink on both sides. 

      SIDE 1 - 
      Location in SER 
      Terminal Number 
      Print page?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 B7
intents.question:
When running a Temporary Wire / Cable for an Irregular Adjustment -  

      Labels should be writen with Red ink on both sides. 

      SIDE 2 - 
      Grade 
      Name of installer (DSIM) 
      maybe licence number 
      Date installed  
      AWC number 
      Signature?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C1
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Scope determine by DSIM / Issuing Authority?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C2
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Independent Pre Wire count to be carried out by 2nd competent person?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C3
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Hand Trace is the purest form of wire proving but also most intrusive and connot always be achieved?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C4
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Wire Count and Correlation to print; Correlate immediate location to everywhere the wire can reach?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C5
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Electrically Prove; 
      Ensure train movements has stopped. 
      Prove which element holds the B potental first by testing to Earth or known return Bus Bar?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C6
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Electrically Prove; 
      After proving B potential, Break Bx locally 
      (ensure , prove Nx remains) , 
      then test wire to host, 
      Break Nx locally (ensure , prove Bx remains)?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C7
Cable Test1 Z1 C8
Cable Test1 Z1 C9
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      Build Evidence; 

      i.e. A loose terminal / screw all other terminals populated, 
      are covers on other terminals?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C10
intents.question:
Wire Off - Proving 

      2nd Competent Person; 

      Inspect re-termination, 
      will carry out a full independent Post wire count?

intents.name: Cable Test1 Z1 C11
intents.question: return to main menu?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 A1
intents.question:
Do a Cable Verification Test - 

      if its new installation ensure an independent tester is used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 A2
intents.question:
The cable should be fully disconnected from all power supply. 

      Isolation methods such as: 
      Links out, 
      Wires Off, 
      MCB out, 
      Fuses removed isolation labelled and locked off?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 A3
intents.question: Cable Test Form F0684 required to record data?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B1
intents.question: Record Cable identity?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B2
intents.question: Record cable manufacturer and Drum Number?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B3
intents.question: Record cable from and to location?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B4
intents.question: Record Reason for cable test?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B5
intents.question:
Record cable length, 
      No. of joints, 
      No. of cores 
      and cable size 

      (e.g 19 core / 75 mm)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 B6
intents.question: Record weather conditions?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 C1
intents.question: Test Assistant will be at another location; (e.g.  a kiosk)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 C2
intents.question: Mobile/Radio comms required between tester and Test Assistant?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 C3
intents.question:
Identify correct meter to use for required testing: 

      AVO, 
      Multimeter, 
      Megger (Insulation Resistance Tester), 
      Optical)/Time Domain Reflectometer (TDR)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 D1
intents.question: Record AVO multimeter/Megger TDR type, serial No. and calibration date?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 D2
intents.question: Record meter Test Voltage setting (e.g. 250V)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 E1
intents.question: Test the Meter and confirm its working?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 E2
intents.question: Confirms meter test leads is plugged in correctly?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 E3
intents.question:
Confirm meter is in the correct settings, 

      note that fluke and Meggars have a maximum resistance reading eg 220M Ohms, 
      (AVO have max  infinty but on 1000M Ohms will be accepted, not  ) 

      Therefore the true value of the resistance is not being shown in the meter. 
      So readings will be 0 Ohms (short circuit) or 220M Ohms (open circuit)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 E4
intents.question: Test meter leads for continuity (Bell test)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 F1
intents.question: Record loop straps Serial Number?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 F2
intents.question: Continuity bell test Loop Straps?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 F3
intents.question: Adjust blue AVO meter (if used) to Zero meter marker?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 G1
intents.question: Write the cable verification equation down?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 G2
intents.question:
Core Equation 

      C = Core and L = Loop Resistance  


      L1 = C1 +C3 
      L2 = C1+C2 
      L3 = C2+C3?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 G3
intents.question:
Core Equation 

      (L1+L2-L3)/2 = Loop Resistance (reference test core)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 G4
intents.question:
The Loop Resistance (reference test core)results 
      will be used to minus it from each core resistance tested?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H1
intents.question: If reference core 1 , 2 , or 3 is faulty. Then use core 17 , 18 and 19 instead?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H2
intents.question: Tester put meter on C1 and C3?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H3

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H4
intents.question: Record results (e.g. L1 =  4.3  Ohms)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H5

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H6
intents.question: Tester remove meter from C1 and C3?

intents.question: Tester put meter on C1 and C2?

intents.question: Tester ask Test Assistant to remove strap on c2 and c3?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 H16
intents.question: Tester remove meter from C2 and C3?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 I1
intents.question:
Using test results ((L1+L2) - L3) / 2 = calculate Loop resistance 


      ((4.3 + 3.6) - 5.1) / 2 = 1.4  Ohms?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 I2
intents.question:
Now start again from C1 to C2 
      and deduct the loop resistance (e.g. 1.4  Ohms) from each test result?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K1
intents.question: Next test requires a Insulation Resistance Tester aka MEGGER and a Spider (Bunch / Wig) wire test kit?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K2
intents.question:
The test will check individual cores to all cores 
      to see if any core is connected to something (short/earth/partial)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K3
intents.question:
Use a Multimeter to continuity (Bell) test the Spider (Bunch / Wig) wires, 
      ensure all individual legs are ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K4
intents.question: Attach the spider to C1 to C19 with spare legs clipped on empty terminals for safety?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K5
intents.question:
Before using the Insulation Resistance Tester (MEGGER), 

      it will require Open Circuit test. 

      Set Megger to 250V (for Bx100) and press test button, 
      observe open circuit reading 
      and tone (high long tone)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K6
intents.question:
Connect the Spider (meter leg) to the Megger, so that a Short Circuit test can be done. 
      Use one of the Spider spare legs clipped on empty terminals to do test, with Megger test lead?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K
intents.question:
The Megger set to 250V (for Bx100) 
      (Megger should be set at least double circuit operating voltage 
      or what is required in documentation) 

      and press test button, observe short circuit reading. 
      Should get a flat tone (lower short tone)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 K8
intents.question:
Before using the Insulation Resistance Tester (MEGGER), 

      touch test leads to earth to discipate any residual voltage?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 L1
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester put Megger on C1 to every wire in cable (C2 to C19) using Spider (Bunch / Wig), ensure spider not on C1?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 L2
intents.question:

      A good reading is - Open circuit reading, long high tone, means C1 to all wires in cable is ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 L3
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      if results is Short Circuit, short flat tone - fault found , Escalate. 

      Cable can not be used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 B3
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      if results is Short Circuit, short flat tone - fault found , Escalate. 

      Cable can not be used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 B4
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester remove Megger on C16, Core 16 megger test complete, Core 16 is confirmed ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 C1
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester put Megger on C17 to every wire in cable 
      (C1 - C11, C14, C15, C16 is confirmed ok, C12 and C13 failing) 
      using Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C18 - C19 

      Ensure unused legs is stowed away safely and spider not on C17?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 C2
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      A good reading is - Open circuit reading, long high tone, means C17 is ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 C3
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      if results is Short Circuit, short flat tone - fault found , Escalate. 

      Cable can not be used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 C4
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester remove Megger on C17, Core 17 megger test complete, Core 17 is confirmed ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 D1
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester put Megger on C18 to every wire in cable 
      (C1 - C11, C14, C15, C16, C17 is confirmed ok, C12 and C13 failing) 
      using Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C19 

      Ensure unused legs is stowed away safely and spider not on C18?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 D2
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      A good reading is - Open circuit reading, long high tone, means C18 is ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 D3
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      if results is Short Circuit, short flat tone - fault found , Escalate. 

      Cable can not be used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 D4
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester remove Megger on C18, Core 18 megger test complete, Core 18 is confirmed ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 E1
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester put Megger on C19 to every wire in cable 
      (C1 - C11, C14 - C18 is confirmed ok, C12 and C13 failing) 
      using Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C19 

      Ensure unused legs is stowed away safely and spider not on C19?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 E2
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      A good reading is - Open circuit reading, long high tone, means C19 is ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 E3
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      if results is Short Circuit, short flat tone - fault found , Escalate. 

      Cable can not be used?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 E4
intents.question:
Spider Bunch test: 

      Tester remove Megger on C19, Core 19 megger test complete, Core 19 is confirmed ok?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 F1
intents.question:
To confirmed that core 12 and 13 are connected. 

      Use a Multimeter on  Ohms range and do a continuity check?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 F2
intents.question: Continuity check confirms Core 12 and Core 13 are interconnected?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G1
intents.question:
All cores to Earth with Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C1 to C19 

      using Insulation Resistance tester (Megger)?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G2
intents.question: All cores to Earth using Spider found a earth fault is present?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G3
intents.question:
Tester must test all cores to Earth 

      removing one Spider leg at a time 

      until earth fault clears?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G4
intents.question:
All cores to Earth with Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C2 to C19, 

      remove one spider leg at a time C2 - C19  connected, 

      then do Insulation Resistance test (Megger) to earth, 

      fault still on?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G5
intents.question:
All cores to Earth with Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C3 to C19 

       Spider leg being removed one by one and Megger tested. 

       Found earth and still showing Earth by giving flat reading 

       Fault still on?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G6
intents.question:
All cores to Earth with Spider (Bunch / Wig) on C4 to C19 

       Spider leg being removed one by one and Megger tested. 

       Earth fault clears when C4 removed?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G7
intents.question: Re-apply C4 and confirm Earth fault comes back on?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G8
intents.question: Remove C4 and confirm Earth fault clears, core 4 is the earth fault?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 G9
intents.question:
If there was another earth fault it would of been detected  
       by earlier inter-action test. 
       The inter-action test would of detected two earths faults?

intents.name: Cable Verification1 Z1 Z1 H1
intents.question: Verification testing is complete?

      Put all relays are in 
      Put all mcb in to power up circuit 

      Then the Function tester will put the circuit to work?

intents.name: Correlation1 A1
intents.question: Start Correlation (Verification) of signalling circuit?

intents.name: Correlation1 A1
intents.question:
Correlations is Verification 
      and should be recording in green pen colour 
      for check marking, and red to hashtag an issue?

intents.name: Correlation1 A2
intents.question:
It is important the tester to confirm relay locations (rack row position) 

      so that Test Assitance can be instructed to go to locations 
      and then the relay name can be confirmed 


      Recommend tester write down
      (in testers colours eg purple) 
      the relay positions in prints beforhand?

intents.name: Correlation1 B1
intents.question: The Tester needs minimum of 2 Test Assistant (TA1 and TA2) or more?

intents.name: Correlation1 B2
intents.question: Test assitants needs to have a AVO meter for continuity testing, Belling out?

intents.name: Correlation1 B3
intents.question:
Check meter is calibrated and leads ok, Test AVO meter. 

      Is meter working?

intents.name: Correlation1 B4
intents.question:
Ensure all MCBs or Fuses in circuit is removed, 

      Put meter on voltage setting and test mcb internal 100V, 

      remove mcb and observe 0V confirming isolation?

intents.name: Correlation1 B5
intents.question: Ensure all relays or loads (i.e. lamps, transformers) in circuit is removed?

intents.name: Correlation1 B6
intents.question:
The high level correlation procedure is as follows: 

      WOFT one end (if relay lids NOT lifted), 
      WOFT other end (if relay lids NOT lifted), 

      Bell it, 
      bell off 'C', 
      bell on, 
      bell off 'T', 

      Wire back on, 
      Terminated, 
      Wire counted, 
      TA swap over positions, 

      Wire counted again, 

      Check mark '|'?

intents.name: Correlation1 B7
intents.question:
Correlation requires wires off for testing, countinuity testing and wire count. 

      Are you lifting relay lids?

intents.name: Correlation1 B8
intents.question:
Note: If lifting relay lids / Q relay removed, 

      the WOFT (wire off for testing) process will be skipped?

intents.name: Correlation1 C1
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1 - go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 1?

intents.name: Correlation1 C2
intents.question: Test Assistant 1:  Go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 1?

intents.name: Correlation1 C3
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1,  confirm relay name?

intents.name: Correlation1 C4
intents.question: Test Assistant 1: confirm relay name (eg. BP TR)?

intents.name: Correlation1 C5
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1,  confirm 2 Front - wire count?

intents.name: Correlation1 C6
intents.question: Test Assistant 1: confirm relay BP TR 2 Front wire count?

intents.name: Correlation1 C7
intents.question: Test Assistant 1:  2F has 1 wire beaded (labelled) terminated on the nut?

intents.name: Correlation1 C8
intents.question:
Test Assistant 1:  Relay lids have been lifted / Q relay removed, 

      or Proceed to WOFT (wire off for testing)?

intents.name: Correlation1 D1
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1 - can I have WOFT (wire off for testing) ?

intents.name: Correlation1 D2
intents.question:
Tester: may also need insulating, 

      if Test Assistant is not immediate testing it?

intents.name: Correlation1 D3
intents.question: Test Assistant 1: wire off on Rack 11, Row 8, position 1  2 Front  and insulated?

intents.name: Correlation1 D4
intents.question: Test Assistant 1: confirm relay (eg. BP TR), contact 2 Front,  one wire WOFT?

intents.name: Correlation1 D5
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark by writing 'WOFT' in prints?

intents.name: Correlation1 E1
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2 - go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 2?

intents.name: Correlation1 E2
intents.question: Test Assistant 2:  Go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 2?

intents.name: Correlation1 E3
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2,  confirm relay name?

intents.name: Correlation1 E4
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: confirm relay name (eg. BR TR)?

intents.name: Correlation1 E5
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2,  confirm 2 Armature - wire count?

intents.name: Correlation1 E6
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: confirm relay BR TR 2 Armature  wire count?

intents.name: Correlation1 E7
intents.question: Test Assistant 2:  2A has 1 wire beaded (labelled) terminated on the nut?

intents.name: Correlation1 E8
intents.question:
Test Assistant 1:  Relay lids have been lifted / Q relay removed, 

      or Proceed to WOFT (wire off for testing)?

intents.name: Correlation1 F1
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2 - can I have at that wire WOFT?

intents.name: Correlation1 F2
intents.question: Tester: WOFT  (wire off for testing ) and insulated?

intents.name: Correlation1 F3
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: wire off on Rack 11, Row 8, position 2, 2A and insulated?

intents.name: Correlation1 F4
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: confirm relay (eg. BR TR), contact 2 Armature,  one wire WOFT?

intents.name: Correlation1 F5
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark by writing WOFT in prints?

intents.name: Correlation1 G1
intents.question:
Tester: ask Test Assistant 1 and 2 - Bell ON (Continuity test) on your wire off, 

      or on wire terminal (if relay lid is lifted or Q relay removed)?

intents.name: Correlation1 G2
intents.question: Test Assistant 1 and 2: Bell ON?

intents.name: Correlation1 G3
intents.question:
Tester: Bell OFF, on your wire off, 

      or on wire terminal (if relay lid is lifted or Q relay removed)?

intents.name: Correlation1 G4
intents.question: Test Assistant 1 and 2: Bell OFF?

intents.name: Correlation1 G5
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark C?

intents.name: Correlation1 G6
intents.question:
Tester: ask Test Assistant 1 and 2 - Bell ON (Continuity test) on your wire off, 

      or on wire terminal (if relay lid is lifted or Q relay removed)?

intents.name: Correlation1 G7
intents.question: Test Assistant 1 and 2: Bell ON?

intents.name: Correlation1 G8
intents.question:
Tester: Bell OFF, on your wire off, 

      or on wire terminal (if relay lid is lifted or Q relay removed)?

intents.name: Correlation1 G9
intents.question: Test Assistant 1 and 2: Bell OFF?

intents.name: Correlation1 G10
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark T?

intents.name: Correlation1 G11
intents.question:
Relay lid been lifted  / Q relay removed, 
      then next step re-terminate WOFT wires not required. 

      or continue to re-terminate wires that's been WOFT?

intents.name: Correlation1 H1
intents.question: Tester: Return wire off, back on, on Rack 11, Row 8, position 1 , 2 Front ?

intents.name: Correlation1 H2
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1 - can I have that wire off re-terminated back on?

intents.name: Correlation1 H3
intents.question: Tester: wire off is return back, wire ON, Rack 11, Row 8, position 1  2 Front ?

intents.name: Correlation1 H4
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: confirm relay name (eg. BP TR) 2 Front?

intents.name: Correlation1 H5
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark by ticking WOFT in prints?

intents.name: Correlation1 I1
intents.question: Tester: Return wire off, back on, on Rack 11, Row 8, position 2 , 2 Armature?

intents.name: Correlation1 I2
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2 - can I have that wire off re-terminated back on ?

intents.name: Correlation1 I3

intents.name: Correlation1 I5
intents.question: Tester: Check Mark by ticking WOFT in prints ?

intents.question: Tester:  go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 2?

intents.name: Correlation1 J3
intents.question: Test Assistant 1:  Go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 2?

intents.name: Correlation1 J4
intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 1,  confirm relay name?

intents.name: Correlation1 K2
intents.question: Tester:  go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 1?

intents.name: Correlation1 K3
intents.question: Test Assistant 2:  Go to Rack 11, Row 8, position 1?

intents.question: Tester: ask Test Assistant 2,  confirm relay name?

intents.name: Correlation1 K7
intents.question: Test Assistant 2: confirm relay BR TR 2 Front wire count?

intents.name: Correlation1 K8
intents.question: Test Assistant 2:  2F has 1 wire beaded (labelled) terminated on the nut?

intents.name: Correlation1 K9
intents.question: Tester: Check Marks | Wire count, on Rack 11, Row 8, position 1, 2F wire?

intents.name: Correlation1 L1
intents.question: correlate another wire?
